message+desc:
The Japanese summer begins in June with a three to four week rainy season.
Do you feel gloomy on rainy day?

In Japan, people sometimes make a ‚ÄúTeru-Teru Bouzu‚Äù to pray for a sunny weather.
This is a little handmade doll made of white paper or cloth hanging outside of the window.
During rainy season, you can enjoy lovely hydrangeas flowers.
There are so many nice places for admiring hydrangeas and today's photo is Hasedera Temple in Kamakura City, Kanagawa Prefecture.

Enjoy rainy season!

Related Information;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/shritemp/hasedera_kanagawa.html
http://www.hasedera.jp/en/
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1404_umbrella.html
comments: Even rainy days r beautiful days in Japan...$$Hasedera is a great place to visit. In the novel, Lost in Tokyo by Jenny Lynne, the characters hike to the temple via a dirt trail. That's exactly what I did when I visited. It was a highlight of my trip. http://mydreamcametrue.com/hasedera$$Summer time...."ajisaii" are beginning to bloom...$$I guess we're talking "official" rainy season, not just that it rains all the time till late August... lol$$l love hydrageas ,but feel gloomy on rainy day.$$In Riversdale Rd in suburban Melbourne there is a florist called: The Lone Hydrangea$$I think all Californians need to make a "Teru Teru Bouzu" so we get more ‚òîÔ∏è!!$$oh, i hear it again. it remembers me when i learned all abov japan. i feel glad again :)$$My kimekomi teacher makes these all the time =)

message+desc:
You can now eat LIVE OCTOPUS in Singapore.Situated 5 minutes away from Tanjong Pagar MRT, Bukang Tuna is easy to find. Once you step in, be wowed by tanks of live seafood lining the entrance. On top of live octopuses, there are other Korean delicacies here so don't worry if you're afraid of the wriggling tentacles!

Read all about our experience here: 
http://eatbook.sg/korean-live-octopus/

Follow Eatbook.sg for more food videos like this!

FYI: Once the head of the Octopus has been cut, it is no longer alive - this is indentical to the way other animals are prepared for consumption. The tentacles are not alive and their movement is due to nerves, like the ones in a lizard's tail when it drops. 

Model: Kaiying Liu

Pity the poor creature.$$Deon Tan you can have your fill of the live octopus in Singapore, don't need to go south Korea alr hahaha$$Kyusang Shim, Korean wave is too strong! Now we can have live octopus in Singapore and it's very near to SG office.$$Peter Jaron you can eat this in SG$$Omg omg omg bring me to eat octopus Annie Park$$Yong Ber lets go eat this! nice!$$I would be fine with it IF they chop the brain off first.$$May Oo want to go makan here soon?$$Chu Lin you can re live your holiday again HAHA$$And this is not cruelty to animals ?$$Jasmine Torres oh ano game?! Hahaha$$Lihao Ng omg shall we try$$Marc Clap they shld have had it earlier, so we can try all the weird stuff tgt! hahhaa$$Yvette Lau omg. We must go there!! Live octopus!!!!

message+desc:
The Tenjin Festival will be held in Osaka on July 24 and 25.
The festival is one of the three largest festivals in Japan and has a history of more than 1000 years. You could enjoy watching the parade by 3000 people dressed up in various costumes through the town. Also, it has a boat festival that about 100 boats going up and down the river and 5000 fireworks are set off in the night sky.
You will enjoy the traditional atmosphere of the festival, so check out the event! ! Photo courtesy: Osaka Convention & Tourism Bureau
More details: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/event/traditionalevents/a37_fes_tenjin.html
comments: Never heard about that festival, thank you for sharing!

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Puerto Galera, Mindoro

What is it like?
Puerto Galera is known for its parties on White Beach, but you can always find a quiet spot at Sabang or Muelle Beach.

How to get there: 
Take a bus to Batangas port from Cubao or Pasay.

Then take a boat bound for Balatero, Sabang or Muelle Port.

Fun Fact: 
A study by the University of the Philippines in the 1980s found that Puerto Galera has one of the greatest diversities of marine life in the world.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Denise Tolentino

message+desc:
Thankfully, this has article has a positive conclusion. Malaysian/Singaporean YouTubers do a blind taste test and they couldn't tell which country the food was from!

"Perhaps we should focus on what we have in common -- Singaporeans and Malaysians are united by a common love for food."

Let's just appreciate each other's food okay!The long-standing debate has been reignited: Whose food is better, Malaysia's or Singapore's?

Some Malaysians online have said their food is better, and slammed a few classic Singapore dishes. This won't end well...

https://mustsharenews.com/malaysia-singapore-food/
comments:
So if Singapore's food is nicer, does that increase our GDP? So if Malaysia's food is nicer, do their citizens become richer? There are lots of bigger problems to worry about than to squabble over something stupid like whose food is nicer üôÑ$$I'm a half&half, both SG n MY food carries their own charisma. Good in their ways.

Even among Malaysians, coming from different states can have different tastebuds. 

Some prefer this, some prefer that.

Having said so, I never wan to order kway teow soup wen in SG. Too bland for me. But I can have kway teow soup in Penang everyday whenever I'm there. My last trip I even lug in 3 kg of kway teow from Penang wet market before my flight home to SG.$$It comes down to the fact that Malaysia gives you more bang for your buck. It can't be helped with their currency crashing past 3 to 1, they are just much better in value. Skill aside, for the same price, the portions are better, the materials used are better. We can't compete with the cheap ringgit nor should we really want to.$$Got nothing to do with money or the exchange rate. I'm Singaporean born and bred but having lived in Malaysia for 13 years, nothing compares to Malaysian food hands down. Mamak culture is amazing not just for the food but the company.$$'local food' wise, SG really out la. With the less salt less sugar less this and that health conscious shit. Tasteless AF. 
Well, some place do have nice crab beehoon, frog porridge and that's all. 
Wan tan mee, Char Kuey Teow, BKT Yada Yada all CMI. 
International food wise (hotel buffets, Japs, Kor) SG wins by light years even when compared with our capital KL. Honestly.$$Suggestion: Make 2 people eat only 1 of each version, all day every day, for a month. And then allow them to swap. Then ask again which is "better". üëç$$now herbal soup, bak kuet teh all taste like salt water. Lor Mee cooked by china cooks got smell no taste. chicken rice e rice so salty e meat very bland. if give me chance to try, i will try malaysia food. food cook by malaysian chinese cook is better. their taste and our very close.$$I love both versions of hokkien mee and bak ku teh. My most memorable chicken rice was 30 years ago at a restaurant in old Klang road. Didn't think it exist anymore.  Believe the secret is in the source of the chicken.$$Singapore better: chicken rice, kaya toast (because the price allows thicker butter), Chilli crab, noodle soup

Malaysia: everything else except the above$$The two countries were and still are tied by kinship and history and families values. Don't let the boundaries blur this valuable human comnection$$Wah. Countries so insecure in their culture they need to hold competitions to see which one is better.$$With more oil, more salt and more 'you don't know what', of course m'sia food are better taste.$$To all .be thank full that we have such good food in both state. Not like in some country where even  brinking water hard to get.$$Food is best only to you.  What I love may the thing you hate.$$Food taste like shit is because no one wants to learn how to cook..or they are not interested so ..what can you expect..$$Malaysia boleh and cheaper. Singapore now mostly PRC cooks behind cooking your Bak Chor mee and what's not.$$Because all our good food like Hokkien mee is at least 12 ringgit to them so they never eat before! Hahaha.$$no point to compare. more practical to compare local dishes with the same dish.$$Taste wise, for health sake, i would think sg is better. not to mention abt hygiene !$$Why bother who is better. Just continue to compete and make food even more amazing for everyone. Burp.....$$singapore food now mostly cooked by foreginers like chinese, korean, japanese food in food court now mostly cook by china ppl.$$Some people keep searching for cheaper deals, some people learn how to make more money. Personally I prefer the latter.$$I say Malaysian one good. Why? Cos my wallet says so. Low rates ma. Singapore one ex. One meal can eat 2-3 meals in jaybee. Anyone who know how to save will agree.$$Malaysian food is way better and cheaper

message+desc:
Kayangan Lake is probably up there in the list of the most frequented tourist spots in the country and I understand why. The stunning limestone cliffs and turquoise waters are stuff of dreams. 

We knew that the place would be packed when we visited Coron last April so in order to avoid the crowd and enjoy the quiet chirping of birds and a one of a kind sunrise, we arranged to come to the Lake at the earliest time possible which was 7am. 

We were extremely delighted to have the lake to ourselves for a good two hours. The tour groups started coming in throngs at around 9am and by then we were well on our way down, and on to our next destination.

Words and video by Christer Isulat
@filipino_flight_tales
comments:
Come and Visit Us ... Much More Fun in Cebu Philippines ... We are DELIGHTED to SERVE you with a ..... SMILE$$Yes Coron has so many beautiful tourist spots . I climbed that kayangan lake like three times already . Hope your well x$$There is much more to Coron than the lakes.. You can see this video the Underwater Amazement in the bay!

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Anilao, Batangas

What is it? 
You‚Äôll find endangered sea turtles in Philippine waters. Go for a dive in Anilao or Balicasag, Bohol to catch a glimpse of them by the dozen.

How to get there: 
Take a bus to Batangas from Cubao or Pasay.

Fun Fact: 
Sea turtles can live up to about 80 years.

Photo by/Caption by: 
Walt Stearns/Meggy De Guzman

Dosanseowon Confucian Academy, located in Andong, Gyeongbuk province, was built to admire and cherish the virtue of famous scholar Toegye Lee Hwang. Known for its beauty in autumn, its buildings are decorated neatly and simply, which properly reflects his attitude and personality of a scholar. For those of you who don't know, he is the face of the current 1,000 won note! :)

message+desc:
Situated in the heart of Serangoon is Singapore's FIRST hawker school for the disabled and disadvantaged called Dignity Kitchen.

Started in 2006, Dignity Kitchen caters to those facing physical, social, mental or intellectual challenges. They provide lessons and training that arms their beneficiaries with valuable skills such as cooking and baking in order to help them find employment. This year, they are selling a variety of mooncakes handmade by their beneficiaries in order to raise funds for their cause. You can pre-order their mooncakes here: http://dignitykitchen.sg/mooncake/

Find out our full coverage of Dignity Kitchen here: http://thesmartlocal.com/read/dignity-kitchen-mooncakes

Never want to miss a post by us again?
Like TheSmartLocal.com FB Page > Click on "Liked" and set Notifications to "All On"

Model: Adria Elysa Tham

message+desc:
Have you heard of Yosakoi Festival?
Yosakoi Festival is an exciting 4-day dance festival held every August.
The festival is held in the capital of Kochi Prefecture, Kochi City, in the south of Shikoku Island. 
More about Shikoku:„ÄÄhttp://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/rtg/pdf/pg-607.pdf„ÄÄ„ÄÄ
In Yosakoi Festival, 200 groups comprised of 20,000 dancers groove in the style of Yosakoi all over town. The whole city is filled with a feverish energy until sundown.
Each group is free to arrange their own style for the Yosakoi song and costumes. These styles often include traditional Japanese, rock, ‚ÄúKawaii‚Äù, and many more!
If you are interested in Yosakoi Festival, please ‚ÄúLike‚Äù this post!

Related Information;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/kochi/kochishi.html
http://www.pref.kochi.lg.jp/english/tourism-general.html„ÄÄ
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1106_awaodori.html

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Danao Park, Bohol

What is it like?
The Danao Adventure Park offers eco-adventure tourism lovers another face of Bohol. Some of the many varied activities include kayaking, river trekking, rappelling, rock climbing, and visits to cultural heritage sites.

How to get there: 
Fly from Manila to Tagbilaran.

Or take the Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry from Cebu to Tagbilaran.

Or take a boat from Cebu or any of the major cities in Mindanao to Tagbilaran.

Then take a bus or van to Danao.

Fun Fact: 
The zipline in Danao is the Philippines's longest and tallest, running half a kilometer from one mountain to another. Only for the most hardcore adventurers, the zipline has been dubbed the "sui-slide." It's certainly not for the faint of heart.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Rey Tiempo
comments: Beeh here. Tried zipline and bungee jump :)$$Yes.. The best ang the plunge kesa sa dahilayan challenge

http://www.slippersandshades.com/paguriran-lake-in-my-little-conquer/Posted in Adventure ‚Ä¢ Paguriran Island ‚Ä¢ Philippine Beaches ‚Ä¢ Philippine Islands ‚Ä¢ Philippine Lake ‚Ä¢ Philippine Travel ‚Ä¢ Sorsogon ‚Ä¢ VacationPaguriran Lake: In My Little ConquerMay 16, 2013By shadesandslippersComments: The nestled lagoon in the middle of an island, a natural sanctuary for giant seafa‚Ä¶
comments: it's not a lake it's part of a beach. nasa coastal area ito facing rapu-rapu island of albay. we were there last year. paguriran is an island beach resort.$$i took a lot of pictures of this plce$$The best and unique travel destination in Bacon...so awesome place. Welcome po!$$I agree, Paguriran is not a lake. The water is sea water. During low tide you can walk to reach the island, where there is a lagoon inside. But once the tide sets in, you need to ride a bangka and the lagoon would be part of the sea. Bacon, Sorsogon is my parents hometown and it's practically their backyard.üòä$$View of Paguriran Island from the beach

message+desc:
Where is it?
Bulabog Beach, Boracay

What is it?
Kiteboarders discovered the windy side of Boracay ten years ago. But this isn't the only place they flock to.  There are near-perfect wind conditions in provinces up north in Luzon, and in Palawan.

Fun Fact:
Kiteboarding is an extreme water sport that combines techniques from wakeboarding, windsurfing, surfing, paragliding and even gymnastics.

Photo taken from the Philippine Department of Tourism
comments: hope there will be more places for windsurfing and kiteboarding beside Boracay Bulabog Beach...may be at Bantayan Island...$$We stayed at Boracay two years ago...such a beautiful island!

message+desc:
Suzhou, a charming city renowned for its classical gardens, museums, and canal scenes, is a 25 minute train ride away from the bustling city of Shanghai.  

Pictured here is the meticulously groomed Humble Administrator's Garden.  Originally, the garden belonged to a former government servant, Wang Xianchen.  After he retired, he chose to live a humble life, gardening and planting trees and vegetables here.
comments: This garden seems to change with every step you take and that's in the design.$$I'd like to see it in person one of these days!

message+desc:
What is it like? 
Diving in the Philippines brings you close to colorful reefs covered with a wealth of plant life. Discover a variety of sea fans, corals, and giant sponges.

Fun Fact: 
For a totally different diving experience, you can go for muck diving in Dauin. Try spotting rare critters like the ghost pipefish, anemone crabs, and colorful cuttlefish.

Photo by/Author: 
Department of Tourism/Brandon Dollente

message+desc: Ever explored Hong Kong‚Äôs glorious outdoors? Share your favourite nature photos with #DiscoverHongKong and follow @DiscoverHongKong on Instagram to see more: http://bit.ly/1HjIj7v
comments:
Loved the Waterfalls Trail.  Worth doing the whole thing and seeing all of them, and spending a bit of time at the Monastery at the base to pay your respects.  This is only one of the highlights of my trip Sept. 2016.  Best thing about checking out all the waterfalls is that when you need to cool down, the options are endless.  Thank you Hong Kong <3  It is one of the many reasons you are my favourite travelling and hiking destination in the world.  I only hope that one day I will be able to complete all the hiking routes I have not yet done.  I also highly recommend the entire Lantau Trail (take 5 days, seriously, 4 days isn't enough, and if you have spare room for anything, make it water), and being able to see, and if you are lucky enough with time, to walk along the 8 Immortals.$$....was there in 1968.  I remember dining at a resteraunt up in the new territories and an Indian tailor shop on Nathan .... the floating sea food place, the ferry across... Victoria peak incline, and a pair of socks for $0.10....$$Tatianna Teanna Tang  I thought you might enjoy this. I've been a follower of this page for a while now. It features many nice places to see in Hong kong! Sometimes they have a contest where you can win - a trip to Hong kong!$$Loved living there but was on the mainland first in Kowloon then the New Territories remember Nathan Road well üíú$$I spent my 30s, 40s and a chunk of my 50s there. Amongst many challenges, I walked the Macklehose Trail past Lion Rock of which this is a photo. SHALOM.$$I was in HK for R&R in 1969. My brother-in-law and his friend took me bird hunting on an outlying island (no success). We had 12 gauge shotguns.$$I wish I could as the love of my life was born in Hong Kong and to see it with her is always a pleasure.
Now just depends if she wants me to see it with her?
That's a question only she can answer.$$I LOVE HongKong.... I was been there, and the country is very clean. To be in HongKong is such an experience that I will not forget.$$The only thing I found is it takes a wheelbarrow full of money to buy a loaf of bread$$I was there last 1996 to 1999, I'm working there in New Territory, as a Part time Job. I Remember that Place is so Beautiful.$$Very crowded - everywhere you turn you bump into people. Beautiful place! Great shopping.$$We went to Hong Kong it rained for the two days we were there xxx$$I loved Hong-Kong,  lived there as I child so many great memories, great food.....wish I could turn the clock back üòä$$Just got back from Hong Kong and they need a smile campaign. Many grouchy stressed out people$$I have visited Hong Kong 6 times and loved The Rugby Sevens. Wonderful Walking, Visits to nearby Islands by ferry and much more$$We have been to Hongkong two times already. Visiting again this last week February . It's cold there now$$This was where my dad was stationed when he was in the Royal Navy x I was born their in 71, I will get there one day üëç$$It's really a wonderful place, I missed the foods, the beautiful places, n shopping$$So if you like eating dogs and cats you will love hong Kong get it now$$Honkong is 1 place I would love to go my Dad was stationed there when he was in the Royal Navy an the Pictures he's got are just Amazing. xx$$I just got back from Hong Kong about a week ago and I found it to be a very beautiful city and very clean.$$Stay at the Mount Davis Hostel when on Hong Kong the view is better than this.$$Gaby Alex Carly .. 26 weeks and counting xx

Hakone is a popular destination not only for its scenic views of Mt. Fuji, but also for the many impressive art museums that can be found there. Museums in Hakone are filled with famous Japanese works of art, as well as unique exhibitions found nowhere else in the world!

Learn more: http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1702_museum.html
comments:
Definitely a favourite of mine, especially as it's so close to Tokyo it's great for a day-trip. Train in the morning, soak in the onsen and then a luxurious Odakyuu Romance Car back in the evening. message+desc: Special thanks to Calvin Soonzh for sharing this with us. :)Four days travelling around Pe g, Malaysia. I have experience something that I have not feel it for a long time. Something that most of us have probably forgotten how it feels like. It was the selflessness, the interaction human once have with each other. It was the deep sense of human touch. I bring this back home, make it into a travelogue video, and hope to share with everyone the experience I have, in this small town, Pe g. Hope everyone will like it. :)

message+desc:
Where is it?
Anilao, Batangas

What is it? 
Located in Southern Luzon, just a few hours from Metro Manila, Anilao is a popular weekend getaway for divers and underwater photographers. A few feet into the water and you can already see the exciting marine life that lies beneath!

Fun Fact:
There are thatched bamboo rafts, rustic cabins and picnic cabanas available for rent at the many local resorts that line the shore!

Photo by Elmer Yu

Oh I LOVE PHILIPPINES!!!$$Its More Fun in The Philippines$$Its more fun in the PHILIPPINES!$$best dive of my life in anilao$$yeah, Anilao Batangas.. <3 Batangas is popular with so many local resorts good places, nice for people who want to unwind and get relax.. Love that  place  Anilao.. Divers who want to get more experience by sighting underwater, surely gonna like this place.. <3

message+desc:
Today, we celebrate the Feast of the Black Nazarene. Every 9th of January, the life-sized figure of Christ is brought out of the Quiapo Church to the Quirino Grandstand and from there, it's carried through town back to the Church by barefooted devotees yelling "Viva Se√±or" while a huge crowd attempts to touch the statue.

An annual event that started back in 09 January 1787, the Traslacion, as it is commonly called, has become a sacred devotion for many Filipinos around the country, such that the entire procession could last for almost 24 hours.

The longest traslaci√≥n was recorded in 2012 which lasted 22 hours. In recent years, the procession has captured the attention of the international media for being one of the largest religious gatherings in the world.

Photo by Reuters photographer Ezra Acayan
comments:
We have been taught by the Roman Catholic Church that the images and icons used in the church are not actually ‚Äúworshiped‚Äù but are simply ‚Äúvisual aids‚Äù to worship.
Catholics use statues to recall the person depicted. 
Just as YOU looking at your loved ones picture.
the link between us and God is Faith.
To those who talk and think negatively about the #BlackNazarene
ask yourself.
How are you sure of what you believe in?
Religion is a never ending argument.
I am no saint. Im a sinner. but one thing everyone should practice #RESPECT #respectbegetsrespect
VIVA SENYOR NAZARENO!$$It's not about da image,is about a faith on there heart.pic show how Filipinos having strong faith to God Jesus$$Yung sinasabe na imahen or idol ang sinasamba namen mga Katoliko. Tanong ko lang? Bakit tinayo ang bantayog ni Rizal sa Luneta? Simple answer: to commemorate his act of heroism and for what he did for this country. Bakit tayo may imahe ng Poong Itim na Nazareno? To commemorate the suffering of Christ before He was nailed on the cross. Yung imahe nya na nagsusuffer, parang nakakarelate ang mga ordinaryong Pilipino na naghihirap, na manalig lang sa Diyos at giginhawa ang buhay nila. Kahit hindi pa nila nakakamtaman yung maginhawang buhay mas lalo tumitindi ang pananampalataya nila sa Panginoon. Please respect our faith as we respect yours. The Fiest of the Black Nazarene is way of showing what faith can do to ordinary people like me and every devotee of the " Itim na Nazareno ".$$Lord look not on their failure to serve you right,but forgive them & shows the right way to worship you in spirit & in truth$$Images and names of Jesus are all representations of many remarkable stages of HIS life. And so are the images and names of Mary and the saints. All created to remind us all of something important in line with the bible. Faith is what drives people to touch and kiss them. I am a Catholic, i used to when I was a kid. I realized, people who kiss and touch these images are driven by faith (either to ask for something and to express gratitude), which Priests and Bishops have no control of. I believe, we all have different means and ways of expressing our faith. No one can say which one is right or wrong. Only God can judge us all.

And i dont ask people to believe me or any of us. We and all the followers of the other religions are being judged, anyway. But keep in mind, we all have our own ways and rights practicing our faith. 

If one speaks on behalf of the bible then he she it they must exhibit that respect learnt from it.$$God is Spirit and those who worship Him must worship Him in Spirit and in truth.  How can an idol or graven image create heaven and earth.  Graven image has ear but can not hear. Has eyes but can not see has lips but can not speak has feet but can not walk. True God is mighty, creator  of the universe , mountains bow down and the sea will roar at the sound of His name. Jesus Christ the second God of the Trinity.$$Rather than to judge the Nazarene devotees (and the Roman Catholic Church as a whole), it is better to know and understand the story and heart of each person. Know the facts, ask the devotees themselves, try to put yourselves in their shoes first.

His Eminence Luis Antonio Cardinal Tagle shared wonderful insights regarding this. Please take time to read. God bless us all! 

http://www.cbcpnews.com/cbcpnews/?p=70617$$WILD and MISTAKEN ANALOGY.

I was surprised to see on my newsfeed two pictures. Picture of the golden calf being worshipped by the Israelites with a caption ‚ÄúNOON‚Äù. The other is a picture of the itim na Poong Nazareno being carried and held in procession by the devotees with a caption ‚ÄúNGAYON‚Äù.

While the one who posted it was giving a caution that the devotees of today or even the Catholic Church herself of committing the same mistake of worshipping an idol, it does try to make an analogy, i.e. they denote the same context. The innocent, ignorant, and uncritical viewer might make a quick conclusion and like, share, and make a comment of approval on it.

Regarding that post, I offer these nuances;

1. We, Catholics, had always been proclaiming that we do not worship images. When we use images, we satisfy our human need to see and to feel our God and saints by representing them. There is no way we will entrust our life and salvation to a piece of wood or any man made images.
2. While our actions maybe misinterpreted, what counts are what we stand for. The homily of His Eminence Cardinal Tagle in the fiesta mass early this morning responds partly to this. The dire need of the devotees make them commit some acts which maybe bordering or even tantamount to idolatry yet, deep inside, it is actually faith of a different approach but deep and meaningful anyway.
3. There is a lot of and great difference between the golden calf and the image of the Black Nazarene who is Jesus Christ Himself. The golden calf was a pagan representation while the Black Nazarene is our representation of Jesus, the Second Person of the Trinity, our Messiah. The devotion is drawn not by the image itself but the one being represented by the image. Can those devotees still worship without the image? The answer is that it maybe difficult but they still can. But why make it difficult when it can be made easier by those representation images?
4. The dynamics of the use of symbols and signs in worship come to mind. As human beings, we live with signs and symbols. We cannot live without them. The caution is to focus on the meaning of symbols and the messages of the signs. The bible is a symbol of the compilation of the Word of God. The letters and the words in the bible are signs (images) of the messages. Thus, those religions who claim that they do not use ‚Äúimages‚Äù are either telling a lie or are being deceived. To worship the bible as a book and not its content and messages is also bordering on idolatry. Remember, the Word of God came before the ‚Äúbible‚Äù that we have now. Even without the ‚Äúbible‚Äù, the Word of God still exists.

We were cautioned by that post. I throw the same caution in easily accepting or being misled by it.

Happy feast of the Black Nazarene!
(Just saying.)$$If you have the faith... No need to have pictures or images... A prayer alone is enough to remember the Christ the Saviour...$$This is your society on religion. 

If a hundred people were regularly injured at an annual rock concert, that annual rock concert would be investigated and shut down. But somehow we've come to accept and expect that a hundred people are injured consistently every year at a religious event. On many years, a number of people are even trampled to death. We would even be surprised if this year there were no deaths. Are you on drugs or something? I'm not.$$Black Nazarene is not worship as God. He is like an idol for others to follow the way he was been. In Exodus 20, God made a covenant with Moses, explaining all the Ten Commandments. Now these stabbers rely on that from the Old Testament of the Prophets. These stabbers are like those meddling Hebrew teachers who scrutinized Jesus because of His teaching. They all ask questions trying to see the errors of His teaching but they failed. When Jesus started preaching, He enlighten this teachers including questions about marriage and the sabbath day. Now which teaching do you prefer, the Prophets or Jesus.? From Ten Commandments, Jesus made it two. So change was evident in the New Testament. Now why rely on the old scriptures? Jesus said "I am the Light, the Way, the Truth and the Life, none can pass to the Father without passing through Me." He also said, "Though they have eyes, they will not see; though they have ears, they will not hear." Now he is the blind and the deaf? May you be enlightened.$$Exodus 20:4-5. 4. Thou shalt not Make unto thee any graven Images, or  any likeness of any thing that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water. 5.  You shall not worship them or serve them, for I, the LORD your GOD. am a Jealous God,  visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the on the children, on the third and the fourth generations of those who hate Me.$$Isaiah 44:9-12 all who makes idols are nothing, and the things they treasure are worthless. Those who would speak up for them are blind; they are ignorant, to their own shame. Who shapes a god and cast an idol, which can profit nothing? People who do that will be put to shame; such craftsmen are only human beings. Let them all come together and take their stand; they will be brought down to terror amd shame. The blacksmith takes a tool and works with it in the coals; he shapes an idol with hammers, he forges it with the might of his arm. He gets hungry and loses his strength; he drinks no water and grows faint.

Habakkuk 2:18 of what value is an idol carved by craftsman? Or an image that teaches lies? For the one  who makes it trusts in his own creation; he makes idols that cannot speak.

John 4:24 God is spirit, and his worshipper must worship in the Spirit and in truth.

Would rather obey God or your religion?

Acts 5:29
29    Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.

God invented and man invented religion.

Christianity is not a religion. Christians must choose between obeying religion or obeying God's law or commandments.$$I'm a catholic and I respect other people's beliefs. But saying that we need saints and mother mary as channel for our prayer to reach God, I guess we don't understand faith that much. God is all around us, with us, closer than we can imagine, 24/7. All we need is to simply talk to him directly thru a prayer. That's it. The problem with most of us Catholics is that WE RARELY READ THE BIBLE. We just believe what others tell us about religion and christianity. If we read the Bible, we'd think twice about going to religious processions such as this. When was the last time you read the bible? üòÉ$$One last post. Catholic does not worship or idolize the statues and images you thought they have worshiped. The image or the statue is a representation or the reflection of the life of Christ or any other Saints, their passion or sacrifice. Something a lot of you would not understand. If you do not believe in the image of Jesus it is a blank space, nothing really, only a void. We were not born when Jesus walked among man, so when you pray how would you imagine Him? In the presence of the image you can figure Jesus passion and sacrifice. It is like this, If you did not believe in the Crucifix, then you did not believe in the sacrifice of Jesus and salvation. Upon the cross, His sinless body laid, he died carrying the weight of all the sinners, to save us all. Upon the cross, our selves are deemed by His sacrifice, a sacrifice for our Salvation. Our faith binds us directly to Him, and by the image/statue/crucifix or cross, we can clearly see Jesus, strengthening our prayer because as we close our eyes, we can see Him and feel His presence. Love the people around you and you'll recieve too. God's way is too complex none of us can reach, so for what He had installed for us, we'll never know. So live your own way. He knows everything, we don't. For whatever we do, judgement is always fair in the arms of the Saviour.$$Really incredible!!!
That's how Filipinos and many foreigners too fanatically join in venerating and processing this Black Nazarene .$$Please respect their faith,if you're not believing in image (statue) or if you are non catholic .You should give respect to catholic faith. Catholic believers not asking anybody to believe in statue or give you rosary or to invite you in the holy mass. So let the people pray and believe in any religion. #RESPECT #RESPECT #RESPECT$$For all of you who had bashed the Catholics. Here's something you might want to read to give you view of what we do. How our prayers are carried by Saints. Heres an example from the Virgin Mary. Here everything is explained and don't tell me Google texts are lies, well not all. And if you have more doubts, ask Vatican. http://www.theholyrosary.org/fatimaapparitions$$I was born and raised in Angeles city , Philippines till I left for Canada in 1974. We have a small church close to our house and there is the chapel call visitang Apu, there is our Black Nazareno lying there since the world war 2. People all over come and visit specially Fridays. As far as I can recall ,other Catholic Churches attempted to move the Black Nazareno but unable to. Now this church became a Shrine. All the remarks I have read so far make sense. Spirituality is a choice. Believe in faith or not.$$We respect your traditions and beliefs that's why for years, we are not complaining about it but when we gather in edsa to fight for our faith, most of you branded us as nuisance.may you have a peaceful and ZERO casualty celebration.
#respectbegetsrespect

message+desc:
Discover 12 reasons why more travelers are trekking to Cebu for more fun in 2015 -- and you should, too!

http://www.skyscanner.com.ph/news/12-reasons-visit-cebu?utm_source=facebook&utm_medium=social&utm_content=PH-sa-pd-reasons+visit+cebu-31+45-DNF&utm_campaign=ph-article&ksh_id=3b216b36-13a6-e708-22a3-00003e56ff9c&AssociateID=SOC_FCB_00065_00158Discover the top reasons travel junkies flock to the island of Cebu.
comments:
Many fall into a trap when visiting Cebu. Oftentimes, visitors get trapped in malls or in the four walls of their hotels and go home missing the real Cebu experience. The beauty of Cebu is far beyond what Cebu City is. The pristine beaches are a bus-ride away and some require crossing the seas to nearby islands. The luxury resorts in Metro Cebu may offer comfort but adventure is beyond the city. I think this is what makes Cebu an all-around island. It caters to any type of traveler - shiny malls for shopping, a vibrant night life for any type of party-goer, high-end resorts for those who have more to spend for picturesque selfies, highland adventure for those who want to take risks, crystal clear waters for the beach bums, spiritual journey to those who need some boost of faith, challenging mountains to conquer, a diverse marine life and more than anything a people ready to welcome any type of traveler from the world all over. All these in one island set Cebu apart from the rest.

To anyone visiting Cebu, get out of your hotel. Walk the city streets. Take the bus to its quaint towns. After all, Cebu isnt just a city. It's one hell of an island.$$Dont miss this 10 tourist spots in cebu too!
 http://touristspotsfinder.com/2015/01/top-10-tourist-spots-in-cebu/$$Yeah been there and got married there and wife is from there to, lovely place and the sites are so beautiful, recommend alegre beach resort north Cebu or towards the south to some lovely places...can't wait to go back there on holiday again...$$Bantayan island, Malapascua, Bohol, Panglau, Oslob, Moalboal... and waterfalls, hiking, fiestas, whalesharks, dolphins, red horse.  Get out of the City.$$Yes cebu Idd has a great natural beauty both above and below water$$Claire MF your beautiful place is mentioned. Seems like i must go there too.$$Cebu been there many times great place to visit as is Bohol.$$Beloved Hindsfeet Bluhbewui Chithhkaeyk Labs Nylirem

message+desc:
Where is it? 
University of the Philippines, Diliman, Quezon City

What is it like?
Sorbetes, the traditional ice cream in the Philippines, is commonly peddled by men called ‚Äúsorbeteros.‚Äù They push colorful carts and ring bells to signal their presence. The usual flavors include taro, cheese, and chocolate.

How to get there: 
Fly into Manila through one of more than 30 international airlines. You can also fly in from any major Philippine city.Or take a bus from any major city in Luzon.Or take a boat from any major Philippine port. Then take a taxi, jeepney or bus to Quezon City.

Fun Fact: 
Ice cream peddlers have become so popular in Filipino culture, that there's a popular song about them entitled ‚ÄúMamang Sorbetero‚Äù (Mister Ice Cream Man).

Photo by/Author: 
Rizza Garcia/Brandon Dollente
comments:
i am here maried to my lovely wife$$Mamang sorbetero , we love your ice cream$$My granddaughter is studying there now...UP Diliman :)$$Enjoyed seeing the colorful carts, and hearing the bell ring. Favorite ice cream sandwich in a bun yummy!$$Ian Jefferson Llanes Rockymore Please refrain from posting ads here to avoid being banned. Thank you.$$Love Philippine ice cream!!!! Ube and mango are the best!!!! And many more!!!!

message+desc:
Do you like theme parks? But you also like to chill and relax?
Here's the theme park called Oedo Onsen Monogatar in Odaiba, Tokyo, and this is an onsen themed facility!
Not only onsens you can enjoy, but you can go back in time and enjoy the atmosphere of the Edo period (1603-1867) of Japan.
Once you enter the facility, you choose your Yukata to become one of the Edo people, enjoy various kinds of onsens, eat some good foods, and rest at Tatami room.
You can also play games at street stalls (in the facility), so no worry for bringing your children!
When you visit Odaiba, you should definitely check it out because it‚Äôs fun just to be there!
Admission charge: 1980yen (900yen for children between 4 and 11)
For more about Odaiba: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/tokyo/odaiba.html
Hot springs easy to enjoy in Tokyo: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/exotic/onsen_ryokan/p6_13.html
comments: been there...amazing place!!!:-)$$This is a great place to go if you are in Tokyo and don't have time to go to a real onsen.

10 Super Secret Sides Of Singapore That 95% Of Locals Have No Clue About

message+desc: Celebrate the 117th Philippine Independence Day in Santa Barbara, Iloilo. The event will be held in the historic plaza where our flag was first raised outside Luzon in 1898. This year, President Benigno Aquino III will raise the flag in tribute to Iloilo‚Äôs role in sparking the revolution in the south. The vin d‚Äô honneur will take place in the newly-renovated capitol, happening for the first time outside Malacanang.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Batanes, Luzon

What is it like? 
The ten islands of Batanes are among the northernmost places in the Philippines. They have very unique topography, where green pastures merge with a contrasting white shoreline. Chadpidan Beach, Sabtang Beach and Nakabuang Beach are the most popular ones.

Fun Fact: 
The islands lie in a strait between the Philippines and Taiwan. Turn on a transistor radio and you'll pick up signals from Taiwanese radio stations!

Photo by/Author: 
Rommel Natanauan/Jao Bautista

Love  the Philippines  and it's kind people.$$yap philipines cool island and philipino girls so greedy$$Contact us for wholeday tour / affordable tourist boat rental or tour package (2N3D / 1N2D). Mobile no. Globe +63 916 7426796 or message us on facebook or instagram.

On the northern coast of Iloilo Province, town of Carles, Philippines a hidden paradise of what we know as Islas de Gigantes or Gigantes islands awaits all curious visitors, with powdery white sand beaches, crystal clear water and fresh seafoods. It‚Äôs very easy to get here and it will take you one to two hours to get to the island from mainland, but its all worth the trip. The island was named as such as it was believed that giants once lived here. Stay at least 3 days here to fully enjoy what the place has to offer.
To get here you have different options. If you‚Äôre flying from Manila you can travel via Iloilo Airport or Capiz Airport. From Roxas City, Capiz it‚Äôs only one to two hours away via Ceres Bus or van and from Iloilo City, Tagbak terminal it's only three to four hours away also via Ceres Bus or van.
Regardless of where you‚Äôre coming from as long as you reach Bancal Port in Carles. Bancal Port - Gigantes island route.

Tag your family and friends now! See you all here!

#VisitCarlesIloilo #ILoveCarles #ChooseGigantesIslandsPH #IslaDeGigantes #GigantesIsland #IslaGigantes

False: Stick to familiar menus. You can go native in between meals.

message+desc: ÏïàÎÖïÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî! Hello~! A fellow traveler needs our help! Please stop by and share some "Do's and Dont's" or any other tips for a solo traveler visiting Seoul for the first time. ^^
comments:
Careful when you are walking near any train stations during the rush hour, Seoulites are really fast on their feet and they stop for nothing! Not even a beg your pardon or sorry! Nothing negative, its just the way they are. :)$$With over 12 million residents, Seoul is a non-stop, fast-paced metropolitan area. Visitors are often surprised at the sights, sounds and energy that make this hustle and bustle city so special!$$Also, don't expect too many ready smiles. Its quite normal for Seoulites to look indifferent but then again, they do't mean any bad, its just the way things are. Once you know them they are real friendly and now that I'm not there, I miss my Korean friends terribly.$$Best currencies to carry with you for exchange  is the USD cos when I tried with my country's as well the sterling pound, the former was totally not accepted while the latter had only a few main banks that would exchange it.$$Im thinking in travelling with Euros. I hope it will be no problem to exchange...$$I hope that I visit Korea in the winter
i hope i hope i hope i hope
^^$$If you have something that you can't do or eat, it will be better if you can know a short explanation in korean..short one will do .. and try Seoul Tour bus .. it will cover most of the main attraction places... less worry to identify the subway line especially when you are alone!!$$Do Seoul City Tour Buses operate on sat & sun too ?$$Yes, it's closed every monday except when it's a holiday! Please check our website for more information on the city tour buses in Korea. 
http://english.visitkorea.or.kr/enu/TR/TR_EN_5_5_1.jsp$$Yeah, Im definitely planning to carry some USD with me. This is so helpful. message+desc:
Nasi ambeng or Nasi ambang is a fragrant rice dish consists of white rice prepared with chicken curry or chicken cooked in soy sauce, vegetables, fried noodles, some salted fish, fried coconut flesh, and so on. It is cooked during important celebrations and served in a tray to be shared by four to five people.  

Come and experience the unique, communal dining style and delicious food of the Javanese-Malay people at the Nasi Ambang Carnival on 17 & 18 April at  Homestay Banghuris, Sg. Pelek, Sepang Selangor.

For places to eat Nasi ambang in Johor, see http://johorkaki.blogspot.sg/

#tmsingapore #myfest2015 #yof2015
comments: Love this food...must eat with dulang off four person eating together....dengan tangan :)

message+desc:
Where is it?
Boracay, Aklan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Caticlan. 

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan. 

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan.

What is it like?
When packing your bags for Boracay Island, shoes should be the least of your concerns. You'll be walking barefoot on the powder-fine sand most of the time. And sitting on it. And getting massages on it. You'll form quite an attachment to Boracay sand. Just please don't take any of it home! Leave the beach for others to enjoy.

Fun Fact:
Come dusk, young boys and girls take to the beach to begin sculpting impressive pieces of sand art. For a small fee, they can even personalize the sand art for you!

Photo by / Caption by:
Ryder Aquino / Nikki Golez
comments: nice  place  i be there  next month!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!$$I wish i could there..$$Boracay is nice, but far too commercialized for my liking. My experience there was nice. It is an enjoyable place, especially for the younger crowd! It clearly is a tropical paradise filled with natural beauty that rivals anything in the world.$$White Beach in Boracay is now included as one of the best beaches in the world, according to TripAdvisor, http://edition.cnn.com/2015/02/18/travel/tripadvisor-travelers-choice-best-beaches/index.html

message+desc:
[New Series] How To Talk To Random Strangers In Singapore And Make New Friends.

Here's something different for our readers. In Singapore, most of us go through our lives like drones, getting all our "skills" from textbooks. But we never pay attention to the skills that will truly help us in life. The ones that matter. Like making new friends, building relationships and pushing ourselves off that ledge of comfort that we desperately cling on to. We fear the unknown and unfamiliar.

So where do you start? That's why we decided to write this guide.

Go out there and start talking to people. Rake up some smiles, meet your new business partner, talk to that cute boy/girl in line, find out about a cool new bar and so much more. Remember the next time you hesitate about talking to someone interesting, you could be missing out on a whole lot of life.

Follow TheSmartLocal.com and never miss our best posts again.

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/strangers-singaporeIf you have no idea how to talk to that cute girl or guy on the MRT next to you fret not. This is the definitive guide on how to talk to strangers in Singapore.
comments:
Ice-breaker line
Me: "Hi, is the air fresher there?"
Girl: "Excuse me?"
Me: "Yeah, coz from here, your nose looks pretty 'stuck up'."
*exits quickily*

*troll.jpg*$$If u r rich.. handsome.. n in the club.. U Don have to.. just throw ur sport car key on the table.. ppl will start a conversation with u..$$Unless u are filthy rich & have many assets under ur name surely all strangers will flock to u no matter u are young or old , handsome/beautiful or ugly.$$there are many pretty girls  at the mrt station always trying to start a conversation with me, but very funny leh, they are all very concerned about my financial planning.... i wonder why.... hmmmmm$$here's my number, call me maybe?$$Augustine Seah some inspiration for ya bro$$Liew Jia Ming, Isaac Tan would start the conversation with heyyyyyyyyyy how's life?$$Edmund Qi Alvin Loke Kyd Songz Vincent Li Jet Eng ... Let's try this out... Make some friends, you know ;)

message+desc:
Visit the birthplace of many Japanese myths, Shimane prefecture‚Äôs Izumo City, and experience ancient Japanese culture and tradition firsthand!

Learn more: http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/special_aeon05.html
comments:
This is a very nice place it is very Áî∞Ëàé but beautiful the Izumo taisha is awesome and if you have a chance to stop by the beach (very near) there is a little shrine on a huge rock at the beach it is very unique, sea food and soba are super good and Matsue Castle is very nice not so big but very nice, and also there is a big lake between Izumo city and Matsue city... amazing place!!$$I visited Shimane prefecture in 2014, I reached the region in an unusual way for non-Japanese. Tourists mostly use the Shinkansen to go there. I took the JR bus at Hiroshima (also covered by the Japan Rail Pass) and we went through the mountains and beautiful landscapes you can't see with the train :-) Shimane is a very nice region:
- Izumo shrine
- Nima sand museum (I was apparently the first non-Japanese to visit this museum, they were a little bit surprised)
- Yunotsu town: a small fishermen town. I spent there one night in a nice Ryokan. Be there when the boats are coming back to harbour.
- Matsue castle 
- Yasugi art museum (and its wonderful Japanese gardens)

Shimane is not enough known by foreigners$$On my travel list for May 2016 together with the neighboring city of Matsue!$$any one can arrange invitation for me for visit japan...e-mail: srakibhassan@yahoo.com

message+desc:
No need to sit through a 24-hour plane ride to North America to experience a sled dog tour - you can now do it down under!

Located 3 hours away from Melbourne city lies Mt Buller - Victoria's largest ski resort which offers sled dog rides! The sled dog adventure kicks off with a 35 minute long meet-and-greet session with the Siberian Huskies followed by a 10 minute long thrilling ride round the snowy trails of Mt Buller.

Best part is, FlyScoot flies to Melbourne from just $193 now (as at 11th Nov)! http://www.flyscoot.com/en/travel-deals

Find out more in our guide to Mt Buller here: http://thesmartlocal.com/read/melbourne-husky-sled

message+desc: Let's not just enter quietly without a word.  Why don't we all introduce ourselves, what is your relationship with Korea?  My name is Marie, and I came here 4 years ago on a whim to teach English, fell in love with Korea and have been here since.  What about you?
comments:
I came here 4 months ago to stay with my husband who is Korean (i am British). It's my first time in Korea so I have lots to learn ^^;$$My name is Ethan. I live in a tiny apartment (I'm not complaining, it's free). I have lived here 11 months. I'm in love with Korean food and I really enjoy traveling the countryside every weekend. (Please don't tell my hagwon the part about traveling)$$Hi Amanda and Ethan!  Great to hear your stories.  Is it your first time in Korea, Amanda? 

Ethan, I'm glad to know you are having a lot of adventure on the weekends.  I was a teacher too when I first came here. It's important to have a passion, travel, photography, taekwondo, whatever it is, in order to have a happy experience teaching.  For me, it was traveling, trying out new food, and especially learning Korean that kept me energized. Do you take photos on your travels? What kind of Korean food is most appealing to you so far?

Marie

message+desc:
Are you looking for any fun things and memorable activities in Japan?
Participating in tea ceremony might be one of the pleasant options for you!
About tea ceremony: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/experience/f.html 
There are tours for taking part in a Japanese Tea Ceremony experience; 
http://japan-tours.jnto.go.jp/eng/index.php
http://japan-tours.jnto.go.jp/eng/index.php?sort=def&limit=20&page=2
comments:
I want to learn how to preform Tea Ceremony$$Tea ceremony,s..not my cup of tea ... cherry blossoms .....raw fish...surely there is more to Japan ...???$$In terms of traditional and uniquely Japanese activities, I think the most valuable experiences are the most common ones, like going to a bath house or a hot spring (onsen), and going to an izakaya with a group of people to drink, eat, and drink some more.$$My favorite sushi experiences are either going to a 'kaiten-zushi' which I call 'merry-go-round sushi' in English, or go to some small seaside town famous for its fish--because that's where the best sushi really is.$$the tea ceremony is interesting but tea needs some sewets$$My 'chawan' (tea bowl) was given to me by my roommate's mother during college, to thank me for setting up the apartment and putting all the bills in my name.  My roommates mother was a fifth level tea master and instructor in Kyoto, and her son (my roommate) was also very much into tea ceremony.  He said, "Even I don't have a chawan that nice!"

I really didn't know the difference until I was invited to a tea ceremony in Iwate and asked if I could bring my own chawan.  They made the same tea in mine as every other chawan, but they absolutely gawked at the tea in mine because it was much more beautiful and 'frothy.'  That's when I understood the difference.$$I enjoy the tea ceremony but not in a tourist setting$$Ha ha ha ! I'm so sorry but I had to laugh seeing cha no yu done with folding dinner trays and benches !  Cute ! The Japanese are so accommodating$$why  all of them  seem so lost?Everyone is looking at the other xDDDDDDD$$When you are in Kyoto, please visit us and I'd love to share the beauty of tea ceremony, on tatami:) We all speak fluent English and you can ask questions directly. www.tea-kyoto.com Thanks!

BounceOFF! Fiesta is here and it has transformed our Marina Bay area into a massive 40,000sqm play space suitable for all ages.
 
Enjoy a fun day out with more than 30 Inflatable rides available, including S.E.A's largest inflatable bouncer standing at 16M. For the daredevils, get your adrenaline pumping by free falling from the 10m Blobber S.E.A's tallest blob jump thanks to DBS.
 
What's more, DBS / POSB cardholders enjoy a special deal whereby they get a One Day Unlimited Fiesta Play Pass @ only $48 (U.P. $128). Promotion is valid for online and on-site ticketing from 22nd December ‚Äì 26th December.

message+desc:
Kodiakanal - Old-world charm combined with nature's bounty

Kodaikanal, a charming hill station, stands amidst sylvan beauty on the southern crest of the upper Palani Hills near Madurai in Tamil Nadu. It is also referred to the princess of Hills and is located 2,133 m above sea level.

Kodaikanal is also well known for the Kurinji flower which blooms once in 12 years in December and covers the valley in a beautiful sea of blue. It last bloomed in 2006; the next bloom is expected in 2018.

- See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/kodiakanal
comments: I visited it .. such a beautiful like ooty

message+desc:
Have you ever soaked in ‚ÄúAshiyu,‚Äù means footbath?
‚ÄúAshiyu‚Äù is good for medicinal effects such as recovery from fatigue or mental and physical relaxation. It is increasing the number throughout Japan more and more.
Some places are free of charge and some are located at the train station.
When you travel in Japan and would like to go, why don‚Äôt you visit to the Tourist Information Center and ask the nearest one. Enjoy!

List of Tourist Information Offices: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/category/index.html?cat=tic
Related information: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/pdf/special/pg-809.pdf
comments: In United States people will put garbage inside as soon as it opens.  People here embarrass me.  I miss Japan alot.$$this show a class of culture$$Love the Japanese culture and approach to life/health$$I tryed it when I visited Arashiyama this summer... it was so comfortable and relaxing. One of the best thing that I tryed in Japan.

message+desc:
Enjoy exciting Tohoku Summer Festivals!

Sendai Tanabata Festival is one of the three major festivals in the Tohoku region and it will be held from August 6th to 8th every year. During the festival, it would be nice to see the so many colorful Tanabata decorations various places in Sendai city. 
Additionally, on August 5th, fireworks is also held.

More information;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/festival/sendaitanabata.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/routes/g_route/golden_02.html
http://www.sentabi.jp/en/event/tanabata.html

message+desc:
Don‚Äôt you feel like to visit Asakusa this month?
Asakusa Sanja Festival is a Japanese traditional festival which is held in May every year. You can see many people carrying ‚ÄúMikoshi‚Äù, a portable shrine on their shoulders. It will be held May 16th to 18th this year, so let‚Äôs experience a Japanese culture in this best season!
Asakusa Sanja Matsuri: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/festival/asakusasanja.html
Asakusa Area: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/tokyo/asakusa.html
Events calendar in May:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/pdf/event/calendar_events_201405.pdf

message+desc:
15 Abandoned Places In Singapore That Were Left For Dead

If you're interested in exploring corners rich in history and ghostly tales, this list is for you. 

I wouldn't step into #14 alone!

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/abandoned-placesIf you\'re interested in exploring corners rich in history and ghostly tales, this list is for you. I wouldn\'t step into #14 alone!
comments:
Neo Tiew estate. I went there twice in my life. First time is when I was 15. Was there because of a taoism precession. The next time I was there when I was 22. It was for military training. 

When I went back for military training. I felt so at home at first because the place is familiar to me. However I felt chill down my spine during the mid day, 12pm, for no reason. When I left the place at 4pm. I feel that there are a lot of eyes looking at us leaving.

message+desc:
Singapore Hello Kitty Cafe is now OPEN at Changi Airport Terminal 3!

The TSL team went down for a first look. Here's what to expect! Orchid Garden is the world's first 24 hour Hello Kitty cafe. And it looks nothing like what you'll find in an airport.

MORE PICTURES and our full review on Eatbook.sg here.
http://eatbook.sg/hello-kitty-orchid-garden/

Grand Opening Date: 12th May 2016
Address: Changi Airport Terminal 3 #01-22

Follow TheSmartLocal.com for more videos like this!

Verdict:
While the food is nothing to rave about, it‚Äôs passable considering people generally visit character cafes for the ambience and aesthetic, rather than to indulge in a gastronomic experience. We fell in love with the beautiful decor and how its open 24 hours a day. Imagine bringing your partner here for a surprise midnight tea date! 

Hello Kitty Orchid Garden succeeds in creating a unique experience for all Hello Kitty fans, both local or overseas. 

Review: Alicia Teng
Model: Debbie Michelle Aurelia

message+desc:
Hong Kong Now
Murray House wasn‚Äôt always in Stanley. Anyone know where it originally stood?

Murray House was originally located in Central. In 1982, it was transplanted to its current site in Stanley. http://bit.ly/1bHVj1r
comments:
Murray House was originally located in Central. In 1982, it was transplanted to its current site in Stanley. http://bit.ly/1bHVj1r$$Murray House was built in 1844 as officers' quarters of the Murray Barracks during the early years of British rule. It was named after Sir George Murray, the British Master-General of the Ordnance at the time of construction. The designer and constructor were Major Aldrich and Lieutenant Collinson of the Royal Engineers.In 1982$$I think it was first in Central (Murray barracks)$$Located in Central originally, which next to Bank of China building :))$$Yes..located at stanley..near by with a garden ...open hall and shops houses..souvenir shop....during weekend use to be family retreat..

History..during the Japanese time..as a temporary platform ..$$Central bank of china location$$Where Power Tools and Locomotives were invented?$$Can't believe it was only 8 days ago I was standing looking at that building - wish I was still there!$$Been there! message+desc:
Where is it? 
Tubbataha Reef, Palawan

What is it? 
Tubbataha Reef is the mecca of Philippine diving, and a superstar in the international diving scene. It's accessible only by live-aboard dive boats between the months of March and June. You have the chance to marvel at 11 species of sharks, over 600 species of fish, 360 species of coral, 12 kinds of whales and dolphins, and get this ‚Äî 10,000 hectares of reefs.

How to get there: 
Fly from Manila to Puerto Princesa, then take a live-aboard boat to Tubbataha.

Fun Fact:
Aside from being a marine sanctuary, Tubbataha is also renowned for being a bird sanctuary. A lighthouse islet, at the southern tip of the South Atoll, supports a large number of seabirds which nest there.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Donna Dimayuga
comments: Its my ultimate dream to viait tubbataha...$$Candies Davao please refer to our Social Media Guidelines to avoid getting banned from this page.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Makati City

What is it like? 
Makati City is one of the most urban cities in the Philippines, filled with tall office buildings, shopping centers, and entertainment hubs. There‚Äôs no place for boredom here. You‚Äôll always find it bustling with lights, sounds, and conversations.

How to get there: 
Fly into Manila through one of more than 30 international airlines. You can also fly in from any major Philippine city.                                        Or take a bus from any major city in Luzon.                                                Or take a boat from any major Philippine port.

Fun Fact: 
The city is actually a location for a world record: The Guinness World Record for the Biggest Fashion Show. Over 2,000 professional and amateur models walked down runways sporting designs from the best of the country‚Äôs fashion brands.

Photo by/Author: 
George Tapan/Brandon Dollente

That is quite an amazing factüòÑüëç$$ Makati is a beautiful City in the Philippines ... $$Been there many times, very crowded..$$Been there one times, I really like makati.$$I stayed there for 2 months,nice place!$$Looks like a great place to visit... As soon as I learn the langauge...I will definitely go visit...:)$$Sir Daryl Mondavi. You dont need to worry about learning our language fluently. Filipinos can understand and speak English.so you have nothing much to worry about..

message+desc:
Where is it?
Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

What is it?
Mapawa Nature Park in Malasag, Cagayan de Oro is a protected 2,500-hectare area that that provides adventurous visitors with activities like horseback -riding, camping, saying hello to a 300-year old tree, jumping off from a 15-foot cliff and a river trek that could include rapelling or sliding down a waterfall!

Fun Fact:
You could lose a sandal during the river trek, but there's a big chance it will float back to land to return to you.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department Philippines / Nikki Golez

Tomorrow. Or now na. Will fly tonight then fly back the next night. message+desc:
If there's a waterfall, I'm there.

A change of pace from the majestic Kawasan Falls, we came across this little, private sanctuary on a hike through Boljoon. With a day not going as planned, a reward like this to stumble upon made the adventure all the more worth it. As late afternoon progressed, the greens showed off their vibrancy in the shade and we rested our tired feet in this natural pool. Sitting here was not only a reminder of the magic you can find exploring this country's jungle, but the benefits of spontaneity.

Words and Photo by Michael G. Quinn

message+desc: Surrounded by pavilions, towers, arches and cupolas, Udaipur Palace or City Palace, is a fine blend of Rajasthani, Mughal, medieval, Chinese and European architecture. Built on the banks of the serene Pichola Lake, the palace complex comprises the Mubarak Mahal (the palace of reception) and the Maharani‚Äôs Palace (the palace of the queen). Mubarak Mahal is home to the Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II Museum and displays a unique and extensive collection of royal costumes, Pashmina silk, Benarasi silk saris, and others with Sanganeri prints and folk embroidery.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Ifugao, Luzon

How to Get There:
Take a bus bound for Banaue from Sampaloc.

Or take a bus bound for Baguio from Cubao or Pasay, then transfer to a bus bound for Banaue. 

What is it?
According to the Cordillera myth, the Ifugao people were created from Wigan, the god of Skyworld. Legend has it that Wigan gave the rice-terrace farming Ifugaos the first sacred rice. It's believed to be of the ipugo (rice of god) variety, which amazingly still flourishes despite certain the harsh conditions of the mountain ranges.

Fun Fact:
There are more than 20 different cultural dances in this region alone. Each dance is specifically used to celebrate a family occasion or community milestone.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department Philippines / Jao Bautista
comments: The tribe we have back home now it's it cover.$$We are very happy for you!!

The mountains on either side of the gorge - the Jade Dragon Snow Mountain and the Haba Snow Mountain - have peaks at over 5,000 meters, making this a hike only for the intrepid.

Spend a few hours here and have a fun-filled learning experience.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Palawan, Puerto Princesa

What is it?
The series of protruding limestone formations unique to Palawan make the province home to lakes as well. These lakes are formed when water is trapped in the spaces in between the limestone cliffs. 

Fun Fact:
A Palawan getaway wouldn‚Äôt be complete without limestone cliff diving. The otherworldly rock formations make a picturesque backdrop for jumpshot-off-the-cliff photos.

Photo by / Headline by:
George Tapan / Jao Bautista

message+desc:
November 10th and 22nd are the days of the rooster ‚ÄúTori‚Äù 
(‚ÄúTori‚Äù is one of the 12 signs of oriental zodiac).
And in many shrines in Japan, there will be ‚ÄúTori-no-Ichi‚Äù festival held.
The one in Ohtori Shrine, Asakusa in Tokyo is the most famous of all.
The decorations you can see in the pictures are called ‚ÄúKumade,‚Äù a rake and the Kumade is a good luck charm for business, happiness, and fortune.
It is said that we will have a better luck if we buy ‚ÄúKumade‚Äù bigger than the one we bought last year.  The bigger, the better.
Would you like to hang it on the wall of your house?

More Information:
Tori-no-Ichi in Ohotori Shrine: http://www.otorisama.or.jp/english.html
Tori-no-Ichi: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/festival/torinoichi.html
Asakusa Area: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/tokyo/asakusa.html

No matter if you're travelling as a family, couple or just by friends, Panglao is a great destination. Cozy restaurants, beautiful beaches, fun activites such as snorkeling and diving. It's cheap and easily accesible from Cebu and Bohol.

Words and Photo by Alexander Waltner @swedishnomad

#itsmorefuninthePhilippines

message+desc:
The City Palace Museum, the main part of the City Palace in Udaipur, #Rajasthan, comprises several palaces and houses a fascinating collection of rare murals, ancient sculptures, glass inlay work, and personal possessions of some of the rulers. 

A noticeable aspect of the museum is its surreal chess floor - a beautiful tribute to the origins and history of Chess. ‚ÄòChaturanga‚Äô, which developed around the 6th century AD, in India is believed to be the ancestor of various board games including chess and was a favourite pastime of Indian royalty.
comments: Been there. Absolutely stunning.$$Nic Nac......before we fly to mumbai

message+desc:
Fried Oyster Cake (ÁÇ∏ËöùÈ•º) is a snack crispy on the outside and yet moist on the inside when done right. 

And thanks to our friends at The MeatMen, it's now possible to make this at home! The one important thing is to use a wide and not to deep metal ladle. When you're done cooking, the cake will look golden brown - so drain it on a paper towel and serve. Enjoy!

Full recipe at: http://themeatmen.sg/fried-oyster-cake/

Where is it?
Pamilacan Island, Bohol

What is it?
This small, beautiful island is just a short boat ride away from the Baclayon pier. It‚Äôs famous for dolphin and whale-watching, so time your trip during the months these animals are most active.

Fun Fact:
There are ruins of an ancient Spanish fort on the island.

Photo by & Headline by:
Meggy De Guzman

message+desc:
Any plans for Saturday night? How about staring at the starry sky? This video taken in Guyam Island, Siargao, even shows us the Milky Way! Not bad for a weekend night! 

https://www.facebook.com/travelimagez/videos/vb.195718967444442/255967028086302/?type=2&theaterTime lapse scene of the milky way behind Guyam island, Siargao, Philippines. 

Guyam is a small deserted island of the coast of Siargao near General Luna. The island is visited daily by visitors on a boattrip or who come to just chill out for a while. It's a perfect little island with no facilities exept a toilet and 2 shelters. For a small fee the owner will allow people to stay on the island overnight. I've been in Siargao for over 2 months, the vibe of the island and the beauty of the surrounding islands make Siargao and incredible and addicting island. For a while have I been planning the right time to visit this island during the time when the milky way would be visible √°nd when there would be no light pollution of the moon, also trying to lucky with clear weather. 

The milky is not visible like this with your own eyes, it is because of long exposure shots (20 seconds) that details of the milky way become visible and with postprocessing details and contrast are further enhanced. The settings used are ISO 1600, f2.8, shutterspeed of 20seconds. I used a D800 and 14-24mm lens, but any DSLR can capture this and even a good compact camera with RAW abilities.

Follow me on instagram @travelimagez
comments: This could be night time in Toronto if there is no lights. It's gorgeous$$Joanna could of done this in Baler if we'd been allowed out onto the beach üòÇüòÇ$$mga kuyas Richard.. Jeffrey.. Mark.. what do you think of this?..$$Beautiful. God did not make any of that.$$Watch this in full screen "Beautiful

message+desc:
Where is it?
Northern Samar, Visayas

What is it? 
Seven rock formations as high as three-storey buildings draw tourists to the island town of Biri. Stunning as they are, these giant rocks are believed to have been formed by underwater tectonic plate movement.

Fun Fact: 
The National Institute Geological Sciences Research (NIGSR) of the University of the Philippines says that, "Biri Island rock formations were probably deposited 18-24 million years ago in a shelfal continental slope."  Wow! 

Photo by Gerry Ruiz
comments: Biri Island! Ian Casta√±ares Ryan Navarro$$Im fr0m there place , in im pr0ud  to be samarn0n. .

message+desc:
After a long day of braving the cold and seeing the sights, there‚Äôs nothing better than a good soak in a steamy hot ‚ÄúOnsen‚Äù (hot spring). 
Truly, this is one of the greatest pleasures of a winter visit to Japan. 
There is a tradition here, unbroken since ancient times, of maintaining good health and improving blood circulation by warming up the body in a variety of ways. You can bathe in hot springs, take foot baths, use hot compresses, or even try heated stones wrapped in cloth. Come experience winter in Japan! You‚Äôre sure to stay comfy and warm thanks to the Japanese wisdom of old.

Learn more: http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/special_kiribai.html

Absolutelyüòäüíïüíï

message+desc:
Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

What is it? 
Coron‚Äôs many lagoons are surrounded ‚Äì and sometimes hidden ‚Äì by towering limestone hills. Some lagoons have tiny openings that visitors must swim under to reach.

How to get there?
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

Fun Fact:
Coron offers many island hopping eco-tours. Ask your boatman to include a seaside lunch of fresh seafood!

Photo by/Headline by:
Joey Rico/Rachel Teotico
comments: Copywriting. More fun in the Philippines.

Where is it? 
Coron, Palawan

What is it like? 
Coron is a wedge-shaped limestone island in the tip of Palawan. After a tiring day of island-hopping, diving and kayaking, relax and catch the sunset from your bangka (boat).

Fun Fact: 
Get a different view of Coron from a spacious viewing deck on top of Mt.Tapyas. It‚Äôs a 30-minute trek from the town proper.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Rachel Teotico

Forget hot and stuffy hawker centres with uncles fighting over their kopi siew dais (coffee, less sweet). Your favourite Zhi Char dishes has been brought straight out of the hawker centres and brought straight to a comfortable restaurant setting, at the same prices!

Wok Master
Address: 180 Kitchener Road, #02-51, 208539
