message+desc:
We don't normally travel to the East. But we made an exception for Our Tampines Hub - a massive all-in-one lifestyle hub! 

Our Tampines Hub may only be in its first phase, but this massive complex already boasts an impressive range of facilities including a 200,000 sq ft shopping mall and a futuristic hawker centre with self-order kiosks. Sports enthusiasts can also look forward to climbing Singapore's FIRST climbing wall theme part and a sports hall filled up with 20 badminton courts. What more, Tampines Hub also regularly hosts community events ranging from free movie screenings to exciting fun fairs!

Our Tampines Hub
Address: 51 Tampines Ave 4

Never want to miss a post by us again?
Like TheSmartLocal.com and set Notifications to "All On"

message+desc: Can't get enough of caves? Try visiting the Langun-Gobingob Caves in Calbiga, Samar. The biggest in SouthEast Asia, it covers a massive 2,698 hectares, most of which are still unexplored. The main cave alone is so huge that it can accommodate 50 commercial planes placed side by side!

 ‚ÄúThe Oldest Buddhist Temple in Tokyo‚Äù
„ÄÄAsakusa Sensoji is the old Buddhist temple founded in 628, and the 200m-long covered avenue of traditional stalls selling classic items (great souvenir goods) leading up to the temple. The huge red lanterns of Kaminari- mon (Thunder Gate) remain one of perennial favorites for both tourists and Tokyoites.

Information about hospitality tours on the Host Government website.

message+desc: #IncredibleIndia is proud that Dipa Karmakar has qualified for the final round in the Individual vault final of artistic gymnastics, finishing eighth place with a score of 14.850. Dipa is the first Indian gymnast to enter the Olympic finals and is one among the only five gymnasts to have successfully performed the ‚ÄòProdunova‚Äô or the "vault of death" - one of the toughest manoeuvres in women‚Äôs gymnastics. She is also the first ever gymnast from India to be named as 'World Class Gymnast' by FIG.Wing's on Fire #Dipakarmakar #Rio2016

message+desc:
Durga Puja is one of the most popular festivals celebrated in West Bengal, especially in #Kolkata. 

The 10-day festival is celebrated in honour of Goddess Durga during Navaratri. Beginning from the sixth day till the ninth day, elaborate pandals with beautiful, life-size idols of Goddess Durga are open for visitors. The tenth day or Dashami marks the immersion of the idol in water with magnificent processions. People of Bengal celebrate this festival in the last four days of Navratri. 

During the festival, you will find Bengali girls and women dressed in exquisite saris and men in kurta-pyjama. Maha aarti is performed every evening. Devotees perform the Dhunuchi dance to the rhythmic beats of Dhak. The sounds of Dhak, Dhunuchi nach and the subtle fragrance of Shiuli adds to the spirit of the celebrations.
comments:
It's My Indian Culture...

message+desc:
From July 22 to 26, 2015, one of the biggest food shows in the country, the Manila Foods and Beverage Expo (MAFBEX), will bring together food and culinary enthusiasts to sample a wide array of sumptuous dishes and refreshing beverages and cocktails made with creativity and artistry. Experts from the industry will share their knowledge about the fast growing and highly evolving culinary scene in the Philippines.  

Held annually, the expo will host over 500 booths and 300 participating companies with more than 50,000 visitors expected to turn up. MAFBEX offers more than just a taste of what the culinary scene in Southeast Asia has to offer. The event also aims to provide business opportunities for buyers and traders in the industry. Cooking demonstrations, seminars and culinary contests also make up the schedule of this 4-day affair. 
MAFBEX is located at World Trade Center Metro Manila East Wing A & B and Philippine Trade Training Center

For more information, visit http://www.worldbex.com/Event/Mafbex
comments: Should have been there , but too early  i arrive in september from NORGE maybe  later?$$How to join? If there's a need to buy a pass/ticket, how much?

message+desc:
Have you ever heard of ‚Äúoden‚Äù? 
Oden is a Japanese winter dish consisting of several ingredients such as boiled eggs, daikon radish, konjac, and processed fishcakes stewed in a light, soy flavored dashi broth. Simple but very delicious, they are perfect for cold winter nights with your friends and family! 

For more information;
(Japanese winter food ) http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/seasonal/seasons_2004autumn-winter/winter/food.html
(Local cuisine) http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/dining/food/

message+desc:
Mt. Koya or Koyasan is one of the World Heritage Sites in Japan.
This year 2015 is the 1,200 year anniversary since Kobo Daishi (Kukai) founded a monastery at Mt. Koya, and related special exhibitions & events will be held from April 2nd (Thu.) to May 21st (Thu.).
Mt. Koya is a spiritual place where you can stay at the temple, also have absolutely unique experiences.

For further details, please refer to the following website;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/wakayama/koyasan.html

message+desc:
Where is it?
Caramoan, Camarines Sur

What is it?
Little is known is about the Caramoan Islands. Few people get to see this secret paradise. But a beautiful place like this won't be a secret for long. Adventurous types who have been to this island have enjoyed activities like kayaking, snorkeling, diving, limestone cliff-climbing, cave-exploring and stargazing. And they're likely to return, or at least spread the word about Caramoan's charm. 

Fun Fact:
Caramoan has an enigmatic hard-to-find lagoon. See if you can find it without the aid of a map!

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department Philippines / Tin Sanchez
comments: very soon were coming for celebrating holidays..$$Beautiful place .its a paradise but scary when it is rainny season .

comments: i love staycation, because even though i want to getaway from my work and all that stress, i still love the food in singapore, the diversity is one thing you cant find in other country. so staycation is the best of both worlds$$I love staycations because it allows me to take a break from the hectic life in Singapore to indulge, relax, enjoy and spend quality time with my loved ones.$$Having almost lost my marriage recently, staycations are an important part of our lives because it gives us time away from our busy schedules to just be totally absorbed in couple time without any distractions. Although we have been married for 15 years, we feel that it is especially during this period that more effort has to be put in to keep the flame burning.$$Weekends are meant for staycations! I felt like I just went to a short trip to overseas. Feeling super refreshed and recharged my power! There are enough facilities, you do not need to go out. To me, it is the perfect hassle-free holiday! Liked and shared.$$Helps me feel rejuvenated & be able to breathe in life's goodness like the lady in the picture. Been a long long while since I felt so carefree and hence, life's simplest pleasures such as staycations will definitely bring about much needed therapeutic magic and wonders! :)$$I love staycations because it allows me to take a break from the hectic life in Singapore to indulge, relax, enjoy and spend quality time with my husband and kids$$The perfect way to spend the weekend, to be away from reality for a short time ^^$$My love for staycation is mainly for my toddlers and pre-schooler. The fact that we are still in Singapore puts us at ease if my kids suddenly became sick and ill, we can head to the nearest clinic or hospital or rush home to get medicine. We can also be assured that their milk and diapers are readily available, cut down on distance travelling and the frustrations of clearing customs and our loved ones like grandparents can join us at any point of the staycation. Isnt that wonderful?$$Staycation offers the opportunity to reconnect with your significant other or family, away from the bustling city life. An opportunity to chill out from the noise and to rediscover Singapore, and definitely to recharge for the coming week. Allowing the duality of 'urban-chic-tranquility' and local delights, all within the comfort of home.$$Staycation is great because I am more familiar here and at the same time pampering myself in the hotel.$$Best way to travel your mind, body and soul out of the world, locally. $$I love staycations because... I can be a tourist in Singapore for a day. Also, who doesn't love breakfast buffets? Yes, my favourite part about staying in hotels is definitely the breakfast HAHAHA.$$Good location and very nice ambience... will definitely have a good experience if been rewarded...  $$No fuss and go straight to vacation time!!$$Able to sleep the whole day without being nag and pull out of bed.. Recharging mode when in staycation..$$no need to fly, pack so much, can rest and eat more & still go to work the next day!!  what's there not to love!! <3$$Staycation: The only time I can take a break away from home, right at home! ;-)$$We do not have the luxury of time to go for long overseas trips, so a short staycation is a good way to catch up and spend some quality time with my loved ones. This short break is essential for such hectic work life in Singapore.$$what i like most bout staycations are when i can just stay up with my friends, watching movies, eating and drinking, basically just having fun!!$$Staycation means to have fun while relaxing!  Taking a break from work and recharged!$$Getting away from stressed up work and spending time with your love ones = priceless. :D$$Staycations are great cos they signify short getaways without having to travel long journeys. A quick recharge and relaxation trip in sg would be a great option. Thisbwould be the perfect opportunity to have a short getaway with hubby to spend time together without the kids and yet being near, in case they need us! üòä$$WE <3 STAYCATIONS! It is a wonderful way for us to catch up with loved ones in a cosy, relax and intimate enviroment. Ultimate therapy!$$Staycation, a good way of relaxing without being too far away from home.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Callao Cave, Cagayan

How to get there: 
Fly into Tuguegarao from Manila.Take a bus bound for Tuguegarao or Aparri from Manila.Or take a bus bound for Claveria from Ilocos Norte.

What is it like? 
Serious cavers will appreciate the different rock formations of Callao Cave. Casual tourists will appreciate that it doesn't take an expert to explore the area. Natural light highlights certain parts of the cave system, giving the rock formations even more texture. Be sure to bring your camera!

Fun Fact: 
Callao Cave is a popular shoot location for Filipino movies and television shows.

Photo by/Author: 
Karlo Reyes Balisi/Nikki Golez

Through snippets of his travels, Nick Levin takes you around the Philippines' sights and sounds. Join him in his journey through 176 islands including Bohol, Cebu, Boracay and Palawan. Click on the link and share away!

http://vimeo.com/8475010430 days of traveling in the Philippines with 3 friends. 176 islands including Bohol, Boracay, Cebu, Palawan, El Nido etc. Beaches, whale sharks, nightlife, reefs‚Ä¶
comments: The only part I didn't like was the pig :($$definitely more fun in the Phils.$$Luckily you came out in one piece$$More fun in the. Philippines. Staring contests. More fun in the. Philippines. Going with the flow. More fun in the. Philippines. Beaches. Openbars. More fun in the ..The Philippines , officially known as the Republic of the Philippines , is a sovereign island country in Southeast Asia situated in the western Pacific Ocean. To its north across the Luzon Strait lies Taiwan; west across the South China Sea sits Vietnam; southwest is the island of Borneo across the Sulu Sea, and to the south the Celebes Sea separates it from other islands of Indonesia; while to the east it is bounded by the Philippine Sea and the island-nation of Palau. Its location on the Pacific Ring of Fire and close to the equator make the Philippines prone to earthquakes and typhoons, but also endows it with abundant natural resources and some of the world‚Äôs greatest biodiversity. At 300,000 square kilometers (115,831 sq mi), the Philippines is the 64th-largest country in the world, consisting of an archipelago of 7,107 islands that are categorized broadly under three main geographical divisions: Luzon, Visayas, and Mindanao. Its capital city is Manila while its most populous city is Quezon City; both are part of Metro Manila.With a population of at least 99 million people, the Philippines is the seventh-most populated country in Asia and the 12th most populated country in the world. An additional 12 million Filipinos live overseas, comprising one of the world‚Äôs largest and most influential diasporas. Multiple ethnicities and cultures are found throughout the islands. In prehistoric times, Negritos were some of the archipelago‚Äôs earliest inhabitants. They were followed by successive waves of Austronesian peoples who came from Malay, Indian, and Islamic states. Various nations were established under the rule of Datus, Rajahs, Sultans or Lakans. Trade with China also introduced Chinese culture and settlement, which remain present to this day.The arrival of Ferdinand Magellan in 1521 marked the beginning of an era of Spanish interest and eventual colonization. In 1543, Spanish explorer Ruy L√≥pez de Villalobos named the archipelago Las Islas Filipinas in honor of Philip II of Spain. The Spanish Empire began to settle with the arrival of Miguel L√≥pez de Legazpi from New Spain (present day Mexico) in 1565 who established the first Spanish settlement in the archipelago, which remained a Spanish colony for more than 300 years. This resulted in the predominant religion in the country to be Roman Catholicism and it is one of two countries in Asia; the other being East Timor. During this time, Manila became the Asian hub of the Manila‚ÄìAcapulco galleon trade.As the 19th century gave way to the 20th, there followed in quick succession the Philippine Revolution, which spawned the short-lived First Philippine Republic; the Spanish‚ÄìAmerican War; and the Philippine‚ÄìAmerican War. In the aftermath, the United States emerged as the dominant power; aside from the period of Japanese occupation, the United States retained sovereignty over the islands. After World War II, the Treaty of Manila recognised the Philippine Republic as an independent nation. Since then, the Philippines has had an often tumultuous experience with democracy, with popular ‚Äúpeople power‚Äù movements overthrowing a dictatorship in one instance, but also underlining the institutional weaknesses of its constitutional republic in others. The Philippines currently has one of Asia‚Äôs fastest growing economies, and the nation‚Äôs large population size and economic potential have led it to be classified as a middle power.$$yes ! Phil is really beautiful! it s called pearl of d orient seas!

June 30th is the last day of the first half of the year, the day of ‚ÄúNagoshi-no-harai‚Äù, or purification ceremony. 
On that day, some shrines in Japan put ‚ÄúChinowa‚Äù, cogon grass rings, at shrine gates that visitors walk through, praying for the preservation of their good health continuing into the latter half of the year.
In addition, some cities also have a habit of eating Japanese confectioneries called ‚ÄúMinazuki‚Äù. Would you like to experience this unique ceremony and taste these treats?

Related Information; https://www2.city.kyoto.lg.jp/koho/eng/preview/15.html 
http://www.kitanotenmangu.or.jp/top_en.php

Today's ÎßêÎ≥µ (malbok), signifying the end of hot summer, according to the lunar calendar. In Korea, people tend to have samgye-tang (ginseng chicken soup) on those hottest days to overcome the sweltering heat. For the adventurous or cook lovers, why not try making the dish? :D

message+desc: Happy National Batik Day! As an icon of Indonesian culture and recognized UNESCO World Cultural Heritage, here we bring you one of the many beautiful Batik cloths, the Batik Solo. Traditionally, the colors used in Batik are blue to symbolize earth, brown symbolizing fire and white to symbolize air and water. Batik Solo uses predominantly Sogan (chocolate brown) over a pale yellow background. Go to Pasar Klewer in Solo if you want to take home some of this beautiful batik. http://www.indonesia.travel/en/destination/point-of-interest/batik-solo #WonderfulIndonesiaThe two famous traditional cloths produced in Solo are batik and lurik. Batik is an important icon of Indonesian culture. The batik which comes from the areas around Solo and Yogya is known as court batik. Traditionally the colors used in this batik are blue to symbolize earth, brown to symbolize fi...

See more of Jeremy Jauncey's posts about the Philippines by going to his Instagram account, @JeremyJauncey. Follow Beautiful Destinations on Instagram and 'BDestinations' and 'TourismPHL' on Snapchat for more live updates about the team's ongoing travel to around the Philippines!

message+desc:
nanDimsum 101
What does tapping your fingers on a dim sum table in this way mean?

1.	Thank you for pouring my tea! 
2.	Enough, already!
3.	Your turn to pay. Hey! I know where you live!

No 1. You do this to express thanks to your fellow diner when he or she pours tea for you. It started when a Qing dynasty emperor was travelling disguised as a commoner. In a teahouse he poured tea for the officials accompanying him. They had to kowtow for such an honour but that would blow the emperor‚Äôs cover. So they mimicked kowtowing with their fingers.
comments: No 2. You do this to express thanks to your fellow diner when he or she pours tea for you. It started when a Qing dynasty emperor was travelling disguised as a commoner. In a teahouse he poured tea for the officials accompanying him. They had to kowtow for such an honour but that would blow the emperor‚Äôs cover. So they mimicked kowtowing with their fingers.$$I concur with Chew Chee Kong!$$No question: 1.	Thank you for pouring my tea!$$Yes I do but do you know how it came about???$$Thank you for pouring tea

Information on Mt.Pinatubo: No more boating allowed as a matter of fact; no one is allowed to swim, you can only walk about 4 to 5 feet from the shoreline.The guides are very informative and friendly throughout, but don't act like a fool when you're in the crater, they're very strict, after all; your life is in their hands. Approx.18Km 4x4 ride and 4Km. hiking.
The information that's given here are from 2009, also the price of the trek is about Php.5000 p/ 5 people plus other fees.$$Hello there! I just want to promote this blog also.

message+desc:
If you wish for fantastic and unforgettable travel experience throughout your lifetime, then you‚Äôd better come and visit Raja Ampat. From the highest point in the sky down to the ocean floor, Raja Ampat has the fascinating beauty for everyone. If there is a tour destination you must visit at least once in a lifetime, Raja Ampat is one of them. 
As part of Coral Triangle, Raja Ampat comprising over 1.500 island, cays, and shoals surrounding the four main islands; Misool, Batanta, Salawati, and Waigeo. It makes this area well-known as the richest marine biodiversity. But, exploring Raja Ampat is not always about diving. You can visit one of the 18 most beautiful villages in West Papua: Arborek. http://ow.ly/RUCf7

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments: Harborek village with beautiful jetty to diving$$This one is the most beautiful

June is not only the month of humid days and rain, it is also the best time to see fireflies. 
June is breeding season, causing these twinkling bugs to light up the night sky, near clear rivers and streams.

See the best spots for viewing fireflies at
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/histtown/philosophers-walk.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/histtown/senzu.html

message+desc:
Nov. 15th is a Children‚Äôs Shrine-Visiting Day for aged 3, 5 and 7, called Shichi-go-san.
This is a ceremonial visit paid by parents and children to their tutelary shrines to offer gratitude for the healthy growth of the children. The custom is for the children to dress in their best clothes and to carry Chitose-ame which are long thin candy sticks colored in red and white, believed to bring good luck. If you visit the shrines on weekends around Nov.15th, you may find many children wearing traditional Kimono. Very cute!
comments: same as little angel.what so cute.^,^$$I saw Little children visiting the thrines when I das un Hiroshima. So adorable!

message+desc:
Let's sail away.

The bay of El Nido hosts spectacular boats, including this one. Sailboats have always been a fascination of mine, most likely because of my constant desire to be on the water. There's something about being at sea, far from land, on a boat like this to truly grasp the magnitude of a setting and remind us how small we are. Luckily, The Philippines helped me crave that fix (for now).

Words and Photo by Michael G. Quinn
comments: El Nido is one of the most beautiful places on the planet.. if you haven't been.. make it a priority. You will not regret the simplistic beauty.$$This is Hilongos Harbor where ships to Bisaya are running. Was Also so beautiful that I couldn't help taking pictures of it.$$I'm here in El Nido now, and this is my second time here üòâ$$Is it safe for Western tourists to visit because I, m concerned as to the killing of 2 Canadian nationals this year üòì$$I wish I could sail away on that beautiful boat hopping from island to island that would be a dream.$$Awesome!!!! A place to die for....$$Read story on my fb timeline about new pres.of the Philippines and number 7$$The most beautiful island in the world we've  been there last April with my family and relatives

message+desc: Are you ready for the Valentine's Day? In Japan, Valentine's Day is the romantic day when women present chocolates to the men they love. Meanwhile, women also give "obligation chocolates" to their colleagues and classmates to express their continuing gratitude, and give "friendship chocolates" to their female friends. Japanese women present many different types of chocolates, including cheap chocolates sold at 100 yen, high-end chocolates and handmade chocolates that take a great deal of time to make, on Valentine's Day. There is also a unique "return gift day" called "White Day" on 14th March when the tastes of Japanese men are tested in choosing gifts to return to the women. Both men and women become excited on Valentine's Day. How about Valentine's Day in your country?
comments: In Turkey, only some of young couples gives presents to one another. But if my observation is right; generally girls waiting gift(s) from boys. But generally everybody says that Valentine's Day is "money trap". ^^$$It is not an important day in Spain, but some couples celebrate with something special. Not only chocolate, but also flowers or a very romantic moment. Some people really dislike this date, in most of the cases because they don't have a couple yet! :D$$Valentine's Day in Japan is so beautiful! Here in Argentina and Chile the couples celebrate with gifts or they go out to a romantic dinner. Flowers, chocolates, jewelry are the popular gifts in that day, and generally women wait that their boyfriends buy something for Valentine's day. $$in Iraq valentine's day is almost ordinary and not different from others just a bit$$IN the USA we go out or make a special dinner! I guess chocolate is the same all over the world Yummmmmy

message+desc: Explore the #SilkRoad with this video showing an aerial view of north Xinjiang! This province is known for its unique folk culture and diverse resources. With deserts, grasslands, mountains, and lakes, it's a perfect place for adventures! #tourism #wanderlustThis is "North Xinjiang Aerial Showreel 2015 Êñ∞ÁñÜËà™Êãç2015" by Ken Leung on Vimeo, the home for high quality videos and the people who love them.
comments: For centuries the Silk Road was the thread that linked east and west. From as early as 200BC the silk merchants of Xian, China‚Äôs ancient capital, set off with their camel caravans on the long trek to distant Constantinople. They skirted the Gobi and the ferocious Taklamakan deserts, and crossed ‚Äòthe Roof of the World‚Äô, over the Pamirs and the Karakorams. This tour allows you to follow in their footsteps, to trace the legendary route taken by Marco Polo from west to east, with the inclusion of exotic places like Xiahe, and the dramatically-located fortified town of Jiayuguan. http://www.ctshorizons.com/china/tour/silk-road-expedition

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Puerto Princesa, Palawan

What is it like? 
When fish swim in the same direction and in a coordinated manner, the behavior is called "schooling." But when they're together, interacting, it's called "shoaling". Fish shoal for protection against predators, better chances of finding food, and better chances of finding a mate ‚Äì a shoalmate! You can watch schools or shoals of fish when you go snorkeling in Puerto Princesa's marine attractions, such as Honda Bay.

Fun Fact: 
Fish don't just randomly join a group. Like people, they pick who to hang out with ‚Äì who their mates will be. And generally, they like large shoals with fish who are healthy and resemble their appearance. This is because a fish that stands out will be easy prey.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Tin Sanchez
comments:
Very interesting fish notes....$$Been there, beautiful...$$I've been this place  at Honda bay .$$Very informative. Thanks!
I've been to Honda Bay last summer. :-D

message+desc:
Where is it?
Cebu City, Visayas

What is it?
With one happening every day in different parts of the country, fiestas are at the heart of Filipino culture, celebrated in honor of saints and characterized by costumes, street dancing, music and merrymaking!

Fun Fact:
Three of the biggest fiestas in the Visayas are held each year in January in honor of Sto.Nino (Child Jesus) -- Sinulog in Cebu, Dinagyang in Iloilo and Ati-atihan in Aklan. 

Photo by the Tourism Department of the Philippines
comments: That shouldn't surprise anyone$$Effective advertising with the outstanding colors, costumes and smiles.  Captures your attention!!!

Lake Kawaguchi Herb Festival June 21st -15th July
Lake Kawaguchi is the core of sightseeing in the Fuji Five Lakes, and easy access from Tokyo. Destination guide:

message+desc:
Where is it?
Boac, Mogpong and Gasan, Marinduque

What is it?
During Holy Week, men in painted masks and colorful costumes go to the streets of Marinduque to play-act the story of the centurion Longinus. The Moriones Festival draws huge crowds.

Fun Fact:
A parish priest invented the Moriones Festival in the 1800s to get his flock more interested in celebrating Lent.

Photo by / Headline by:
Donald Tapan / Nikki Golez

message+desc: We are very much concerned about the selling of illegal alcoholic beverages in Bali. We ask all of you to PARTY RESPONSIBLY. Anywhere, anytime.
comments: Partly responsibly ? Why legalize "some" alcohol at first place ? Both legal & illegal are destructive.$$so.. so Bali,   how of Bali  other regency of Indonesia . as like Jakarta and any one,$$It says PARTY RESPONSIBLY, no Partly responsibly. Read carefully$$We were born and nurtured in different places, with different cultures. For some, party can involve alcoholic beverages, and for some others, it is restricted. Tourism is universal, and when we embark on making tourism as one of the important sectors, we have to bend some of our rules, but not break it. Thank you, Rizkie Abidin and also Nugroho Latifolia for sharing your thought.$$why only say bali? It is a Very big problem through the whole of Indonesia! Just a month ago a young man died of drinking a cocktail containing methanol in Lombok!  better revise the alcohol import laws and get rid of this ridiculous high taxes so it will not be interesting anymore to make cheap FAKE alcoholic spirits.$$Yes, Danielle Omang Omang. The incident in Lombok gave rise to the concern even higher. Culturally, many ethnicity groups in Indonesia, by history, have their own traditional alcoholic beverages. As tourism grows, these things may divert from time to time. Surely, social control and regulations should be maintained. So, we keep asking you to wisely rationalize this issue, and say once again, party responsibly.

message+desc:
GENBI-KEI Gorge is located northeast of ICHINOSEKI city in Iwate Prefecture and it is nice place to see the colorful leaves in autumn.
At there, a very interesting thing can be experienced. Catch and eat the ‚Äúflying‚Äù dango (rice dumpling).
It is using a basket moving on the wire between the dumpling store and an order place. 
Now you can imagine how it would be a delight to go picnic under the autumn leaves!

Access: It takes about 2 and half hours by SHINKANSEN, bullet train from Tokyo station to ICHINOSEKI Station.
From ICHINOSEKI to GENBI-KEI Gorge is 20 minutes by bus.

More information:
http://www.japan-iwate.info/app/location_detail.php?lid=114
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/routes/rtp/northern_tohoku/day3.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/rtg/pdf/pg-203.pdf
comments: There's also a few nice hot springs there!$$Lynee Cappa I think you are going to need lots more holidays to Japan. :)$$A place to live amazing veiw

message+desc:
17 Places With FREE FLOW FOOD! From Endless Truffle Fries to Bubble Tea at no extra charge!

"I have a love-hate relationship with buffets. The good ones are often overpriced and the cheap ones hardly serve food worth stuffing your face for. Overeating is almost obligatory when you pay for a buffet - you gotta eat your money‚Äôs worth. 

This is why my eyes light up instantly when I hear about places that offer their food free-flow. No exorbitant buffet prices, no extra charges and no pressure to eat more than I can handle."

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/free-flow-foodNo extra charges, no exorbitant prices. Here are 16 places with free flow food you can enjoy with no extra expense to your wallet. Let\'s share the calories.
comments: Forgot Les Bouchons, free flow French fries, and Le Petit Navire has free flow salmon carpaccio !

Still don't know where to go for the Holy Week break? Try some place quiet, where you can reflect and get away from the crowds. Some of the beaches in this list might fit the bill! Don't forget to share this with friends who don't have Holy Week plans yet!  

http://www.backpackingpilipinas.com/2014/03/16-best-unspoiled-philippine-beach.htmlwith too much of the exaggerated polar vortex happening here in the prairies, reading this article is such a warm treat! Napapa beach mode na ugod ako.Congrats inday! hugsss madami. <3

More Fun in Philippines..$$Most travelled people from Cebu love to visit Santa Fe Beach at Bantayan Island during Holy week because of it's uniqueness on the celebration..and attracts local and foreign people too...$$IF U WANT A NICE QUIET PLACE GO TO SIQUIOR ISLAND  NEAR DUMAGUETTI ITS A BEAUTIFUL PLACE WITH OLD SPNAISH CHURCH   AND NUNNERY  NOW A SCHOOL I THINK$$Holy week should be a time to attend church activities for Lenten season. message+desc:
Where is it?
Batanes, Luzon

How to Get There:
Fly into Batanes from Manila, Cagayan or Ilocos Norte

What is it?
Batanes is a group of ten small islands in the northernmost part of the Philippines, lying in the Luzon Strait between Luzon and Taiwan. It's the smallest province in the Philippines.

Fun Fact:
People from Batanes are called Ivatans. Scholars are unable to trace their origins, but evidence suggests that they came from northern Luzon and Taiwan. Ivatans live in sturdy stone houses made of limestone to protect them from harsh weather.

Photo by / Headline by:
Ida Roccio David / Denise Tolentino
comments: i love BATANES...with JEOE$$So expensive to get there!$$on my places to visit wish list! no. 1!

message+desc:
The corals in Komodo National Park are diverse and luxuriant due to the clear water, intense sunlight and rapid exchange of nutrient-rich water from deeper areas of the archipelago. The marine fauna are very diverse, ranging from notable marine mammals include blue whale (Balaenoptera musculus) and sperm whale (Physeter catadon) as well as 10 species of dolphin, dugong (Dugong dugon) and five species of sea turtles. http://ow.ly/Torho
#WonderfulIndonesia

hi all Just came from my vacations in indonesia !! best vacations ever!!! here is a video i made. i hope will inspire others to make indonesia their next vacation destination.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D7dyxeLv_kQ$$One day....I will go there... Love you FULL INDONESIAüòçüòç$$The real pict? 
Soooo beautiful..$$Indonesia is such a beautiful country so rich in biodiversity, but it's also one of the most dirty country in the world. It's such a pity that the government  don't care, don't do anything for the trash, don't educate local communities to environment protection and nature conservation and don't use the money paid by tourists for entrance fees to keep the country clean. Such a pity they are destroying nature and killing animals for financial purposes like palm oil.... pity that Komodo National Park as many others in Indonesia is just a plastic and garbage garden... despite the huge amounts of money paid every day by tourists which is supposed to be used for conservation and environment protection but unfortunately is not...$$Never seen any dugong but I have only been diving here for a few months. message+desc: #GoodMorning! Here's a typical traditional #breakfast of a #Korean family. It usually includes a bowl of rice with a main dish (fish, in this example), a #jjigae (Korean stew) and some #banchan (Korean side dishes)! What is the usual breakfast in your country? Feel free to share with us in the comments below! :D
comments:
Our country Indonesia has 34 provinces, at least based on province we have different kind of traditional breakfast. I cannot summarize all, but at least here the image of some of our breakfast dishes, basically we eat carbs with full nutrient in the morning.. incredibly delicious.  
Some looks like Korean lunch dish, isn't it ? kkkkk
I compile this photo specially for my KTO's friends here..enjoy$$Kolo Mee...Egg Noodles tossed in  seasoned oil served with Honey BBQ Pork and fried minced pork...with a side of pickled sliced chillies...Let's see if anyone knows where this iconic dish is from...hahaha!$$In Indonesia, I usually have fried rice with/without scramble egg as  a topping or bread + jam or nasi kuning (yellow rice) for  breakfast.$$In our country India... usually Idli..dosa..made with a batter of whitegram and rice..Poori..Chappathi..made with wheat flour..some curries like Sambar with mixed vegetables..chutney made of grinding coconut with green chillies and ginger..with a cup of hot coffee..tea or milk..üôãüôãüôã$$Traditionally brewed coffee, half boiled eggs with black soya sauce and pepper, toast with generous helping of butter.$$Excellent Day! KTO, my usual breakfast in my country is  whole wheat bread with cheese  , juice of natural fruit and milk with coffee .. :) (y)$$i asked my Korean co-worker like 3 years ago, what's you have for breakfast everyday..he only said lightly: Í∑∏ÎÉ• Î∞• ~~ (only rice~~) and no further explanation lol$$In Singapore.. we are very lucky to have enjoy western, chinese, muslim and indian style of breakfast...$$Usually tea with s√°ndwich!!$$Flattened rice and milk with fruit$$indonesian traditional cakes or fried rice or reheated leftover last dinner :)$$Indonesian used to eat "mie goreng" as breakfast üòÅ$$Usually we have toast with peanut butter, jam or honey. Somedays an egg dish, omelet or scrambled eggs, hot or cold cereal, such as oatmeal or a bran, date, nut cereal and fresh fruit or yogurt   and coffee or Lotus Tea$$egg, fried rice, coffee=))$$in Fiji because of the diffrent cultures in may very i am from a mix race family we are very westernised  toast bowl cereal and cup of tea is more popular they coffee$$This would be lunch or dinner in my country... for breakfast we eat bread with something on or maybe eggs or oat flakes...$$In Italy it's something sweet like cookies and cappuccino... oh, how I miss Korean breakfasts!

message+desc:
Bodhgaya - Buddhism‚Äôs most sacred and significant site
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bodhgaya, the most important site of Buddhist pilgrimage in the world, is situated in the state of Bihar. 

The place is a sacred site of the first order, and its central temple, the UNESCO World Heritage listed Mahabodhi Temple, is an obligatory stop on the Buddhist pilgrimage circuit. 

Adjacent to the Mahabodhi Temple is the Bodhi tree itself under which Prince Siddhartha Gautama is said to have attained Enlightenment 2,500 years ago. As a result he became the Buddha - the Enlightened One. Bodh Gaya or Uruvela, as it was known during Buddha‚Äôs times, is also a major pilgrimage centre for Hindus as Buddha is considered to be the ninth incarnation of Vishnu.

 - See more at: http://incredibleindia.org/index.php/travel/destination/bodhgaya

message+desc:
Tidung Island has almost every bit of paradise an island should have. The island is one of the hundred islands of Thousand Islands propping up from the Java Sea. It is merely some 20 kilometers north of Jakarta, making it a popular getaway for city dwellers.

The water is shallow and the current is mild, very suitable for dipping and swimming. The long stretch of sand is white and clean to walk upon or lay down in comfort. The trees offer shade for those who are prone to sunburn.

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments: Tidung is a terrible island. Polluted waters, chaotic port, below average accommodation choices. Won't be going back any time soon.$$If any plan came to raja ampat please join with us...

message+desc:
Togetsukyo Bridge (Crossing-Moon Bridge) in Kyoto
If you are planning to visit Kyoto, don‚Äôt forget to visit Togetsukyo Bridge in Arashiyama Area. The bridge is one of the symbolic sightseeing spots and it‚Äôs absolutely beautiful during fall. You can enjoy autumn leaves and feel the traditional atmosphere! 
Best time to see the autumn leaves around this area will be Mid. Nov. to Late Nov.

This area was hit by typhoon #18 on September 15th, but now recovered quickly and enjoys sightseeing as usual!
Arashiyama Now (Japanese) http://www.kyokanko.or.jp/sagano1309/
Togetsu-kyo Bridge: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/histtown/togetsukyobridge.html
Arashiyama:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/histtown/arashi-yama.html

message+desc:
Konark - An iconic masterpiece of ancient Indian architecture

Apart from TajMahal, if there is another monument that symbolises Indiait is the majestic Sun Temple at Konark, a UNESCO World Heritage. Built in the 13th century by King NarasimhaDev of the Ganga dynasty, this temple stands regally amidst the sand dunes bordering the Bay of Bengal. It represents the very pinnacle of the Kalinga School of Temple Architecture. In fact, Konark Sun temple, also known as Black Pagoda, is the most resplendent of thesites in Orissa, one certainly not to miss even in the most perfunctory of tours.The Annual Konark Festival and the Dance and Music festival held here in December and February, respectively, are great attractions.

- See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/konark
comments: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f21cs8cKVTE

message+desc:
What makes Palawan the world‚Äôs best island? Postcard-worthy places like El Nido which Kiwi traveler Jon has recently captured in this post! Click to read about his experience! 

http://jonistravelling.com/beaches-of-el-nido-palawan/The Philippines is home to over 7000 islands, but ask anyone who has been (or is planning to go) about their trip and they‚Äôll probably mention El Nido, on the stunning and sparsely populated island of Palawan.  Most people come for the island hopping tours, but spend a bit of
comments: I spent 7 weeks on Palawan at the beginning of this year. Enjoyed every minute of it and didn't want to leave. Yes, El Nido is a tourist trap and fairly expensive, but stunningly beautiful. The rest of the island is also great and offers so much relaxation, so many white sand beaches. I'l definitely go back.$$Palawan Sux...it is a tourist trap...if you visit the Philippines this is one place to avoid....Try  Boracay or The Hundred Islands area if you want the beaches or Baguio City and the Rice Terraces or The Chocolate hills area if you want the interior scenery...:)$$Nice story, but 1000 pesos for a 45 min. tricycle ride? I guess the prices have changed a lot since a visited El Nido in 2008$$el Nido and Coron are one of the best islands in the world,islands/white beaches/lagoons/corals/rocks/mountains/rain forest/underground river/caves....all there,i ll be back$$Palawan the best place ever. Marerelax ka talaga.$$LAS CABANAS BEACH EL NIDO - I was there with my Pinay Love in may!$$How much will it cost visiting palawan from here in davao?$$Palawan esp.El nido and Coron are the best beaches,very peaceful and relaxing  opposite from Boracay crowded and noisy.$$El Nido tour C... I'll be back in Palawan in exactly 17 more days....can't wait ;)$$I've been in El Nido Palawan.I was so amazed how stunning the island,the crystal clear water, formation rocks...and my favorite  snake island was so perfect. I wish I could visit again.$$The more reason why a coal fored powerplant should not be located in Palawan$$Visited! Lovely place üòòüòòüòò$$Thank you for sharing my blog post. The Philippines is a beautiful country and I will definitely come back to visit it soon (with my Filipina girlfriend). You may check my facebook page www.facebook.com/jonistravelling for other travel stories around the world.$$https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KfHokvIWOdw Beautiful View from the top of Bacuit Bay. Please watch.$$I really want to hear more about foreigners and their experiences there. I have heard some disturbing things about the general area that have me concerned. Just saying$$Surreal. message+desc:
Check out our special Feature on "Hiroshima Prefecture", a must-visit destination in Japan! 
Make sure to visit the unforgettable sites around Seto Inland Sea‚Äôs such as the historic ports or the hilly seaside alongside the more famous World Heritage Atomic Bomb Dome and the Itsukushima Shrine.
Learn more: http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1610_hiroshima.html
comments:
I visited Hiroshima earlier this year. I saw the Genbaku dome, toured the museum and hiked up Mt Misen. Miyajima is absolutely stunning and definitely worth a repeat in the future. 
And the street food in Hiroshima is out of this world! Anyone considering a visit should definitely come see the sights! 
Plus with the tram line running through the heart of the city transportation is very simple$$Impressive place, you can tell the feeling when you are at the Peace memorial park, the GEMBAKU-DOME. is too difficult to explain, you just get like thousands of questions on your head about this place, the people and things at that moment. Also Â∫ÉÂ≥∂ÁÑº (Hiroshima Yaki) is definitely something you have to try there and Oysters (Yaki kaki) at Miyajima  and in Sakura season is just beautiful, just be aware of Deer!! The whole island is full of those animals!! Beautiful Japan!!$$I was in Hiroshima . If you are in Japan you need to go to see that town . I visited Hiroshima Peace Memorial or Atomic Bomb Dome.It was impressive , but make me very sad. That is our real world history, isn't it?$$I lived in Hiroshima for 3 years while on the JET Programme and absolutely loved every minute of it! I go back every chance I get$$I have been to Japan 3 times but yet to visit those sites will visit some other days$$My respect for the people of Iroshima. I have beautiful memories!!$$Visited Japan and Hiroshima 2008 and will come back again next year. Japan is fantastic country!$$Visited Hiroshima twice and took the grandchildren - would go back$$thanks for the pictures on that link .love the old style buildings and crooked roads$$Such a beautiful city... one of my favorites cities I have visited there.$$I was there in 1999 absolutely  fantastic place just back from Japan had another fantastic  time I will be back in 2 or 3 years so much to see and do$$I will see you again, Hiroshima‚ù§Ô∏è$$I was there in September! Very impressive!$$thanks jica who make this historical visit for us$$Love this place ! So impressive <3$$Must make a trip there!

message+desc:
Where do you think this photo was taken? This is the Kanazawa station, Ishikawa pref. The Station was selected as one of the World‚Äôs most beautiful train stations on the Travel+Leisure Magazine. The wooden gate called "Tsuzumi-mon" made with image of a Japanese hand drum used in Kaga Hosho, a traditional No play of Kanazawa, and the glass dome called„ÄÄ"Motenashi (Welcome)-dome"  designed as a huge umbrella. It expresses hospitality to all visitors. The exquisite beauty of these structures perfectly expresses the two facets of Kanazawa as a modernizing city that is deeply respectful of tradition at the same time.
Visit Kanazawa and enjoy the architecture!
Destination guide: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/ishikawa/kanazawa.html
comments:
yes its truly the most beautiful train stations i've ever seen!
utsukushii da!$$I had been here in snowy days ~ so so so beautiful and romantic$$how amazing! A Verry perfect structure. hoping that i came  there soon.$$This looks like landing of golden eagle, the bird of Ishikawa prefecture.$$Saw it last year in April on our german-japanese-friendshiptour$$Japan Train stations: highly functional & esthetically pleasing.

message+desc:
Travel Smart
Purple, green, dark blue, light blue ‚Äì why does Hong Kong have such a variety of banknotes?

Ans: Hong Kong‚Äôs banknotes are not issued by a single authority. Instead, they are issued by three different commercial banks, even for the same denominations. Hence the variety. Find out more about the colour of our money here. http://bit.ly/15MdXYq
comments: Ans: Hong Kong‚Äôs banknotes are not issued by a single authority. Instead, they are issued by three different commercial banks, even for the same denominations. Hence the variety. Find out more about the colour of our money here. http://bit.ly/15MdXYq$$Ha ha ha! In Hong Kong several commercial banks issue their own banknotes for general circulation! In addition HK Monetary Authority issue banknotes. Thats why HK have such variety of banknotes!  Honkg Kong is amazing! Hong Kong is unique!$$I loved the design of 10 HKD$$Beautifull  place  with  beautifull  currency  notes.$$is anyone gong to seriously answer that question?! :o$$I love Hong kong ,got any More  information about Hong kong?$$There are  3 Commercial Banks issue their own banknotes.  First is HSBC, Second is Standard Charter Bank and the last one is Bank of China (^_^)$$cause they're pretty!!$$permission to repost? thanks$$3 banks allow to produce the money$$shows how  colourful  hk is$$Color full and make image of HK.$$Old 50hkd = purple and old10hkd = green$$Cos the banks all print thier own money thats why its all different$$i have 100 and 50 and 20 h.k dollor$$i need this on new year$$I love hongkong i keep on coming back. message+desc:
Where is it? 
Samal Island, Davao

What is it like? 
The Monfort Bat Cave in Samal Island, Davao is known to be the home of at least 2 million local fruit bats. It is the largest bat colony in the world as recorded by the Guinness World Records. 

Fun Fact: 
The Philippines is home to 26 indigenous bat species. That's more than any other country. We have the world‚Äôs largest and smallest bats ‚Äì the giant golden-crowned flying fox fruit bat and the lesser bamboo bat.  

Photo by/Author: 
Miguel Teotico/Rachel Teotico
comments: Had been to one of the caves in Mt. Province during a provincial assignment with the Department of Agriculture. Know what?  The provincial coordinator made me eat a "roasted bat"...

message+desc: Ghum Railway Station, situated at an altitude of 7,405 feet, is the highest railway station in India and the 14th highest in the world. It is the highest point of the #Darjeeling Himalayan Railway from where the toy train starts descending towards Darjeeling town. The Ghum station is regarded as one of the most beautiful railway stations in the country.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Boracay, Aklan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Caticlan.

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan.

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan.

What is it?
Paraw sunset sailing is a popular activity in the island of Boracay. A paraw is a small, double outrigger boat maneuvered by a sail. 

Fun Fact:
In the Philippines, a small boat is called a bangka. The word also means ‚Äúcard dealer,‚Äù and one who dominates the conversation in a group.

Photo by / Caption by:
Ariel Jersey / Rachel Tiotico

message+desc:
The final blow was when Dom's mother was ordered to pay the legal costs for all three defendants amounting to about $22,000.

Rest in peace, Dom.

http://mustsharenews.com/mothers-facebook-post-nsf-court/A grieving mother's Facebook post goes viral.
comments:
How do we entrust our sons to serve when the ones who train them are protected and above the law? Instead of being brought to justice, a broken hearted mother has to pay the legal fees of the ones who failed to protect her son. RIP, dear boy. God sees all and knows all. To the mother, though nothing will bring your son back to you, I hope you can find comfort in your other son. My prayer and heart is with you.$$Can this still be petitioned and overturned? Not only the SAF has broken their own SOP, they even caused a death. What happened to *Care for soldiers and *Safety being a core value?$$Don't complain after voting for the wrong group of people into the seat. It becomes, "what I say is the final word". I feel sorry for the mother whom lost her child.$$Eh fucking How Long more you wanna wait Til you stand up for what is right? Petition at least and let's save this family man. Daylight murder is being done here$$Some one's child  died doing what they were told to do.   If the Govt didn't find guilt in those who were giving the orders then the least they can do for this poor heartbroken  family is waive the legal costs.  With a few punches on a keyboard just erase it and call it over.
Have a heart.$$Very sad situation... but this should not distract the real situation since the boy had very serious" allergic reactions to zinc chloride", which did not affect the hundreds if not thousands of other boys going through the exercise then or before. Would he have survive if is 1 instead of 6 smoke grenade, since the smoke must be thick enough to conceal the troops? This is indeed an unforeseen accident where the two officers would surely be punished and have to live with this incident for the rest of their lives. Instead we should see how we can prevent this in future? As parents should we we have our children properly medically examined including through allergic tests ... before NS or any special school activities, overseas trips including holidays?$$I hope that they start a drive to collect the stated amount... no matter what it's human decency to not allow the family to pay. . The citizens who think this is absolutely wrong would surely contribute .. and happily embarrass our national caretakers..$$I put myself in Dom's mother's shoes and I felt her anguish of bringing up a healthy son and having lost it through no fault of hers or her son.

I put myself in the shoes of the defendents and I think they would pat each other on their back for a job well done and saved SAF S$22,000.

Now everyone knows for sure what they should be looking out for while serving NS and NSMen duties: their own backs.  Because there is no one to look after them. Everyone for themselves first.$$Aparrently you can have an indemnity clause against negligence resulting in death. Always taught and thought that's not possible. But then it's OUR government .. They are the LAW.$$Understand that they should not have sued in the first instance - the lawyers should know the Government Proceedings Act....$$When the founding father said "the pledge is only an aspiration", do you expect the SAF creed to even hold water at all?$$Simple. If I wanna kill someone, I join the ranks of SAF. It's legal.$$This is just so sad. I cannot imagine being in the mum's position. My prayer is with the mum n family.$$She was ordered to do it and the other parties cannot refuse it out of compassion? Sigh. Sad state of affairs.$$The parents sued! And lost!
The lawyer should have discouraged them from sueing...sure lose one.$$Law is in their hands, 69.9% want it..!!$$wtf....  pay the legal fees really? I can see what they're defence claim about  negligence (do not agree) but really pay legal fees?  I believe ghe state can pay that.$$If she can raise the legal fee, get Queens Council to fight it out.$$They said that no one is above the law...$$The part that is saddening is the parents are still being told to pay the cost of the defendants.$$so sad. no matter what,  we cant fight against them. üò™$$My goodness.. Why still have to pay ???

message+desc:
nanIt is with a heavy heart to announce that we have lost another one of our mountain guides, Joseph Selungin, age 33, in the wake of Sabah Earthquake that jolted Mt.Kinabalu.

The earthquake that rocked the mountain on the 5th of June, 7:15am triggered landslides along with rocks and boulders that tumbled down, destroying trails and sadly, taking lives. Joseph was found beneath a boulder, in the heroic act of shielding two of his guests. Unfortunately, the three of them didn‚Äôt survive.

Joseph was last seen hugging two of his guests, in an attempt to protect them, using his body as a shield, an account related by his fellow mountain guide colleague, Sharulnizam Suhaji. Sharulnizam describes Joseph as an easy-going person with a good heart, soft-spoken and always kind. 

Joseph has been a member of our team for almost 2 months. He has brought nothing but good memories and experiences for our fellow climbers. A man of courage and uncompromising thoughtfulness. His good-will and high-spirits will forever be remembered by all the lives he has touched.

Joseph left behind a loving wife, a 4-year old son and a 2-year old daughter. He promised his wife that he will come back to celebrate their wedding anniversary on the 12th of June. Our heartfelt condolences goes out to his family and to those affected. 
We will miss you Joseph, you live on in the love you gave, and the laughter you shared, in our thoughts and in our memories, forever.
comments: Salute. Rest In Peace Joseph. My deepest condolences to his family.

message+desc:
Victoria Memorial is built on the Indo-Saracenic revivalist style and is regarded as one of the finest art museums in #Kolkata. This impressive monument was designed by Sir William Emerson and built by Martin & Co, with white Markana marble from Rajasthan. 

The monument houses a fabulous collection of paintings, sculptures, lithographs, Mughal miniatures, ammunitions and other historical treasures.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Zambales, Luzon

How to Get There:
Take a bus to Zambales from Caloocan or Cubao (seven hours).

What is it?
In March of 1991, a series of earthquakes occurred for nearly 3 months, evidently showing that Mt. Pinatubo was about to erupt. On June 15, the volcano went down in history for having the second largest terrestrial explosion of the 20th century, effects of which were felt worldwide. 

Fun Fact:
The volcano's crater is now a favorite tourist destination of hikers (even the amateur ones, thanks to the fairly easy trails)! A refreshing dip in the lake awaits those who want to cool down after hours of hiking. Kayaks are available too! 

Photo by Alvi Siongco
comments:
I lived in cubao for 4 years at Annpolis street front of unimart.

Torres here!! :D wehehe :)$$The trekking tour with 4x4 jeeps is great......$$correction please you can reached zambales, in just 2-3 hours not 7 hours! wala pong trapik samen, and may nlex and sctex to make it 2 hours from ncr.$$Proud to be from Zambalesüëç$$im from Pampanga. and I've been to Mt Pinatubo for several times already, you will blown away by the majestic view of the crater. oh yes, i did swam at the crater 2x already.. no offense with the zambalenos here, but for the past 14 yrs now, its the Sta. Juliana Route in Bamban Tarlac, the most popular jump start point, and i suggest you contact the Dept. of Tourism Region 3, to help you arrange for your 4x4 (Jeep) ride from Clark, to Brgy. Sta. Juliana (Tarlac) for your registration and they assign you a guide (Aeta). what  are you waiting for, plan your Mt. PInatubo adventure now :)$$Mark Anthony Napoles i wanna come and see the place too!$$its a beauty you should see... ;)

message+desc:
Though beautiful appearance of Mt. Fuji can be enjoyed throughout the year, you can only climb it during the summertime. 
This year the trails are open from July 1st to mid-September. 
If you are planning to climb Mt. Fuji this summer, please read more about the following climbing guide and experience the stunning view from the summit!

Guide for climbing Mt. Fuji:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/scenic/mtfuji/fuji_05.html
http://www.fujisan-climb.jp/en/
Mt. Fuji, Shizuoka Area, general information
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/shizuoka/fujisan_shizuoka.html
comments:
‚ù§Ô∏è Fuji-San! However, when I lived in Japan, we climbed Mt. Fuji once......but I must say.....
1. It was one of the hardest and most miserable painful things I've ever done and I was still young then. Must be in very good shape!! We hurt for over 1.5 weeks!
2. Couldn't see the summit nor crater lake due to heavy fog and rain. 
3. I felt it was very dirty up on the mountain which surprised me and disappointed me at the same time. Too much litter left......and......the toilet situation was terrible! Not only was it very very smelly the toilet paper was going down the side of the mountain. Terrible! 

I think the view is much better from below. So that's how I choose to view it.$$I still miss my short stay at Mount Fuji - Hotel New Century. Very small ryokan but very good service. I woke up at 4AM to watch the sunrise. Beautiful beyond words.$$I hope...i can go....its soo beautiful place....$$Done! Yesterday up and today down.$$Climbing in 2 weeks time !$$I am going to do this next yeeeeear!!$$Awesome. Did this five years ago.$$I did this July of 1995! A truly unforgettable experience.$$I'll be climbing on the 12th August and hopefully get to view a beautiful sunrise. I totally understand it could be fairly crowded, but I don't mind that, at least I won't loss my way. If all pans out, it'll be the highlight of my trip.$$Anyone know what is approximate cost for this adventure?$$oh my gosh i want to go there xoon$$beautiful! not enough words to describe that!$$I was in Japan a month ago, but I only visited Tokyo... I will definitely come back to this amazing country one day. Love Japanese people and their kindness. It's so secure there, and so clean everywhere, I was really surprised and loved my stay... Here's my blog where I talk about my travels. This week I will upload some photos from my visit in Tokyo „ÄÄ http://www.travelekspert.com/2015/07/throwback-friday-tokyo.html

message+desc:
[New] 10 Ways Preschools Have Leveled Up Since Our Days Of Black & White Pokemon 

Remember when you did vegetable printing with cut potatoes and peppers in kindergarten? Kids today are one-upping that by recreating Van Gogh and Picasso in preschool.

http://thesmartlocal.com/read/my-first-skoolPreschoolers are learning SCIENCE and running their own SUSHI BAR businesses! We went down to find out how preschools have changed since WE were in them in the 90s.
comments:
It is good that they learn about Joseph Schooling, but i think they are too young to be introduced to politics imo...

"learning about the artistic strokes of Van Gogh and Picasso as early as preschool"? That might be high level for them... i mean they can still learn this in primary school, even if they want to start early...

Encouraged to interpret their art works... might be a bit too young for them since they may not be able to convey what they want to say well...

It is good if they are evolved but not so much tho... they can be taught on how to talk but interpreting may be a lil hard for them... it is better to let them do this when they are in the early primary levels...$$Mfs don intro spelling, or Chinese ting Xie han yu pin yin which make Mfs graduates big culture shock when reach p1. Slow in teaching reading of words. Science is a 1 term lesson maybe and stop there and then. Else sign up for their weekly science eternal supplier pclasses which give zero feedback or topic updates to parent and risk wasting money if lesson missed. Overall more exp then external outside classes. Kid in k1 but didn't see her learning anything much as claimed in article; On off newspaper reading when feel like it. No parent child event day or learning abt money or entrepreneurship for sure. Maybe lesson not consistent across schools. So not good to judge abt a center with just this article.$$Let our kids be kids....that's all i can say....

message+desc:
How‚Äôs your Monday going? Whether hectic or steady, you can use a break by looking at this photo of Patar Beach in Bolinao, Pangasinan. Know any friends who need the good vibes? Share this post with them! 

Photo from theweekendsightseer.wordpress.com
comments:
Perfect golden sands, pure clear waters, foam from the natural breakwaters. I absolutely miss these - hometown of my beloved parents. Legacy of our ancestors from Spain and Mexico via the Manila Galleon Trade that had a port of call here in the 16th and 17th centuries. Living here in Mexico as a photographer and historian make me value more our shared history. To other lovers of Bolinao's pristine shores and cultural heritage, please help me and other conservationists preserve this natural wonder from ruin, for we are waging a losing battle! Thanks for sharing. I am sharing this too...$$I have been home a week and already missing the beautiful country and lovely people. message+desc:
Question for Trekkies: A digitally-modified image of which Hong Kong building was used as the Starfleet Communications research Center in the TV series Star Trek: Voyager?
1.	Bank of China Tower
2.	Two International Finance Center
3.	Western Market

Wow. Who‚Äôd have known so many Discover Hong Kong fans were also Trekkies! Answer 1 it is. The Bank of China Tower. http://bit.ly/11eWROa
comments:
Wow. Who‚Äôd have known so many Discover Hong Kong fans were also Trekkies! Answer 1 it is. The Bank of China Tower. http://bit.ly/11eWROa$$designed by the world famous architect I. M. Pei$$alot of racist locals, not advisable to visit at the moment.$$Glen Evans did u know this??$$Kim Ward-Ahmed Did u know this?$$Beautiful architetural design inside out... those lines creating triangles lights up at nyt time..love watching them.$$Hi miles its marie can we be friends?$$Oh this is my favourite. The Bank of China Tower. A sort of contorted tetrahedron , or something like that. The point is however that - apart from being one of the most iconic pieces of architectural beauty in Hong Kong - this building has some wonderful Fung Shui elements attached to it. Specifically the most aggressive aspect of the building points South East (correct me if i'm wrong) directly towards the  Former (British Governor's House) - Chris Pattern was the last tennant to stay there - It's essentially a statement by the Architect giving the equivalent of an 80 Ft, two fingered salute to the British. It is simultaneously subtle yet incredibly ordacious. LOL. Love it$$The box it came in is next door!$$Bank of china tower.the answer is no.1.
I love the tower!‚ô•

In fact, the Golden Triangle consists of the national capital Delhi, Agra and Jaipur which forms a triangular shape on a map. You can discover Qutab Minar in Delhi to the Amer Fort in Jaipur and of course the Taj Mahal in Agra.

message+desc:
Photo of the day:   Moji-ko (Moji Port) Retro Area Kitakyushu, Fukuoka pref.

Enjoy strolling around romantic streets with the port town atmosphere, listening to the sound of the waves. Several of the buildings in the port town were built between the Meiji Era(1872 to 1914) and the Taisho Era(1914 to 1931). As you make your way through Mojiko, you will find many attractions such as the water & light show in the evening.

Destination guide: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/fukuoka/kitakyushu.html

http://www.crossroadfukuoka.jp/en/

message+desc:
Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
Coron‚Äôs many lagoons are surrounded ‚Äì and sometimes hidden ‚Äì by towering limestone hills. Some lagoons have tiny openings that visitors must swim under to reach.

Fun Fact:
Coron offers many island hopping eco-tours. Ask your boatman to include a seaside lunch of fresh seafood!

Photo by / Headline by:
Joey Rico / Rachel Teotico
comments: Its more fun in the philippines$$Don't miss out on this Sarah Marie!$$Next trip I'm going there$$You'll be gobsmack by the scenery.$$puerto princesa palawan.nice and beautiful..a safe place..ive stay here for almost 9yrs...more fun in the philippines$$Yeah have been here before with my late lovely wife, daughter Emily & niece Luchi Teodoro beautiful place....$$More or less how much do i have to spend to reach coron from manila. Board and lodging for two for three days. Including air fare.

message+desc:
CONTEST CLOSED:
---------------

The next trip to Melaka, embark on a 7D interactive adventure.

Join Sinbad on as he sails through the Seven Seas to defeat the evil Shaman and his army of ghouls on The Adventure of Sinbad.

Established in 2016, Melaka Thousand Tales of Adventures provides unique entertainment for the whole family. Combining the latest interactive 7D cinema technology with themed escape challenges and break-the-code puzzles, this simulated indoor adventure traces the enchanting and perilous voyage of Sinbad and offers a family-friendly alternative during your stay in Melaka, the historic city of Malaysia.

5 lucky winners and their buddies will get to experience this 7D interactive attraction, on us!
Simply tell us why we should award you with a pair of entrance tickets. ;)
 
(Post your answers under the comment column)

Contest T&Cs:
- Closing date: 16th March 2017 (Friday) at 23.59pm
- Each contestant is permitted to answer only once. 
- Contest is eligible for residents residing in Singapore only.
- Tourism Malaysia, Singapore office reserves the right, at our discretion, to amend the terms of this contest.
- Tourism Malaysia, Singapore office reserves the right, at our discretion, on the method of selecting the winner(s).

This contest is in collaboration with Melaka Thousand Tales of Adventures.

#malaysiatrulyasia #7dinteractive #melaka #ourfbcontest2017

message+desc:
Do you know the Most Beautiful Villages in Japan? 
This association started only 7 villages in 2005 and today, the association includes 46 villages spread over 7 regions throughout Japan, north from Hokkaido to south in Okinawa.
We can escape from hustle & bustle urban life and will be satisfied peaceful scenery of the countryside. Let‚Äôs explore great variety of beautiful villages. It is easy to travelling by train in Japan. 
Railway Pass Information: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/arrange/transportation/discount/railways.html
The most beautiful villages in Japan: http://www.utsukushii-mura.jp/village-list
Your Guide to Japan<PDF>: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/pdf/yourguide/eng.pdf

How you can choose the most beautiful villages in Japan? Japan is beautiful from Cape Soya to Cape Sata, including all islands... I could never, in all that beauty, to understand what the village is better than others!$$I would love to travel all over that island$$Awesome.. Wanna visit this soon.$$Ah...I hope to be able to experience this one day...$$I really want to visit these villages$$I want to live there

message+desc:
Takayama Matsuri Festival of Hie Shrine, Takayama, Gifu Pref. on April 14 and 15. This is one of the grandest and is considered one the most beautiful festivals of Japan. A large parade of 1,000 people is staged, making you feel as if you have slipped back to the 15th Century, especially because of the costumes and music performances.
More details,
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/festival/takayamafes.html
Calendar events for April:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/pdf/event/calendar_events_201304.pdf

What a holiday Kristi!! I will keep buying the lottery tkts!!!$$Same here Sister!  You know you and the family can always stay with me!!$$I want addmissin your academy, pls, get a japanese visa. message+desc:
Featuring whitewashed walls and a symmetrical trio of buildings, The Warehouse Hotel perched on the bank of the Singapore River has opened to a ton of fanfare and Insta hype. We went undercover to see if it was any good. 

Their standard room ($315 after taxes) wasn't anything to shout about. Their loft room was nice but pricey, at ($480 after taxes). We loved their spacious reception area, which turns into a bar after dark.

Our overall rating: 8/10.
Full review here: http://thesmartlocal.com/read/warehouse-hotel-review

Address: 320 Havelock Road, 169628
Never want to miss a post by us again?
Like TheSmartLocal.com FB Page > Click on "Liked" and set Notifications to "All On"

Models: Fauzi Aziz and Gwendolyn Oh

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Anilao, Batangas

What is it like? 
Soft corals prefer nutrient-rich waters and less light. They may look like plants, but corals are marine animals that need food. And this type feeds on zooplankton, or organisms incapable of swimming against a current ‚Äì making it the ideal treat for hungry marine creatures. You can find soft corals in Anilao's colorful underwater gardens, which are home to all sorts of tropical fish.

Fun Fact: 
Some soft corals are not actually soft. They're more tree-like and flexible, and can dance gracefully in the waves.

Photo by/Author: 
Tanya Burnett/Tin Sanchez
comments: Sarap...mag dive. ..d ko mlilimutan..still in top 10 dive sites in Philippines ^^$$15 min from my house. My relatives own Aguila Beach, famous for diving

message+desc:
Candi Prambanan is a 9th ‚Äì century Hindu temple in Central Java Indonesia, dedicated to the Trimurti; the expression of God as the creator, the Preserver, and the Destroyer. As the largest Hindu temple in Southest Asia, the temple which located about 17 kilometres (11 mi) northeast of the City of Yogyakarta on the boundary between Central Java and Yogyakarta Provinces is an icon of Indonesia‚Äôs cultural heritage.

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments:
Though most people go straight to Borobudur, we made sure to include Prambanan in our itinerary during our visit there. It was awesome! We got lost on our way back to Yogya, but it was a great experience still as everyone was so helpful and accommodating. :)

https://rainbowjournal.com/3918/overshadowed-borobudur-prambanan-temples-need-itinerary/$$A must to visit when in Yogya :)$$I love that temple! Xavier$$Honey bun Jack Baeur, we will visit this next month InsyaAllah, exicated ;)$$Please came here Ralph Rowdydogshiner Yates

message+desc:
Where is it?
Camiguin Island, Mindanao

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Cagayan de Oro.

Or take a boat from Manila, Iloilo or Cebu to Cagayan de Oro.

Then take a bus to Balingoan, and then a boat to Camiguin Island.

What is it?
Camiguin is known as "the island born of fire" because of its seven volcanoes. It‚Äôs a less touristy site, with most visitors coming to see White Island ‚Äì a sandbar with a view of Hibok-Hibok Volcano and Mt. Vulcan.

Fun Fact:
Camiguin is the second-smallest island-province in the Philippines.

Photo by / Headline by:
Joey Rico / Rachel Teotico

message+desc:
Where is it?
Mangenguey Island, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
The Calamian group of islands in Busuanga, Palawan is filled with tiny, idyllic tropical islands like Mangenguey. Walk a few steps from the shore, and already you‚Äôll be surrounded by the most colorful coral and fish.

Fun Fact:
You can snorkel, surf, swim and dive in this island paradise!

Photo by / Headline by:
Meggy de Guzman / Meggy de Guzman
comments: let's go here Chris Tuerpe$$Yaaay January I'll be there can't wait ;)$$Il will be there in may with my beautiful Pinay! <3$$I like palawan... I will go palawan next years ... Haha

message+desc:
Where is it?
Palawan

What is it?
Club Paradise Resort is surrounded by a house reef which is easily accessible to divers and has a diverse marine system. Near this reef is the feeding ground of sea turtles and dugongs (sea cows) ‚Äì the gentle giants of the sea. There are tours that take you along the coast of Busuanga for some dugong-watching.

How to get there? 
Fly into Puerto Princesa from Busuanga, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo or Manila. 

Fun Fact: 
Some believe that stories of mermaids came about when lonely sailors spotted dugongs swimming in the ocean, and mistook their shape as that of half-woman, half-fish creatures.

Photo by/Headline by:
George Tapan/Tin Sanchez
comments:
no..it is in the visayas..
southern part of cebu in the town of boljoon..
FYI$$Palawan is beside the Visayan islands but still a part of Luzon.$$Haha i was about to mention your name here awhile ago baby...$$There was a move to put palawan together with the visayas. I don't know if they actually did it. Regardless, does not matter.$$All that survive,let's meet here my friends$$Venjilen Pabona Panal. We stayed here for our honeymoon. Wish we stayed longer. message+desc:
Want to add a dash of royalty & splendour on your wedding day? Look no further; #Rajasthan, India‚Äôs royal state known for its exquisite havelis and royal palaces, is just the right place for a grand, luxurious wedding. Udaipur, known as Venice of the East, is one of the most popular wedding destinations in Rajasthan, thanks to its splendid lakes, magnificent palaces and romantic ambience.

Tie the knot at any of the fascinating wedding venues, such as Devi Garh, an 18th century fort and palace, or the City Palace Complex, where the royal family of Mewar still resides. Jaipur, the Pink City, is another exciting wedding destination; here you can choose from a plenty of venues including the Jal Mahal Palace or the Samode Palace. Jodhpur, the Blue City, offers you a world of opulence, luxury and grandeur - go in for the spectacular Umaid Bhavan Palace, or the regal Mehrangarh Fort. 

Rajasthan has always remained a favourite with celebrities - Katy Perry, Madonna and Elizabeth Hurley have tied the knot in this splendid state.
comments: Vicki Campbell destination for your next wedding üòòüòÄ

message+desc:
Do you know Japanese purification rite called NAGOSHI NO HARAI ? 
This is a well-known ceremony especially in Kyoto, Kansai region. The end of June is the first half of the year, just before hot summer. On June 30, there is CHINOWA (a large sacred ring made of loosely twisted miscanthus reeds like a below picture) at several shrines and people walk enter this ring for praying their good health beyond the second half year. 
Also, June is the month to eat Japanese sweet called MINADUKI. Please enjoy June!
http://www.kyotoguide.com/ver2/thismonth/event.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/event/traditionalevents/

message+desc: Whilst Bali well-known for its vibrant and sparkling tourist compound on its southern coast, the island of Lombok fame for its southern shore. One of them is Tanjung A'an beach which comprising two picturesque white sand bays separated by a rocky outcrop;  A'an to the West and Pedau to the East. Its smooth turquoise waters is a perfect place for swimming and snorkeling. However, it can be strong currents at times on the Eastern Bay.
