comments: My suggestion is for the young people to learn ..filipinos...to learn more other languages....chinese....japanese...french...Spanish....Italian....of course English is already a given coz from elem to college we already learn English ...while chinese do speak very little English and I never heard a chinese person say thank you to me ...never.....the salesgirls at the airport not one chinese said t.y. To me....but I say see see to them always plus thank you .....$$Filipino students while in college must take optional courses in other languages.....chinese..japanese...french......Spanish....Italian.....because you never call tell when you will need those skills later on in life....kahit conversational french or Italian...they are so important...coz all I know was merci...merci....and see see....which means gracias thank you....it's good I took 24 units of Spanish in college and found it very useful while in Spain while shopping  for abanico...fans.....and bandanas.......$$For those who have not seen hong kong ...here are my experience....expect a rude airport personnel who would shout at you because you donot understand each other...he does not know how to speak English well and insist on saying something you cannot understand too....wrong pronounciation....that guy must go back to school and learn some more English language properly....you will surely get a culture shock ....if you happen to fall in front of him in the immigration...but became tamed when he saw my passport marked with so many immigration data...from the U.s. Europe...Hk...but I love hong kong for their clean airport...comfort rooms so neat....I love their transport system where u can take their airport bus to almost all parts of Hk...so efficient ....no jeepneys....no karga karag buses.......and yes when taking the taxi from the airport write down on a pc of paper where u are going and hand it to the driver coz they may not understand u for wrong pronounciation of the place........always bring with you a spare writing pad and a pen always while in Hk coz your next culture shock are the taxi drivers....$$And yes if you missed your night flight in hong kong you can sleep well in their soft sofas....coaches at the airport....they have plenty of those comfortable sofas at the airport....like those of sfo....l.a....Singapore ....that is another plus for Hk.....$$The place is good but the citizen lacks hospitality...no hospitality at all ...philippines is uncomparable,many beautiful places...$$Hello lan kwai fong...miz≈∫zzz u...small place but u will really njoy...cute rave party....$$Pwede tayo mag shopping f we have lots of money pagputi ng uwak$$I would love to go back there. It's fun to live in hk.$$Remember friends, Hongkong is China.$$Alam ko na yan there we spent Our last night in Hongkong$$Miss ko lan kwai fong.. Good memories when i was in h. K. message+desc:
Where is it? 
Club Paradise Resort, Palawan

What is it like? 
Club Paradise Resort is surrounded by a house reef which is easily accessible to divers and has a diverse marine system. Near this reef is the feeding ground of sea turtles and dugongs (sea cows) ‚Äì the gentle giants of the sea. There are tours that take you along the coast of Busuanga for some dugong-watching.

Fun Fact: 
Some believe that stories of mermaids came about when lonely sailors spotted dugongs swimming in the ocean, and mistook their shape as that of half-woman, half-fish creatures.

Photo by/Author: 
George Tapan/Tin Sanchez

Really a beautiful place... Expensive but its wortj it$$I been here also, nice place for relaxing and for diving ..‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

message+desc: A breakdown of  what to expect when staying in various neighbourhoods in Hong Kong.  Let us know if you agree or have other tips for first-time visitors.Hong Kong is an incredible city and what I consider the gateway to Asia. Just about every local speaks English here so for first-time travellers to Asia,...
comments:
Stayed at Largos Hotel near Nathan Road during my first visit and I must say the location is perfect! Fact: For my three-day stay I toured around the city by foot. The only times I rode public transportation were from the Ferry Port going to my hotel and Bus going to the airport. I think t'was a great experience. I really enjoyed the hustle and bustle of the city coz my hometown is pretty much laid back and HK is quite the opposite! Will be back soon for sure!$$Usually i live near causeway bay mtr or, better for me, near tin hau mtr, whitfield Street.  Some tips: West Kowloon culture park...if you Like running go to quarry bay riveraide park so tou can enjoy also a view og kowloon bay. Take the bus from Central to repulse bay and Stanley market...then catch up some small beach for enjoy sun and quiet...come back to North and take a walking on the Mid Levels...then stop for get some good and drink there. Go to Tsim Sha Tsui At 8pm and enjoy the simphony of lights, so nice and so commercial..then so annoying maybe! Don't miss to taste an egg tart and take the ferry to come back to Island.$$I've always stayed in Hotels on, or near to Nathan Road. Everything from the various Markets to high end shopping. And the McDonalds (for the western palate). However, I'd like to try staying across the water next time. Maybe down near the Ding-ding tracks.$$We stayed at Courtyard Marriott in Sha Tin.  A little out of the way but if you time it right, there is a free shuttle that takes you to TST and back.  During our 2 weeks there, we really enjoyed this hotel especially the executive lounge - great snacks and drinks for free!$$You missed my favourite place to stay in HK which I'm not mentioning- you mentioned places around it- as I don't want it any better known than it is! :)$$Langham place (cordis) most amazing hotel I have ever stayed in. Will be staying again in december and staying for nye. Love mongkok$$Lulu and Gamme loves Hong Kong in the world ‚úàÔ∏è ‚õ© üçú ‚òÄÔ∏è$$Tin Hau...great hotel Butterfly On Victoria, close to good restaurants, Victoria Park, easy to get everywhere else by tram/mtr, Would stay there again$$I love staying in Causeway Bay/ Tin Hau side - L'Hotel or Metropark are both amazing - stones throw from the MTR, a few minutes away by MTR to Central and TST.  Nice to be out of the complete hustle and bustle but feel like you are in the midst of HK.  Great bus links and eateries around as well as having amazing views of the park and harbour.  Definetely my choice whenever we visit :)$$These places are obvious locations and for tourists who want it safe but where money is not an issue. Other locations next to these locations such as Sheung Wan, Causeway Bay, Hung Hum, and even Tung Chung, are cheaper and just as convenient. The author should explore more than where all the tourists go.$$Loved the Excelsior Hotel on causeway bay . Hotel overlooks the noon day gun which is fired everyday at 12 noon$$Tips for whom travel by themselves to HK in the first time are to ask any information at the booth for visitors at the airport (a red booth), they advise clearly and stay in hostels in Mong Kok not expensive.$$Every time I've stayed in HK it's been at Garden View on McDonnell St, Central and it's a short walk down to the Peak Tram, a little further and you can walk to Central or Admiralty/ Pacific Plaza. Have to agree with the review.$$Courtyard at Connaught Rd. I loved walking around and discovered by accident the elevated walkways. Incredible. And I know not related, but JW Marriott in Macau is awesome. You can access all the pools of Galaxy hotel, as well there. It's beautiful.$$Had a great time there and around Kowloon$$I always stay at Stanford hotel right in Mongkok!! Have to say I am a sucker for Mongkok is my favourite part of HK.$$Stayed at Repulse Bay then at the Peninsula both were fantastic it was a long time ago but I remember it so well , then going to Macua and the floating restaurant fab food great trip$$Harbour View International House on the Island, at Wan Chi.$$Sanghati Bhattacharya Sarmistha Roy... it shows the place where we stayed. Tsim Sha Tsui :D$$The Penthouse at The Langham 
In Mongok , super Amazing$$Chungking Mansions üòÄ absolutely the best...even if you take the stairs instead of the elevator üòâ$$it would be nice yo visit Hong Kong$$I am coming. ....Hong Kong. 
Can anybody suggest me for stay and looks around in Hong Kong$$Hongkong is the best ...

message+desc:
Gimhae Citizen's Bell (ÏãúÎØºÏùòÏ¢Ö)
The Gimhae Citizen's Bell symbolizes the city's identity with as the center of Gaya‚Äôs culture, a prayer for the citizen's peace and prosperity, and a symbolic transfer of cultural heritage to the next generation.

Gimhae is a city rich in historical legacy. It was the seat of the Gaya Kingdom (42 ‚Äì 532 CE) and was referred to as the Kingdom of Iron because of its iron work and pottery that blossomed for 500 years. 

Today, thanks to the city‚Äôs convenient transportation such as the airport, seaport, railway, and highways, Gimhae is not only a dynamic and ever growing city but is also in perfect harmony with the past and the present.

Gimhae Attractions >>> http://bit.ly/YfKLyv
Gimhae Tours >>> http://bit.ly/WZwsEG
More about Gaya >>> http://bit.ly/XYZAGA
comments: What an interesting place to visit.$$So much history you would need to spend a week there.$$interesting place to be traced :D$$Gimhae is good place to explore 'cos we can learn more about it's history.$$the buliding is amazing unique shape$$interesting bell...nice place to visit....$$i really like this archtecture in south korea i think it is on of the very best in all the world

message+desc:
Many firework displays are going on right now, but have you enjoyed small fireworks that you can hold in your hand?

Among these handheld fireworks, Senko Hanabi (a sparkler) is the most popular one.
Once you light the sparkler, you have to stay still as possible since the tiny tiny fireball can fall so easily.  

People enjoy the beautiful sparkles and fragility, and this is definitely one of summer features in Japan. :)

More details: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/feeljapanesque/fireworks.html

message+desc:
Keibul Lamjao, situated in Manipur, is the only 'floating' sanctuary in the world. It mainly consists of 40 sq. km. of wetland with 1.5 m. deep floating vegetation. The Loktak lake, the largest freshwater lake in India, is a highlight of the park. The park is also known for its rare and unique fauna and is home to the Sangai or brow-antlered deer, one of the most endangered species of deer in the world. 

#KeibulLamjao #Manipur #IncredibleIndia
comments: Please post some more photos from the North East.$$Never heard of this place I will tell my wildlife photographer friends to explore it

message+desc:
Located in Seremban (Negeri Sembilan), The Dusun is an 12 acre orchard resort, an 1 hour 15 minutes south of Kuala Lumpur. The Dusun is 800 feet above sea level in the foothills of the Titiwangsa Main Range, next door is the Berembun Forest Reserve.

The resort offers a variety of activities like jungle treks and bird discovery walks. Guests can also rent a bicycle, walk to the waterfall or relax with a massage at Dusun Resort.

For more info: http://thedusun.com.my/ 


Posted: fe

message+desc:
To anyone who has shared moments over socials with our local mountain guides, exchanging stories in the campsite under starlit skies or along the trails, I'm sure one way or another, you've heard them share about how much their livelihoods have been helped by being a guide or a porter.

Carrying one's heavy pack along with the items of the rest of the group throughout the duration of the trek, which could last up to 10 or more hours per day depending on the trail, is something mountain guides and porters are willing to sacrifice for in exchange for a better source of income.

Where majority of our provincial lands' main source of livelihood rest in farming or fishing, most of these guides go back to such labor when they have no group to guide in the mountains.

But being a guide can earn four to five times more than what one can earn from fishing or farming in a day, and that is why they are willing to make the sacrifice and even eager to do so. At night in the campsite, they take shots of local rum, not to get drunk, but to ease their bodies from the pain and protect themselves from the cold. 

With better accessibility to the mountains, locals who lead groups visiting as guides or as porters, certainly have a better chance of living, and more money to feed their families.

We shouldn't take it against them for making a decent living out of being a guide or a porter. While there are those local communities who sadly and unfortunately abuse this opportunity, there are still those who do not and are very adamant about providing job opportunities for the locals while at the same time preserving the natural habitat of the mountains in their community.

From among these are the guides I met in Kanlaon Volcano in Negros. They limit climbers to 10 per day and require permits for any mountaineer visiting. They uphold the model for responsible mountaineering.

Photo and Story: Nella Lomotan (@nellal on Instagram)

#TourismStoriesPHL
#itsmorefunintjePhilippines
#VisitPhilippinesAgain2016
comments: Kind hearts they have; &.. You must understand your comment - "We shouldn't take it against them for making a decent living out of being a guide or a porter." I find quite obsurd. People that work as Guides,Rangers etc... In other countries such as Australia & New Zealand get paid quite good money & love their jobs.However I understand your meaning, with the little to no pay these great people endure. This is actually a dream job in many peoples opinions. It is good that they want to provide job opportunities in these communities. Magaling!$$Don't forget to give them a good tip too because guides and porters don't make much. Ditto for waiters. Be generous.$$Yeah I drink rum for the pain as well lol

They live their entire lives in factory farm conditions. They have no freedom, no affection, nothing that makes them feel good. And they‚Äôll be butchered so humans can eat their meat.

I have to be honest regardless of some cruel and archaic cultural tradition I do not understand why this practice is allowed to continue. I know there are many animal rescue groups who are trying desperately to stop the senseless abuse, cruelty and butchering of these poor animals.

It is my hope that continued pressure by animal rights groups, and a loud voice from various media groups, including Social Media will help but an end to the blight of these animals. Your voice would be greatly appreciated.
Regards

message+desc:
Tamatsukuri Onsen is one of the famous hot spring resorts in Shimane prefecture which is located in the western part of Japan. It is said that this hot springs has the effect of beautifying your skin.
You can also enjoy a natural foot bath along Tamayu River in the area for free.
 
About 1,000 bamboo lanterns will be illuminated by the river from 6:30 pm to 10:30 pm until September 30.
If you stay at the onsen area, borrow a lantern at the Ryokan, and enjoy an evening walk!

message+desc:
Where is it?
Apo Island, Negros Oriental

What is it?
Both a volcanic island and a marine reserve, this island has become a favorite diving destination in the southern Philippines. Its most popular site is Coconut, where sea turtles and sea snakes are regulars. But the spotlight belongs to the small-bodied white tip reef sharks which only grow up to five feet long.

Fun Fact:
If you fancy corals, you‚Äôll love this place. Most of the country‚Äôs 400+ species can be found in this small space.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department Philippines / Jao Bautista

An hour boatride from Dumaguete.$$Come visit and more more picture coming in the Philippines..$$It's more fun in the Philippines!!proud to be pinoy! :)$$Miss that island use to have no electricity man and nature in its purest form..... That was 12 years ago......:)$$We enjoyed snorkelling in Apo Island , beautiful place........

Will visit again soon  $$Been there with my family. My kids loved diving with the turtles (pawikan).  :)$$1 of my wish list places see u soon;-)$$I live there :) so lucky$$Samson Franklin please refer to our Social Media Guidelines to avoic getting banned from this page. Thank you!$$This island is not Apo...$$Here's the trip me and my Husband @ Apo Island Last year, and we're looking forward for the next trip back home.$$Was with my family there very nice and diving is amazing there.

Posing at the foot of the tunnel seems picturesque. But please note that bikers will come down this slope from your back at high speeds. The transition from light to dark (in the tunnel) will make it difficult for bikers to see anybody standing in the middle of the trail.$$Ubin next!

message+desc:
Just how Pinoy are you? Check out this link and see if you or anyone you know still practice these traditions such as playing Filipino games like "piko" and "patintero". Share this with fellow Pinoys around the world and keep these uniquely Filipino customs alive! 

http://www.filipiknow.net/philippine-icons-and-traditions-that-are-disappearing/Modern times are threatening to wipe out these things that have made us uniquely Filipino.

Honestly, who would miss riding the calesa? I wouldn't and if there's a better alternative to the jeepney so much the better. Something more environmentally-friendly and road-safe please. Lastly, no - I won't miss traditional Filipino courtship. The writer must probably be based in Metro Manila because Filipino games and the pagmamano are still alive. Moreover, majority of Filipino children do not have gadgets and thus are still playing traditional games. Almost every weekend it takes all my patience not to shoo the children who play taguan, bahay-bahayan, and langit-lupa in front of our house.  There's also a big difference between spirituality and religiosity. Filipinos may be becoming less religious but not less spiritual.$$Yes Ferdinand, if you go to Fresno in my brothers house all the younger ones kiss the hand of the elders. Sabi panga ni mrs. Hernandez Dito lang soya nakakita ng maroon pa nagmana no. Ferdinand gumaganda. You look like your daddy Mano mayo. God bless.$$Show of respect to olderly should not be dessapere despite our tradition...look st Japanese always and will be there tradition of respect ri bow with honor.$$Me and my friends still do play patintero...it's really fun and we also do "mano" to older people and relatives.$$To me ..no ..I treat it in the modern way ...like we have then ..example ..why OPM na English din ..when we have KUNDIMAN? Just things and male our old with respect in our renewed visual on things of then ..as my art Sinnosamakpan ..Sining Noon Sa Malabagong Panahon ...with respect to the old in my time ..so shall be with my sons and so on in their time so the Future grows with Mankind or the people..under the shade of the Heavens ..and law of God ..in this home of ours ..written as Earth ...and so be it.$$I always insist on the mano po and opo thing....

message+desc:
Where is it?
Palawan, Puerto Princesa

What is it?
The series of protruding limestone formations unique to Palawan make the province home to lakes as well. These lakes are formed when water is trapped in the spaces in between the limestone cliffs. 

Fun Fact:
A Palawan getaway wouldn‚Äôt be complete without limestone cliff diving. The otherworldly rock formations make a picturesque backdrop for jumpshot-off-the-cliff photos.

Photo by / Headline by:
George Tapan / Jao Bautista

Who are the Hwarang Guard? The Hwarang Guard were an elite force of noble men of peak physical beauty and mental virtue. These so-called ‚Äúflower youth‚Äù were chosen from the best of the Silla nobility and they could fight, they could entertain, and they could administer the realm, depending on what the situation called for. In time, the Hwarang Guard became one of Silla‚Äôs most important weapon.

The musical Hwarang is playing at Daehangno Art Madang through Aug 31, 2014.

message+desc:
What is it?
Rice pounding is a Filipino custom still done in many small, rural villages. Pounding the rice allows the seeds to be released from their husks.

Fun Fact:
There's a famous song about rice pounding that goes, "Planting rice is never fun. Bent from morning 'til dawn. Cannot stand and cannot sit. Cannot rest for a little bit."

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department of the Philippines / Rachel Teotico
comments:
I think it should be.

Planting rice is not a joke?

Am i right? Kasi. "Mag tanim ay di biro"$$The most popular English translation is: Planting rice is never fun, bent from dawn 'til setting sun; Cannot stand and cannot sit; cannot rest for a little bit."$$Its true .in our place we are still pound palay using alsong and al-o.$$Thank a farmer today!

Albay, Luzon

What is it?
Mt. Mayon is the Philippines's most popular volcano, renowned for its almost perfectly-shaped cone.

Fun Fact:
Locals also refer to the volcano as Bulkang Magayon or "beautiful volcano."

Photo by George Tapan

message+desc:
CHICHIBU YOMATSURI (Chichibu Night Festival) is famous for its giant parade floats with lantern and its fireworks in winter. 
The festival is held on December 2nd and 3rd, and is said to be one of the greatest festivals in Japan.
You will absolutely be amazed to see the combination of the lighted floats and fireworks in the winter evening sky!
Chichibu City is located in Saitama Prefecture, near Tokyo. If you are planning to visit Tokyo at the time, why not add this festival on your itinerary?
[Access from Tokyo]
About 50 min ride of Seibu Ikebukuro Line Express to Hanno Sta. from Ikebukuro Sta., then about 50 min ride to Seibu-Chichibu Sta.

More information:
Chichibu Night Festival: http://www.sainokuni-kanko.jp/eng/festival/070.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/festival/chichibuyo.html
comments: Oh the lanterns are soooo prettyüòç it's the lanterns that always get me.$$Dang, I'll be between Sapporo and Hakodate then. I don't get back to Tokyo until the 5th :($$It is wonderful. a shame not to attend. I hope to go next year :-)

message+desc: The Potala Palace in Lhasa, Tibet and among the #silkroad is featured in Cond√© Nast Traveler's 15 Most Beautiful Museums in the World list! #travelOnce the home to the Dalai Lama, this towering 17th-century structure now functions as a state museum. The massive palace has 13 stories and more than 1,000 rooms, as well as centuries-old shrines. For those willing to ascend the 12,000+-foot climb, the main payoff will be the complex's otherwor‚Ä¶
comments: The name Lhasa means 'place of the gods' and it remains a vivid and still-thriving enclave of devout Buddhism. 425 ft above the city on Red Mountain stands the fortress-like Potala Palace, 13 storeys high and with 1,000 rooms filled with statues,chapels, manuscripts and murals. Potala was the winter palace of the Dalai Lamas and Tibet's political and spiritual headquarters for centuries. http://buff.ly/1TzcGeT

message+desc:
Jaipur, the capital of #Rajasthan, is an epitome of royalty and magnificence. Jaipur is famously known as the ‚ÄòPink City‚Äô because of the colour of the stone used in the construction of the city. Besides its oriental charm, the city is popular for its exquisite handicraft items, embroidered apparel, and splendid culture and history. If Jaipur leaves you awestruck with its fairy tale charm, Jodhpur enthralls you with its pretty blue visage. Jodhpur, the ‚ÄòBlue City‚Äô, is a true architectural marvel. 

Stroll through the narrow lanes lined with Jodhpur‚Äôs blue houses and immerse yourself in a spellbinding, out-of-the-world experience.
comments: Have you visited India?

message+desc:
Many cabin crew have expressed their unhappiness with the airline's policy on Facebook. We spoke with a former SIA girl and here's what we found.Apparently SIA discourages its cabin crew from taking MC. Is it true?

We asked a former SIA girl, who told us how staff are ranked according to how many MCs they take.

https://mustsharenews.com/sia-mc-appraisals/
comments:
You never feel like the company looks out for you, not just in terms of MCs, but even in things like just basic protection of their staff. Remember the case where the SIA stewardess got slapped while on a flight by an upset wife? I remember the words of the SIA spokesperson; "this is a personal matter, not a company matter". She wouldn't even be on the damn plane if she wasn't WORKING FOR YOUR COMPANY, CAN?! How DARE you claim it's not a company matter when she's wearing the very uniform that made your company famous, working on one of your planes, talking to one of your passengers? I left after two years because there's no point destroying your body working for a company that will call you for a flight on midnight of the day your MC expires. Because sure, my illness will magically expire the second the clock strikes midnight, like I'm some kind of miracle healing Cinderella.$$Seriously I could never understand why people always chose to remain silent and are only willing to make noise and speak up when a human life is lost.

I find that most people can't work smart. We are born with choices. Its sad that people now value more about the stacks of cash in their bank accounts then their health. A life is so much more valuable.$$Aiyoooo pleassseeee~~ Do u all know that air crew gets 21 days Annual Leave and on the average about 100 off days a year. 

SIA rewards crew with a medical benefit of $300/year( or is it $200, I can't remember) for those who take extra care of their health and not fall sick. 

No one is forcing anyone to go on flight Sick. BUT there are really a lot of "chao Geng" crew out there who always conveniently falls sick on occasions like New Year eve, Christmas and especially when they are rostered for shitty low paying flights such as Sydney, Bombay for e.g. 

An employee can be damn good at her job, but if she lacks discipline and responsibility. Who can you blame. 

So the rest of those who works hard and make an effort to stay healthy to stay to their rosters are idiots is it? 

I am an ex crew who had taken numerous MCs, prolly falling into the mid "chao geng" category and I still qualified for promotion interview. 

P.S : I'm speaking up on behalf of the other flying crew who can't say no sh*t because the other crew members would aim them for speaking their mind. So yah, dun like what I say. Too bad.$$This is sooooo true and sooooo inhumane of a company to treat their employees. Also it has become a competition to see who score the highest based on MC rate. So unfair! How can your crew be happy working if the company doesn't care for their employees welfare!$$It's not just the flight crews I heard. Ground staff, in other subsidiaries like engineering also from what I heard from friends who work there. Apparently , in engineering , my Friend said if you took more than 7 days MC, you won't be eligible for the free staff air travel benefit for certain period of time. Not sure if really true but it's really sad if it is. That's why many afraid to take mc even if genuinely sick. Dunno why MOM so bo chap. How can staff benefit also be tied to how many mc u take. Not ethical at all.$$Boycott Sia! All passengers can get sick too due to the sick flight attendants whom FORCED to work.. the virus will spread faster in enclosed cabins ...$$Dun blame anyone!  Everything happened must has reason. 
Is she playful and dun take rest when itl's time to take a nap or rest? 
We must know " How n When to discipline! "$$It ain't just the flight crew, ya know?! Just sayin'...$$hmmm... what about the cabin crew members who take mc to avoid certain desirable flight routes?$$Not only SIA lah. This practise is like normal in SG companies. Why make it sound that only SIA is doing it. üò¨$$My friend who was a SQ stewardess quit for mostly that same reason, and she vouch this practice was widely enforced within SQ$$I used to work in a few local companies..they use staffs number of MC taken, to evaluate their appraisals. I kena b4...sucks!$$Not just SIA... Alot of company practice this.$$Not the only company taking mc into account for appraisal.$$Beelin Khor please just take mc when you're sick.$$And their union accepted this practice?$$Lirong Lim Josephine Tan Shuzhen Sim Shuyu Tan Roselyn Tan the COMPANY POLICY sounds very familiar.... lolx

When you say "culture" do you mean traditional or modern?$$More off-the-beat travel specials. i've been to seoul 4 times and i really want to know what other special things to do/places to go! as unusual as possible! 

and more discounted specials too please~~!$$I took a look but it seems all is perfect but maybe a suggestion can be about school exchanges I think :)$$Hello KTO, usually the information on the "event" section is outdated.. Please update them regularly, because events and festivals are one of the most interesting things to plan your trip.. One more thing, there are still some great places are not included in the website (such as EcoLand in Jeju, Stone park and etc.. or maybe I couldn't find them..) Overall, your site is great!! And even more greater thing is that KTO always listens to people and tries to make it even better :) Excellent$$When I'm using the term culture I mean it in the broad sense - so both traditional and modern - but sometimes the most modern is the best reflection of your culture. Like Noma in Copenhagen is a great example of using Nordic flavours in foods - http://www.theworlds50best.com/awards/1-50-winners/noma and that's for sure one of the things I'm looking forward to exploring, Korean food - and maybe that's a perfect example - Korean food itinerary?$$ÏïàÎÖïÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî! Overall I think that the website is rather comprehensive and useful...

But perhaps more information on hidden finds (less touristy area) could be included. Also, is it possible to include a forum (with various subheadings) for people to discuss about itineraries?

Anyway I'll be coming to Korea to study soon!!! Excited!!! „Öã„Öã„Öã„Öã

Í≥†ÎßôÏä¥ÎãàÎã§! ^^$$I agree with the off-the-beaten-path content. I really like the suggested iteneraries on the site as well.  How about making some more of then, particularly potential day trips from Seoul. ^^ You guys rock!$$This is really nice page... ^o^ I Love to look around... since I will visit Korea again.. Specially Seoul..$$I am a vegetarian. I often, if not most of the time, have to google a list of vegetarian restaurant of the cities I visit. And I don't always get the correct informations online, either the shop moved or closed or too far... etc.etc. I know many people these days are turning Vegan, so it would be great if you have something like a list of all good Vegan food eating places or restaurant!$$Pictures from inside Korea's greatest shopping malls!$$Show us your creativity! In everyday life, in special things, in art, technology, even in modern culture. 
Tell us the popular traditional tales and modern stories that have become popular.
Personally I read with great pleasure the articles about historical sites and places as well as modern festifals. 
One more thing - food! Tell us about specific dishes, ways to prepare food, sweets, etc.

message+desc:
Looking for a new Cafe to start your F&B dreams? Sal Happy Salads @ SMU is up for sale, with the owners having to go overseas. Interested parties may contact Joseph Chan below. 

Please help share this post! Good luck with your new life in Canada buddy!

https://www.facebook.com/jc.josephchan

"Hey everyone! It's been an exciting and fun time running both of my cafes at SMU over the last 18 months. However, I'll be migrating to Canada soon and now I'm looking for someone to take over my baby. We have a full 60-seater cafe, complete with a full italian espresso machine, a brand new cake fridge and full kitchen. We also have a lovely take-away cafe too for take over.

Rental is really nice, just over $2k for either cafe and loads of student traffic, a captive market. Please help me spread the word and let me know if you're keen :)"
comments: Thanks TSL! You guys are always so helpful :)

message+desc:
Last week, we've started featuring stories of people whose lives have improved because of tourism. These are successful stories of our tourism frontliners who prove how inclusive the tourism industry can be. Their stories are told by various local travelers around the Philippines whose journey would not have been more fun and much easier without the help they got from their newfound friends.

This week, we begin with the story of Jacob Maentz (@jacob.maentz on Instagram), a documentary and travel photographer from Cebu:

"I met Captain Angel Torres in Bais Bay during an early morning excursion to see the dolphins of Ta√±on Strait. Ta√±on Strait lies between Negros Oriental and Cebu and is the largest protected seascape in the country. It is home to spinner dolphins, dwarf sperm whales, spotted dolphins and pygmy killer whales. Today, a number of fishermen and other locals work part-time as captains or crew for some 15 boat tours around Ta√±on Strait, Angel being one of them. Visitors can get a glimpse of the marine mammals during early morning dolphin-watching trips.

"Back in the early 90‚Äôs dolphin meat was sold for P10 per kilo and was a common part of the local diet. Marine species would also be hunted for pure sport, mainly because no one knew any better explained Angel. In the mid-1990‚Äôs much of that changed when the LGU implemented a number of environmental laws to protect the dolphins and whales in the area.  Tourism now provides a livelihood for local fishermen and the marine life is better protected. "

Story and Photo by: Jacob Maentz (@Jacob.Maentz on Instagram)

#TourismStoriesPHL
#ItsMoreFuninThePhilippines
#VisitPhilippinesAgain2016
comments: I'm coming back to the Philippines in 2 days. Looking for outdoor activities to try$$Raymund Gaudiano Sande you shoul be here sir! my other friends / group of other friends wants to have a tour just like  what I had. And I prefer you.$$just like in Oslob, people were killing whale sharks to earn money, but when tourists started arriving, they shifted from killing whale sharks to accommodate tourists---earning MORE money than killing them. :)$$this sailor looks determined in what ever he does$$Over half of Philippine waters should be declared as marine sanctuaries. Keep the country clean and beautiful!$$Many people wait and push for the government to take action. But history tells us better that we can each take part in improving things ourselves without the expense and corruption that comes with government involvement.$$I miss the dolphins in bais city$$And so much more can be done if the politicians would only do something about it.$$:) USE WWW. ZEROLIKER, COM AND GET DAILY 2000  LIKES AND FOLLOWERS ON FACEBOOK USE IT SHARE IT MUST TRY FRIEND (y)

message+desc:
Where is it?
Boracay Island, Aklan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Caticlan.

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan.

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan.

What is it?
With all the water activities it offers, Boracay is one action-packed island. But that doesn‚Äôt mean you can‚Äôt find your spot of tranquility. Visit Station 1 for quieter accommodations.

Fun Fact:
The powdery white sand and the pristine waters aren‚Äôt the only things to enjoy in Boracay. There are also golf courses on offer.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department of the Philippines / Brandon Dollente

The best of everything you need in a vacation...$$Yess twas really beautiful and quiet place we've been there last dec.2013

Watch an exotic dance-drama...

Kathakali dancers getting ready for a performance in Kerala.

To know more, log on to http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel-discover-india/discover-india/culture/dance
comments: I visited the Cochin several times. Apart from the well known Kathakali shows (which are very good for the make up show and the explanation of the various facial expressions), I found the Kalaripayattu (martial arts) show even more exciting than the traditional dance shows. The Cultural Centre is working with local families who are trying to keep this form of art going. It is a show of strength, agility and speed. I would strongly recommend this.

What is it like? 
Ah, Boracay. Need we say more? Since much has been said, raved and written about this famous four-kilometer stretch of powder white sand paradise, we would like to suggest you try the most exhilarating activity off it ‚Äî cliff-diving at Ariel's Point. The highest plank is about 15 meters high, which is as high as a five-storey building. But a jump off it ends with a safe, pleasantly wet landing.

Fun Fact: 
Not a lot of people know that Tribal Adventure Day Tours are offered on this island. These are no ordinary tours. You spend an entire day getting to know the indigenous people living In the area. The women will welcome you into their homes and even cook for your group while you learn about their history and customs. Ask around for D'Arcy Kelly. He runs the show.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Donna Dimayuga
comments: ILOILO "The Football Capital of the Philippines" ‚ò∫$$Very beautiful country$$Love boracay and cannot wait to get back there$$Barotac Nuevo ILOILO is the football capital of the Philippines..:-) pride to be barotacnon..miss my hometown.$$Ariel's point is at d mainland. Specifically at Buruanga Malay Aklan. Cliff diving is also available at Magic Island with 10metres high, near Boracay Island.$$Tourist trap from what i hear. check out Bohol

message+desc:
The New York Times introduced one of JNTO's events in New York; showing an unusual tourism related video. 
The video shows how humanitarian efforts made by a Japanese diplomat and an employee of a tourism bureau to save Jews. 
It's less well known, but the tourism bureau played an important role in helping thousands of them during World War II. 

If you are interested, please check out the link below! 
http://www.nytimes.com/2014/03/06/nyregion/an-evacuation-of-jews-with-help-from-japan.html?ref=world&_r=1As Japan Week begins in New York City, a video about the roles of a diplomat and a tourist-bureau employee in saving Jews from the Nazis will be shown at Grand Central Terminal on Thursday.

Will we be able to see this video on YouTube?$$Blessed are the kind, helpful and benevolent people. They will be remembered till Eternity$$Please "LIKE" our page for an insider's guide to all things Japan! https://www.facebook.com/japandatravel$$And was not Japan an allie of Germany on War World II?$$This is a great story of a very brave and caring man! :-)$$More an individual story than politically.

message+desc: CNN host and renowned chef Anthony Bourdain returns to the Philippines with a personal mission: to learn why Filipinos care so much.Tagalog, the language of the Philippines, is not an uncommon thing to hear in my household.
comments:
I'm a fan of this man, his food shows, and his travel shows. I didn't know he's actually quite fond of the Philippines and her people. 

Mabuhay!$$No words are enough to describe how i feel about your article,you nailed it right in the head Mr Bourdain, thank you very very much God bless$$Yeah, he loves Filipinos, right behind Singapore, Hong Kong, Thailand, and Vietnam, countries he repeatedly visits and profiles on his show.$$Philippines with Anthony Bourdain
Vists the Filipinos learn about the country$$The majority of the Filipinos are awesome people, but just like any other country, they have corrupt government officials.$$It's an incredible country with incredible people.  There is so much I can write about them but all I can say is, how wonderful to see another episode on this country.$$Dear leaders of the Philippines!
Offers its program to restore the water balance of the Philippines, and the elimination of surface and underground earthquakes.
In the Philippines, will be carried out work on the restoration of rivers and ground and underground reservoirs in the level and purity. This will increase the productive land and pastures (which will create new jobs, increase in agricultural and meat dairy products), and the cultivation of new forests arrays.
Finally, and most importantly, what needs to be done immediately.
Philippines - a country of many mountain formations. Mountain formation and adjacent lithosphere and the tectonic plates were many thousands of years in a static state. It is known that all crystalline body expands when heated. That is what happened in Indonesia, when 250 thousand people were killed by the tsunami. Scientists: "The joints of two adjacent slabs could not stand the load, collapsed - and one plate dove under the other." And such or similar joints in the Philippines and around - many dozens.
Quote: "The area of the Philippines is located in the zone of the so-called Pacific Ring of Fire, and even the coast of the Philippines is a zone of subduction, where oceanic crust is turned in under the mainland. subduction zone is also called the Benioff zone, because it has the largest number of deep earthquakes. "
"In the Philippines, for the year on average, there is more than 35 earthquakes (on average by 3 earthquakes per month) magnitude of 5.0 - 5.9, one earthquake of magnitude 6.0 - 6.9 or 7.0 - 7.9, then this country can be considered one of the most seismically active areas in the world. "
Physics. The warming heats the surface and underground rock formations of the Philippines. By law, all of physics solid crystalline formations expands when heated, destroying themselves and the surrounding formation, and form of the earthquake and tsunami.
The scheme is simple to prevent earthquakes.
My program is cooled all the big and small rivers. Rivers carry cooled water into the surrounding body of water Philippines, cooled water, rock formations both on land and at sea, to prevent the appearance of surface and submarine earthquakes and tsunamis.
During 7 years - 15% in a year - I chilled all rock formations to the level of 1980. There basting to reduce the damage from the hurricane, the theme of excess current, but it is still in operation.
One technology - "Ladder", which explains the principle of cooling rock formations, tectonic and lithospheric plates - I'm sending you. But it is more suitable for hospitals, schools, and kindergartens, and partially cools the water area around the Philippines. At the prompt, I'll bring the technology is three times more powerful than the "Ladder".
Sincerely, environmental programs developer Victor Rodin.$$Filipinos love your show!  Your respect and appreciation of our culture gives us joy.$$They care because God is in their hearts. They know God loves them, so they may love others.$$I'm a big fan of Anthony Bourdain hopefully hill try travelling around Visayas esp. message+desc:
Yummy! Japanese rice.
Do you like rice, but don‚Äôt own a rice cooker? No need to worry, you can cook rice in a pot!
First, wash the rice and place in a pot. Add water (rice to water ratio is 1: 1.2) and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Once it is boiling, cover with lid and let simmer for 12-15 minutes over low heat. Remove the pot from heat (with the lid still on) and let steam for another 10 minutes.
With these simple steps, you can taste soft, fluffy rice whenever you want! 

For more information about Japanese food:
http://japan-brand.jnto.go.jp/eng/foods/other_food/2792/
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/dining/food/jfood_01.html
http://www.maff.go.jp/e/foj/food/rice.html

message+desc:
Shimla - Located deep in the Himalayan foothills and entirely surrounded by dense forest and magnificent mountains, Simla (now spelled Shimla) was the glorious summer resort of the British Raj. One of the most popular hill stations in India, the city sits at an altitude of 2213 meters and is the present capital of Himachal Pradesh.

The imposing six-story Scottish baronial mansion known as Viceregal Lodge, summer seat of the British government until the 1940s, is undoubtedly Shimla‚Äôs best-loved colonial attraction. Shimla, which has the distinction of inspiring scenes from Rudyard Kipling's Kim, is also a base for visitors who come to seek adventure in other parts of the state.

- See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/en/travel/destination/shimla

Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
Coron is a first-class municipality in Palawan known for its beaches and shipwreck dive spots.

Fun Fact:
Tamilok -- shipworm dipped still-wriggling in spice vinegar -- is a local delicacy. Extreme foodie Andrew Zimmern had some on his television show, Bizarre Foods!

message+desc:
Sasangir - Preserve of the majestic Asiatic Lion and several other unique species

Located in the state of Gujarat, Gir Forest National Park and Wildlife Sanctuary, also known as Sasangir, is an entrancing preserve for the Asiatic Lions. The proclamation of the Gir forest as protected in 1990s by the rulers of the princely state of Junagarh saved them from extinction, and currently their population stands at 411. 

The seven rivers of the forest create a landscape filled with evergreen vegetation along the riversides, dry deciduous and tropical thorn forests. Though the undisputed highlight of the Sasangir is obviously the Asiatic Lions, the park is home to 38 species of mammals, 37 species of reptiles and more than 300 species of birds. 

- See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/sasangir
comments: Been there sadly saw no lion but my friend saw a panther!

message+desc:
The Bruce Lee Kung Fu ‚àôArt ‚àôLife exhibition
Bruce Lee spent his childhood in Hong Kong starring in films. But he wasn‚Äôt actually born here. Which city was Bruce born in? 
1.	Shanghai
2.	San Francisco 
3.	Kowloon

The answer is No. 2. Bruce‚Äôs parents were in the USA when he was born and moved back to Hong Kong when he was still a baby. You can see plenty more snapshots of his childhood at the Bruce Lee Kung Fu ‚àôArt ‚àôLife exhibition. See more here: http://bit.ly/136f6mx
 
Film still from ‚ÄòThe Kid‚Äô (also called ‚ÄòMy Son A-Chang‚Äô)  1950. (From the collection of the Hong Kong Film Archive).
comments:
The answer is No. 2. Bruce‚Äôs parents were in the USA when he was born and moved back to Hong Kong when he was still a baby. You can see plenty more snapshots of his childhood at the Bruce Lee Kung Fu ‚àôArt ‚àôLife exhibition. See more here: http://bit.ly/136f6mx$$SF, baby! But they just tore down the hospital he was born in earlier this year. :($$San Francisco. He might be born at home then, instead of a hospital because at that time, many kids were born at home.$$2. San Francisco

He is actually an American. When he was born, he was given the name "Bruce" by his nurse.

If he was born in Shanghai, he would not have an English name, as Shanghai was not a colony of the British or the US. If he was born in Kowloon (Hong Kong), he would have his name transliterated into English "Lee Jun Fan" and probably would have not picked the name "Bruce". 

How do I know? Hong Kong was a British Colony that was dominated by the Chinese, and most likely would not have had an English name. With that said, it only leaves San Francisco as my last choice (Of course, having Wikipedia helps too, but even without Wiki, I could still guess SF).$$San francisco but then moved to kowloon....$$Who knew and who gave an "honest" answer without checking Wikipedia or Google? Probably the ones who favoured not SF.$$In hospital  but  not sure  where :-D

message+desc:
Interesting infographic - How much money you make is based on your personality type. A complete guide By Malcolm Baey

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/how-much-money-you-will-make-based-on-personalityHow much money will I make? Most people ask this question but never know the answer. How you make decisions affects how much you earn. Find out your score.
comments:
Article would have been more helpful to the readers if it provides career guidance for each personality type rather than stating which types earn the highest income. I seriously doubt the two wealthiest individuals in the world, Bill Gates and Warren Buffett, spend that much time being social. Also, Warren Buffett is well-known for being a straight arrow.

Instead of forcing people to change their personalities, it is more helpful to provide suggestions on how each type can leverage on his strengths to earn a higher income. May I recommend you read this book called "The Millionaire Code: 16 Paths to Wealth Building" by Paul B. Farrell, JD, PhD. The world is blessed by people with different skill sets and strengths, not those with the same.

Having said this, I wholeheartedly agree with you that we need to work on some of our weaknesses to become better people. Not necessarily to make more money, but more to enrich the lives of others around us.

message+desc:
Small Airports adalah bandara kecil dengan jumlah penumpang kurang dari 5 juta orang/tahun.

Di Indonesia sendiri terdapat beberapa small airports, diantaranya Komodo (189 ribu penumpang/tahun), Bandara Cut Nyak Dien Aceh (27 ribu penumpang/tahun), dan banyak lagi lainnya.

Bandara Soekarno hatta sendiri mencapai 62 juta penumpang/tahun. 

Karena itu, Angkasa Pura Airports bekerjasama dengan Airports Council International (ACI) Asia Pacific, menyelengggarakan ACI Small and Emerging Airports Seminar di bali tanggal 20-22 Oktober mendatang. http://indonesia.travel/id/news/detail/1432/airports-council-international-aci-asia-pacific-di-bali
comments: I think indonesia has many small airport spread at small islands and big islands for instance pioneer airport,for small plane based on java island,bali island,biak island, sumatera,and many other.

Add in a thriving nightlife scene, and you have one of the top tourist spots in the region. ‚ÄîJ.S.

Stop it please, I already have a list of places to visit in the Philippines that is as long as my arm.$$I was in Boracay January 2016. Its pretty awesome, it's clean and a lot of cheap good eats  and activities like scuba diving, snorkeling , banana boating, diving at Ariel's point etc. Lot of tourists and locals. It's nice to see people enjoying their stay there. Don't listen to negative comments, remember the saying , " Beauty is in eyes of the beholder. " Go to YouTube and see latest videos of travelers. If you want an upscale Romantic place there check in at Shangri La.$$Discover this Island too, my Province Siquijor located in Visayas Region. Small boracay, for more information visit official website Siquijor Tourism.$$I'm sure that there are islands in the Philippines which are far more romantic than Boracay. üòè$$Most Romantic Island, and three are from ASEAN, Boracay Island and Palawan Island from Philippines and Bali from Indonesia. Sebastian Seasia$$Ayala Land to start Sicogon Island tourism project
by MB Online
March 3, 2016
Share3.7K Tweet4 Share4 Email6 Share3.8K
image: http://www.mb.com.ph/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/sicogon.jpg

DCIM100MEDIADJI_0029.JPG

Ayala Land Inc. (ALI) and Sicogon Development Corporation (SIDECO) will launch Sicogon Island Tourism Estate development within the first half of 2016.

The ALI-SIDECO joint venture is expected to drive economic progress in Western Visayas and the entire region as it serves as a tourism hub for surrounding or nearby destinations like Gigantes, Bantayan and Concepcion islands.

The 1,100-hectare Sicogon Island will feature a balanced mix of developments, such as a resort town center, hotels and resorts, as well as commercial and residential establishments, supported by an on-site airstrip.  The ground breaking of the airport runway is scheduled for the second half of the year.

‚ÄúThe initial development will concentrate on building the airport and runway, to ensure accessibility to the island,‚Äù said Jose Emmanuel Jalandoni, ALI Senior vice president and group head of commercial business.  ‚ÄúThe 1.3-kilometer runway will allow immediate access from Manila and Cebu to the island development,‚Äù he added, saying further that test flights to Sicogon are being targeted for the first quarter of 2017.

The project is supported by public, private and community organizations, and government bodies alike because of the potential economic benefits it will bring to the region.  A framework agreement was signed by ALI, SIDECO, and the Federation of Sicogon Island Farmers and Fisherfolk Association (FESIFFA) in 2014 to pave the way for the sustainable development of Sicogon Island.  The group has been assisting the local community through skills training and livelihood programs to make them active partners in the development.

‚ÄúWe strongly believe and hope that poverty alleviation will be achieved through tourism projects.  These will give us various job opportunities and help us improve farming and fishing methods,‚Äù said Raul Ramos, president of FESIFFA.

Jalandoni stressed that sustainability will be a main focus of the project.  Aside from allocating more than 50% of the development for open green space, ALI will also work with the Department of Environment and Natural Resources to continue stewardship of Sicogon‚Äôs forested area, and work on coastal protection and marine life rehabilitation in support of sustainable development.

‚ÄúMore than becoming a premier tourist destination and a tourism hub for the region, Sicogon is envisioned to provide inclusive growth and economic development through long-term recovery and livelihood programs, and job creation,‚Äù said Jalandoni.

ALI estimates that the Sicogon Island development will provide 20,000 jobs either directly or indirectly with increased tourism, and approximately P1 billion in earnings for the community through business opportunities that will come from the retail and commercial establishments.

Read more at http://www.mb.com.ph/ayala-land-to-start-sicogon-island-tourism-project/#m2mIhpPrVjBexJCz.99$$NOT SO ROMANTIC, BUT ONE OF the BEST PLACE to INCLUDE in YOUR itenary this SUMMER

Where Survivor World stayed.  Pm me for more info. message+desc:
Where is it?
Anilao, Batangas

How To Get There:
Take a bus to Batangas from Cubao or Pasay.

What is it?
Anilao is just a two-hour road trip from Manila, and has excellent waters for snorkeling and diving. It‚Äôs famous for its biologically diverse waters, and of course, its warm temperate waters that lets you dive in shorties.

Fun Fact:
This place is also popular for underwater macro photography.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department Philippines / Meggy de Guzman

Photo by Led Danganan

message+desc:
We heard about an ice cream cafe in an ulu part of Hougang that serves chilli crab flavoured ice cream and decided to check it out!

This cafe also happens to be Singapore's FIRST photography themed eatery, set up by a photographer. Some standout flavours include watermelon soju, bubblegum, lychee martini and even chilli pepper crab. But the highlight would have to be its Foie Gras Ice Cream with Raspberry Cake ($12.50). The ice cream is priced at $3.80 for single scoop.

Mingle Mangle
Address: Blk 476, Upper Serangoon View, #02-07, Singapore 530476 
Opening Hours: 12:00 - 22:00

Verdict: 7/10

message+desc:
Strike one off the "52 things to do in Singapore before you die" bucket list! Ultimate Drive has generously offered to giveaway TWO complimentary tickets to our readers worth $762!!

Take part in our simple facebook contest for the chance to drive a million dollar SUPERCAR on the F1 circuit in Singapore!

--------

Christmas has come early! We will be giving away TWO complimentary Ultimate Drive "Street Circuit Tour" tickets (worth $762) valid for six months to TWO lucky Facebook Fans, courtesy of Ultimate Drive Singapore. This will also come with a complimentary certificate and HD recording of your experience in a thumb drive.

If you've always wanted to experience cruising down Singapore's F1 circuit driving a Ferrari F430 F1 Spider or Lamborghini Gallardo Spyder, now is the perfect opportunity! Or perhaps, win and give your boyfriend the perfect Christmas present! To join the contest, all you have to do is:

1. Like the Ultimate Drive facebook page
2. Like the TheSmartLocal.com facebook page
3. Simply comment on this post and tag 2 friends who you know LOVE cars or you know would enjoy this!

-----
Terms & Conditions

- You may take part in this contest by commenting a maximum of two times (4 tags total) to increase your chances. Those who comment more than twice will be disqualified.
- The contest will end at 5 pm 14th December. The winners will be announced shortly after and determined by random draw. Winners can apply their voucher how they wish, for themselves or as a present.
- Two complimentary Ultimate Drive "Street Circuit Tour" with certificate and HD recording will be given out as prizes, one ticket each to two different winners.
- Winners are required to contact TheSmartLocal or check their facebook page for notifications once the results are announced. If we are unable to contact you after 3 days, the tickets will be given to the next in line.
- Winners are required to come down to collect the tickets at Ultimate Drive, Marina Bay Sands within one month. There will be a casual photograph taken with the winners and CEO of Ultimate Drive.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Dumaguete, Negros Oriental

What is it?
Dumaguete is referred to as "university town" because of its four universities and numerous colleges. It's most famous university, Siliman University, is the country's first Protestant university and the first American private university in Asia.

Fun Fact:
Dumaguete is also nicknamed, "The city of gentle people."

Have you been to Dumaguete?  If not, take a virtual tour here:  http://itsmorefuninthephilippines.com/negros-oriental/
comments: Oh-ohhww that is my homeland

message+desc:
[Fitbit Tracker Giveaway!] 8 Super Fun Workouts In Singapore For People Who Hate Running

You can't eat all the cheese tarts without absorbing their calories, but you can surely burn them in ways that make you forget you're exercising. This goes out to aspiring #fitspos who inwardly rejoice when it rains on jogging days. 

All you have to do to win is:

1. Like TheSmartLocal.com and Fitbit Facebook pages
2. Like and share THIS Facebook post
3. Comment with which function you're most excited to use on the Fitbit Charge 2.

This contest ends on 17 November 2016 and 1 random winner will be chosen. Good luck!

http://thesmartlocal.com/read/fun-workouts-sgBounce on trampolines, indoor surf, and drum your way to your dream body - here are 8 out-of-the-box fitness classes that'll give you a head start.
comments:
Congratulations Nur Hazirah Hassan! You've been picked as the winner for this giveaway. Please PM us with your Name, IC number, and Email Address, and we'll get back to you soon :)$$I'm especially interested in the Multi-Sport Mode as I enjoy doing lots of activities such as running, trekking, rock climbing and boxing and it would be good to track my fitness level, track distance and also my progress over time! Nothing can stop me from being fit and keeping a healthy lifestyleÔøΩ$$I'm interested in the Cardio Fitness Level mode because I have started to resume my workouts recently, but I feel that my stamina is really really bad compared to years ago and I'll like to see what level it is at now to have a better judgement of the execises I should be pushing myself to do :)$$Definitely most excited to use the continuous heart rate monitor (HRM) on the Fitbit Charge 2. Till now, Fitbit is the only HRM I can find, that stores heart rate data at 1 second intervals during exercise tracking and at 5 second intervals all other times. Other HRMs usually measure continuous heart rate every few minutes. Fitbit's higher frequency should result in more accurate resting heart rate (RHR) figures, which can be an indicator of your overall health. The lower your RHR, the better. :)$$I am most excited to use the Cardio Fitness Level!!! After childbirth n stepping into middle age now, metabolism dropping n all, my body shape has been growing "wider" n has not since stop growing this way! Lolx. message+desc:
Where is it?
Ternate, Cavite

How to Get There:
Take a bus to Cavite from Cubao or Pasay.

What is it?
It only takes a day to hike Mt. Pico de Loro. Though it's only 664 meters above sea level, the trail to the summit is difficult, but rewarding. Nestled in Ternate, it offers a view of mountainous landscapes and nearby islands. The best part is it‚Äôs only three hours away from Manila.

Fun Fact:
During the Spanish era, Mount Pico de Loro was a Filipino rebel‚Äôs camp and watch tower.

Photo by / Headline by:
Mary Naomi Gail Malones / Rachel Teotico

Look where this turned up on my FB page :)$$Monolith rock formation a.k.a.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Sumilon Island, Cebu

What is it like? 
Sumilon Island is the very first protected marine sanctuary in the country. Its beautiful beach has varying hues of aquamarine waters, and white sand. It has four famous dive sites ‚Äì Garden Eel Plaza, Nikki's Wall, Coral Landscape and Julie's Rock.

Fun Fact: 
Sumilon also has a lagoon surrounded by tall mangroves and caves where fishermen take refuge during a downpour.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Tin Sanchez

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Banaue Rice Terraces, Ifugao

What is it like? 
A lot of traditional villages can be found scattered throughout the rice terraces. Visit the Tam-an, Bocos, Batad, and Bangaan villages to immerse in the culture of this region.

How to get there: 
Take a bus bound for Banaue from Sampaloc. 

Or take a bus bound for Baguio from Cubao or Pasay, then transfer to a bus bound for Banaue.

Fun Fact: 
If you were traveling in the Philippines, you‚Äôd most likely be carrying the Banaue Rice Terraces in your pocket. The image of the site can be found at the back of the new P20 bill.

Photo by/Headline by: 
George Tapan/Brandon Dollente

message+desc:
[Flower Arrangement Festival, 12-14 April 2013 in Kyoto][Flower Arrangement Festival, 12-14 April 2013 in Kyoto]
The largest festival of the Saga Goryu ikebana (flower arrangement) school falls on the anniversary of the death of Emperor Saga, the founder of Daikaku-ji, and features a flower exhibition on the grounds of the temple; one of the twice-a-year occasions of crossing the Osawa-no-ike Pond on a Ryuto-kakushu-sen boat; floral-tribute ceremony and tea ceremony reminding you of Heian Emaki (Picture of Lives of the Heian Period); and several other services, all of which are held in a graceful atmosphere.
http://www.daikakuji.or.jp/en/event.html
comments: I would definitely love to attend this festival!!!$$I'll be in Kyoto on April 16. Is still any other festival there on that day?!

message+desc:
Where is it?
Davao, Mindanao

What is it?
Davao is the third most populated city in the Philippines. It's also the largest in terms of land area. There are many reasons to visit Davao. One is to see Mt. Apo, which has the highest peak in the country. Another reason is to go diving in one of its many world-class dive sites. The most popular ones are Angel's Cove, Marissa Dive Site, Ligid Pinnacle Point, Ligid Caves, Dapia Dive Site, Babu Santa Minwall Dive Site, Coral Garden Dive Site, Dela Paz Corner Dive Site, Mushroom Rock Dive Site and Tagbaobo.

Fun Fact:
SCUBA is not just a word ‚Äì it's an acronym that stands for "self-contained underwater breathing apparatus."

Photo by / Headline by:
Alexey Stoyda / Tin Sanchez
comments: Happy christmas Phillipine and Phillipians.$$I LIKE PHILLIPINES I LOVE Phillipine$$Merry Christmas and God bless!$$Its more fun in the phillipines.

message+desc:
The Takayama Spring Festival will be held on April 14, 15 at Takayama city, Gifu pref. The festival is considered one of the most beautiful festivals in Japan. A large parade of 1,000 people is staged, making you feel as if you have slipped back to the 15th Century, especially because of the costumes and music performances. According to cherry blooming forecast, Takayama starts to bloom April 15th. Hope it will be blooming little earlier than the forecast, and could enjoy the beautiful cherry blossom at the festival!
Location
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/gifu/takayama.html
Detail information
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/festival/takayamafes.html
¬©Takayama City

  very unique experience !$$Is the parade going to be held both days? 14 & 15?

message+desc:
[New] 11 Things You Will Only See In Singapore During Chinese New Year 

CNY is celebrated across Asia. But only in Singapore do we go crazy over a special kinda magic that is Twister Fries, and endure 3-hour queues for the mother of all Bak Kwa.

message+desc:
Hita Gion Festival will be held July 27 (Sat.) and 28 (Sun.) at Hita City, Oita pref. This festival has been a tradition for 300 years and is designated as an intangible folklore cultural asset by the country. There will be a parade of 4 flouts from Mameda district, 2 floats from Kuma district, 2 floats from Takeda district, and 10m high Heisei float during this festival.
Photo Courtesy: Oita Prefecture and Hita city
Destination guide:

message+desc:
If there is just one thing you read about the Paris attacks today, make it this.

This is dedicated to all our Muslim friends out there who now have to bear the world's hatred. It should be directed at Terrorists, not Muslims. But sadly, people are going to generalise.

It is unfair that a tiny group with a distorted view of religion could cause so much distress to both Muslims and Non-Muslims.
comments:
Please be aware that The Islamic State aka ISIS (Islamic State of Iraq & Syria) does not & will not represent all Muslim & Islam as a religion.

No religion preach violence or to harm others nor themselves. Terrorism is not an religion but an act of immorality against humanity & everything good that comes out from Peace.

We all must be educated to know this difference & not be misled.

News & media are using 'Islamic State' because that's what the terrorist group called themselves. Technically it isn't wrong but many whom are not aware might be mislead into relating Islam as a religion supporting such act of evil. It is ISIS agenda to create more hatred & making believe that all Muslims are apart of them. Creating a greater social diversity & unrest among people, nations & religions.

We as an individual can help to spread the understanding. A small action against terrorism, help to keep humanity & harmony in place. We are all a part of something bigger. Fight terrorism!

#SpreadTheWords$$Rest In Peace . My follow Bro . 
There no hatred towards Muslim or any religion .

And I think most of us know that's a crock!$$Fact check please, this is a hoax.$$I had read about the security guard but my understanding it was his wish to stay out of the media. Brave man to turn the bomber away, smart man to turn the media away.$$This story is a hoax  . There was a guard by that name was there , but he did not confront the bomber . From the article , http://www.wsj.com/articles/attacker-tried-to-enter-paris-stadium-but-was-turned-away-1447520571 -  " Zouheir, who was stationed by the players‚Äô tunnel, said he was briefed on the sequence by the security frisking team at the gate."  R.I.P.$$Shibli Zaman Yr post has gone far n wide.. üòÇ Alhamdullilah.. thxs for the beautiful post bro.. you put it out perfectly.$$Zaman, the author is now convinced that lots of people DO CARE.

message+desc:
The RSAF Open House 2016 is back this weekend and it's completely FREE to visit!

Ths TSL team went down to explore Paya Lebar Air Base and here's what to expect! There's also rock climbing, air shows and the chance to sit in four different planes. You even get to sit in a cockpit! Kids will be entertained by the booths at the carnival section.

Location: Paya Lebar Air Base (PLAB) 
Date & Time: 21 & 22 May, 9am to 6pm daily

Follow TheSmartLocal.com and you'll never run out of things to do!

Getting There:

Free Shuttle Buses with RSAF-issued authorised bus labels from Eunos Bus Interchange and Kovan Hub (Shuttle bus operation starts at 8.30 am and ends at 5:30 pm at both locations. Buses leave both locations at 10-minute intervals.)

SBS Bus No. 90 (please refer to the SBS Bus operation timings). Visitors should alight at Air Force Museum.
Registered Taxis with the Land Transport Authority, i.e. taxis from Comfort, CityCab, SMRT, Trans-Cab, Premier and Prime.

Model: Symone Maria Oei

message+desc:
Do you like Japanese Tea?
Now is just in the Japanese tea-picking season. 
You can see the tea plantation through the window of Tokaido Shinkansen, bullet train in the Shizuoka area.
Besides Shizuoka, there are several famous tea plantations in Japan, such as Uji (Kyoto), Yame (Fukuoka), Ureshino (Saga), Chiran (Kagoshima) etc. 
You can enjoy really first tea "Shincha" at the moment. Fresh and tasty!!  

Related Information;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/shizuoka/shizuoka_city.html

message+desc:
Here‚Äôs a challenge to the foodies out there: if our street food was described like how they do it in a five-star restaurant, would you still be able to guess correctly which dish is which? Click on the link and take the test! 

http://www.buzzfeed.com/isabellelaureta/hardboiled-egg-surprise?utm_term=.odWgx7vKRY#.rlazyDpz8The bamboo stick furthest from your plate is meant for the first course.
comments: I love pinoy food, but the problem I hear a lot is the presentation.  If you don't know pinoy food it does not always look yummy.  Most people who are not familiar with pinoy food always try the "safe" dishes, like adobo, or lumpia.  The real good stuff though like kare-kare and sinagang, or palabok looks not so appetizing .  It's hard to convince my friends to try them, but once they do, they always like it.  Oh man I'm getting hungry right now!$$I just came back from Maynila last weekend, I enjoy Pinoy food except those which has Pork in them...like sinigang ng tangigue, bulalo, pancit canton with bokchoy, bangus, pinakbet etc...would be going again there soonest...coz it's very near from my place i.e around 1:30hour flight only (KK-MANILA)...brilliant!!! üòÄ$$The banana cue photo is terribly unappetizing. And no, sorbetes =/= "sorbet". That would be like saying ice cream=sorbet. Sorbetes is actually flavored coconut ice cream.$$This is turon....(Banana Saba wrap in wrapper with sugar to taste @ Fry)...street foods like our isaw @ barbeque in variety part like ,chicken  addidas,wing,leg @ isaw @ a  lot more..?    yummy ...!$$i'm gonna sell them on sept.27, 2015 at miyanomori church, muroran please come everyone!$$Got everything right except #10 I thought Walkman is BBQ chicken head$$That's our native delicacies called Turon. It's made of native banana called Saba, rolled over on brown sugar and taste better if you will add chopped ripe jackfruit before wrapping them on flour tortilla like wrappers. Sprinkled with brown sugar to caramelized it. Good with tea.$$Try it to showcase it to the world!$$Yes they do, but more like international dish.with more meat ...

message+desc:
Its the season of Dabai. What is Dabai, you may ask?  :)

It is a native fruit of Sarawak harvested by local natives and sold it in the native market. The fruit is also called 'Sibu olive', 'black olive' or 'tropical olive'.

The dabai is a large tree growing up to 20m high. it is a course tree with a tall straight trunk, big stems and branches, and large compound leaves. Being dioeciously, there are male and female trees. 

Want to try? Only available in Sarawak...  :)

posted by: fe

message+desc: Here‚Äôs another language lesson! When dating a Filipino, these terms will come in handy. Know what an ‚ÄúAfam‚Äù is, as well as the difference between ‚Äúsyota‚Äù and ‚ÄúM.U.‚ÄùFrom the early stage of M.U. to the steady sureness of jowa
comments:
These are slipped away words just like tongue twister...pls. don't misunderstand...typist filipino language & had a similarity with slang am. Words.
Sa atin parang alyas pero hindi naman maganda o d naman pangit ang ibig sabihin depende kung paano mo sinabi o ginamit yong salita.
MU at Afam bago sa pandinig ko pero yong syota at dyowa...dati na iyan.
Sound humor for those who heard it but sometime they react too how and why they say such things.
I called it word expo or word speed.Real wordd can expand to another words either similar or opposite meaning...guaranteed.
How fascinating for filipinos...they can speak and understand so many language and blend well...it is hard too for them but they try..Think!
Part of Growth and Survival...So many dialect...
Kaya naman mabilis din ang learning kung tama din ang pagturo sa tamang panahon.
Ako'y isang Pinoy sa Puso at Diwa...sabi nga nila kahit ako'y isa na ring estranghero sa aking bansa.
Knowing Philippines in Better Times.$$It would be nice, for us foreigners, if you used only one language and not mixed it all up. Newspaper headline = English, article = Tagalog. I know of no other country that does this.
(This is humourous I hope - only in the Philippines) :)$$Well let me tell you I dated a felipino later married  him and I sure as heck didn't and still don't know what those words mean and don't care to know and have been married to him going on 15 yrs, so that is such malarkey.$$Today March 16, 2016 is the 495th anniversary year of "discovery" of Ferdinand Magellan-led expedition of the PHILIPPINES...But here below are some old names the Philippines once called then by different people and resources.

* Islands in the Far East---- by the ancient mapmakers ( collective term for islands that includes Guam, Hong kong, Japan,Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia, Taiwan,Korea)
* Cibabao/ Tandaya-----------by ancient Filipinos who lived in Samar, When Magellan came.
* Sulot------------------------------by ancient Filipinos who lived in Sulu when Arab Muslim came in 1380's.
* Ma-i;  Lu-Song; or San Tao--by ancient Chinese 
* Maniolas-------------------------by ancient Greek map of Claude Ptolemy
* Baroussai------------------------by Greek sailor Hippalus
* Sri Vijaya-------------------------by ancient Hindu Indians (esp. Visayan Islands)
* Suvanardvipa-------------------by ancient Bharat Indians
* Selurung-------------------------by ancient Malaysians
* Seludong------------------------by ancient Muslim Indonesians
* Mahardlika----------------------by ancient Hindu Mainland South East Asians.
* Luzones-------------------------by ancient Japanese 
* Islas Ponientes--------------- by the people of Europe
* Islas del Oriente---------------by the people of Europe also
* Las Islas de San Lazaro--- by Ferdinand Magellan        (1521)
* Las Islas de Felipinas-------by Ruy Lopez de Villalobos (1543)
* Republica Filipina------------by Philippine revolutionary government of 1898
* Philippine Islands-------------by Americans$$If you are going to date a pinay you will learn what tampo is. Hahaha.$$Start with MU "mutual friends" then ends with MU too "Malabong Usapan" Lol$$First time to hear afAm ?
