message+desc:
Where is it? 
Olango Islands, Cebu

What is it? 
This island group is composed of the main Olango Island and its six satellite islets. The site is a wildlife sanctuary that serves as a pit stop for migratory birds that come from as far as China, Japan and Siberia.

How to get there: 
Fly into Cebu from Hongkong, Singapore, Narita, Incheon, or any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus to Cebu from either Dumaguete or Bacolod. Or take your car via a Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry.

Or take a boat to Cebu from Manila or any major city in Visayas and Mindanao.

Fun Fact: 
The seven islands of the Olango group are joined together by a continuous reef. This makes the site a nice diving spot as well.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Tourism Department Philippines / Jao Bautista
comments: This bird are nice what it..

Laguna de Bay is the country‚Äôs largest lake.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Callao Cave, Cagayan

What is it? 
The mystical Callao Cave is the prize of Cagayan Province, holding seven chambers riddled with stalactites and stalagmites, and illuminated by natural crevices.

How to get there: 
Fly into Tuguegarao from Manila.

Or take a bus bound for Tuguegarao or Aparri from Manila.

Or take a bus bound for Claveria from Ilocos Norte.

Fun Fact: 
The main attraction of the cave is in the first chamber, where the locals have built a functioning chapel.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Donie Cruz / Magnus Ahmad
comments: is is the one in Isabella?$$Been here many times, as a young boy, then a teen, then an adult accompanying friends and family, but the wonder and chill never fades away. I have always been moved, and silenced. It is God's rock sculpture.

message+desc:
These Primary School Questions Our Kids Go Through Will Horrify You.

Oh dear, this is quite shocking. These questions may explain why Singaporeans have so much trouble with the education system.

http://mustsharenews.com/primary-school-questions/These questions may explain why Singaporeans have so much trouble with the unforgiving education system.
comments:
It depends. Some like to know why - that is the basis of science.$$The teacher is/was the perfect candidate for government  sector. Very losoh, repetitive and stating the redundant to ensure absolute absolute  clarity of understanding, comprehension and grasp of the obvious problem by the student, a kid, of 10 yrs of either boy or girl which is the opposite  of a boy$$Is it the teacher? Looks like the same person marked it, and that teacher obviously likes precision and details.$$Well, I would have failed if I took my psle now. Wtf.$$I think it's just this particular teacherr bah.
But from the perspective of thoroughness, then the student's answer is really too sketchy and does not address the principles directly, ie path of light, water is drawn through the roots. It's like the sort of analysis that mixes up cause, effect, and side effect in statistical studies.
But i agree the ball volume vs space one is ridiculous, both terms are practically interchangeable, and the logical assumption that this volume will displace water is too intuitive that teachers should not expect students to explain explicitly

message+desc:
Don't want to carry your heavy bags around while sightseeing and shopping?  
Try convenient and reasonably-priced baggage delivery services!

More story, click here 
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1508_handsfreetravel.html
comments:
I used Yamato Kuroneko service for my trips in Osaka, Kyoto and Tokyo. All of my luggages arrived on time and in one piece. Best of all, I just send my luggages to the convenience store (Family Mart and Sunkus). 

If you're travelling between cities, you can send luggages a day before. For example, from Osaka to Kyoto. If you want to send to the airport, it's best to do it two days before. Most major hotels will accept your luggages on your behalf. In fact, the hostels I've stayed in had no problems with the luggages. It's best to inform the place where you will be staying beforehand so that they will have a staff ready to receive your luggages.$$This is one of the best services I've found while traveling.  We have used it to send our luggage from city to city when we travel.  I haven't done so much shopping where I might need this service and hadn't thought about using it in this instance, but next visit, I just may do that.  Highly recommend it!!!$$Jordan - we should look into this when we land next time. We can go out and about without carting our luggage around!$$Sadly, the service doesn't seem to be available in Hokkaido.. Search returned 0 results.$$Very lovely photos wish i lived in Japan to expensive :-):-):-):-):-)kisses poshy:-):-):-):-)$$Is this service available in Hokkaido?$$This is great now when I go back to Akihabara I don't have to carry all those gundams model kits everywhere$$Use takhaubin all the time....so easy$$Only in Japan can your luggage be trusted to someone else... :)$$Tried it and it's awesome!!$$Any charges for the delivery service..cant seems to find it$$Good lord, how did we not hear about this Liz Wilson?!?!$$Takuhaibin is the best thing ever. So quick, cheap and easy.$$Whatever comes in the market, "Kuroneko Yamato" Courier Service is by far the best in Japan!!$$Dt 04-08-2015 Hello Friends üôèüèΩüôèüèΩüôèüèΩüôèüèΩüôèüèΩ. Good Morning And Have Beautiful Day  üåπüåπüåπüåπüåπüåπ.            ‡§π‡•ã‡§Æ ‡§ó‡§£‡§™‡§§‡•á ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É II.               Take time to love and  be loved , for it is the greatest gift of life.

message+desc:
[TRAVEL GIVEAWAY!] Chinese New Year - a time of festivities, but also intrusive questions and empty malls. If you're plotting a getaway, Klook is giving away $250 worth of travel credits for ANY activity on their platform. Simply:

1. Like Klook on Facebook 
2. Comment below and tell us what your ideal Get Away plan is 
3. Share this post to double your chances 

To usher in the year of the rooster, Klook is also giving away sure-win travel credits for new sign-ups here: http://bit.ly/2jvyVGU. 

Good luck everyone!
comments:
My ideal getaway will be escaping to Japan! It's a great way to relax and find your zen while traveling to places you've never been to. Exploring Japan and learning new cultures will be the perfect CNY getaway. A great way to start a new year~$$My ideal getaway is to go to korea with my BFFs! We have been planning this trip for years but hadn't make our first move to book the tickets, so these credits would definitely help us realize our getaway! Tan Ying Bei Natassja Putri$$Hello klook! My ideal get away plan would be one that is affordable, with plenty of good deals and cheap thrills. Then it's just hitting the spots that locals recommend. Nothing says adventure more than spontaneity! üôåüèª$$My ideal getaway plan is something impromptu to a place  closer to Nature where I can put away my phone and just relax. No social media, no calls, no stress from work. Local food, local people and local culture! Liked and shared. üôÇ$$My ideal gateway plan will be going all Museum attractions that will amaze my eyes to just forget the stress. With a great engagement fun and amazing discovery it's worth to take the stress off everything.$$My perfect ideal getaway plan is to travel to China! Afterall, Chinese will be embracing this festival with most gusto and I would like to experience that!
Liked and shared!$$Nothing as ideal as visiting a country with snow, wrapped in warm and fuzzy sweaters, sipping onto a cuppa hot tea latte.  Imagine sitting carefreely in a cafe, watching the falling of those dreamy white flake. How magical!

I digress but i think my ideal getaway is being able to try things I haven't tried, that being having a homestay with a nomadic family in Mongolia - helping a nomadic family to migrate, building ger, waking up to be greeted by endless colourful mountains, meeting eagle hunters.

Like honestly, when's the last time anyone's able to let go and just be yourself and not be judged and hounded. Being yourself is fantastic! 

Liked and shared!$$I would like to 'escape' to Australia for a short get away, can have a 4D3N self drive around the coast taking in all the wonderful coastline or along the mountain trails..
Liked and shared..$$My ideal getaway is... to wake up to my Australia Dairy brekkie at HOng Kong and reliving childhood memories at Disneyland with the kids. Samar, Visayas

message+desc:
3, 2, 1...It's September 1! Yehey! The #longestchristmasphilippines has officially begun in the country!  This article from CNN tells us what it's like to celebrate the most wonderful time of the year where it's more fun! Share if you love Christmas!    

http://edition.cnn.com/2012/12/05/world/asia/irpt-xmas-philippines-traditionsWhere would you find the most Christmas spirit in the world? The Philippines -- where the festive season goes on for months.
comments: This article translates "misa de gallo" to "midnight mass" which is a misconception. The midnight mass is celebrated at 10:30 pm in some areas but mostly at midnight on the 24th of December. Misa de gallo stands for "rooster's mass" celebrated at 4:00am. It is actually a novena of 9days preceding Christmas Day.$$my last x-mas in the P.I. 1961, one of these yrs, I will go back for x-mas

message+desc:
Where is it?
Boracay, Aklan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Caticlan. 

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan. 

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan.

What is it?
When packing your bags for Boracay Island, shoes should be the least of your concerns. You'll be walking barefoot on the powder-fine sand most of the time. And sitting on it. And getting massages on it. You'll form quite an attachment to Boracay sand. Just please don't take any of it home! Leave the beach for others to enjoy.

Fun Fact:
Come dusk, young boys and girls take to the beach to begin sculpting impressive pieces of sand art. For a small fee, they can even personalize the sand art for you!

Photo by / Caption by:
Ryder Aquino / Nikki Golez
comments: So beautiful, take me here, I want to go$$I been there before   nice place and beautifull. ,

message+desc:
Semiwon is home to water plants such as lotus flowers and water lilies. The park was designed with paths made out of washboards and is decorated with lotus-themed poetry and drawings. There's also a bridge made out of flat-bottomed boats that connects Semiwon to Dumulmeori.
More info: http://bit.ly/Semiwon

[ Photos by www.flickr.com/traveloriented ]
comments: Harmony.It is worth seeing.

message+desc: The Japanese Doll Festival on 3 March is a festival held to wish small girls both health and happiness. Families with daughters usually display a set of ornament dolls representing members of the Imperial Family attending the wedding ceremony on a platform covered with a red carpet. This weekend, several events celebrating the festival will take place, including the event to be held in Katsuura, Tokushima Prefecture which will show a dynamic ornament composed of about 30,000 dolls, and the event in Tokyo's Higashi-ojima which will display handmade hanging dolls.http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/event/traditionalevents/a70b_fes_hina.html

message+desc:
Built in 1928, Iloilo's Nelly Garden  was the venue of many grand balls during the American and Japanese colonial period in the Philippines. Today, the majestic ancestral house is still in its original state and is a favorite venue for private functions among Ilonggos. Iloilo, where the past is always present!

ICYMI, here's our new TV commercial featuring more ancestral homes in Iloilo: http://youtu.be/nQJIB4rRkNI
comments:
Im from iloilo city but I still dont have the opportunity to go there. Lol$$Iloilo's Queen of Heritage Houses in the Queen City of the South.
The Don Vicente Lopez Mansion. Jaro, Iloilo City, Philippines.
#iamILOILO #proudtobe #ILONGGO$$http://antoinegreg.blogspot.com/2014/06/iloilo-city-heritage-mansions-and.html$$For an 80 year old house, It still looks new$$Pwede ba pumunta dyan kahit walang special private gatherings? Just to have a look.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Boracay, Aklan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Caticlan. 

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan. 

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan.

What is it like?
When packing your bags for Boracay Island, shoes should be the least of your concerns. You'll be walking barefoot on the powder-fine sand most of the time. And sitting on it. And getting massages on it. You'll form quite an attachment to Boracay sand. Just please don't take any of it home! Leave the beach for others to enjoy.

Fun Fact:
Come dusk, young boys and girls take to the beach to begin sculpting impressive pieces of sand art. For a small fee, they can even personalize the sand art for you!

Photo by / Caption by:
Ryder Aquino / Nikki Golez

I would like to come back to reminisce! Proud of Boracay! Mabuhay=Bon's favorite word.$$yes Howard! you will enjoy @ Boracay... we are all excited to see you, my Sister Lhuz & Ethan...$$Wow boracay is so beautiful place i want to go there one of my big dreams hehehe$$Been there last summer... its paradise... tip to everyone who wants to go to boracay..  get your accomodation at station3 its peacefull there and not overcrowded.. :)$$yes..been there last yr.oct.13,14,15,16. its amazing.like paradise .i'll back again and again and again.$$I love Boracay, my latest wa last April 2013. message+desc: Good morning everyone! It seems that some of you are learning Korean through romanization so let's start our day off with a little tip! In Korean, '„Öà' is generally romanized as 'j' and '„Öä' as 'ch.' So be careful not to mix up 'chuweoyo' (it's cold) and 'joayo' (it's good). „Öã„Öã„ÖãAny other tips or fun facts for those learning Korean?
comments: a good site to learn is www.talktomeinkorean.com$$I think the KBS World website has a very good online learning section :)$$This is fun !! Sometimes i do mix up ~~ But now okay already ~~$$@Jan-Louis: Sites are good, but how about sharing something from YOUR experience?*^^*$$I just try and pick things up from the Koreans around me. Wherever I go I ask people what is the word for this or that. Or I ask them what they just said. I suppose another thing that was good for me was to start with the phrases that were useful to me, it makes me more motivated when I can use what I have learnt (things like directions etc).$$Something else that can be confusing is Î∞©Í∏à (banggeum) and Í∏àÎ∞© (geumbang). Look it up on Naver if you're curious. ;-)$$I really want to learn korean...so that it will be easier for me to travel korea independently next year$$@Heidi: One of the best things to learn is <<food name, this, that>> + Ï£ºÏÑ∏Ïöî (juseyo).$$"ÎûòÌîÑÌåÖ" and "Î≤àÏßÄÏ†êÌîÑ" are two good words to be able to read in hangeul this summer!$$Thanks for the tip so i know the different now because last time i heard the pronounciation is almost same$$Wow next year me and my friend will visit Korea also on Valentine's day,,$$I don't have hangeul on my computer but the romanization "place name + odisaeyo" is useful. Translated as "where is...".$$my future wife has planning go to Korea for honeymoon..$$Gamsahamnida...i've been to Korea once that was 3 years back..really miss Korea rite now...$$@Jan-Louis: That IS an important one!!$$I'm going to Korea this 25/6! :D :D$$my 2 cents: I think Romanization does not really help anyone trying to learn Korean. It's even counter productive$$It's actually i am attending Hangul class rite now..and i'm in the process of writting &reading..it's interesting..i hope to continue to the higher level...$$@Matthias: I agree that it's better to learn the Hangeul, but knowing the romanization can be useful for online purposes.^^$$@Angele: That's excellent! What book are they using? message+desc:
Bandhavgarh
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Bandhavgarh National Park, lying in the heart of the Vindhya Mountain Range in Central India, is a small and compact National Park, yet full of game. The density of the tiger population at Bandhavgarh is the highest known in India. 
The centre of the park is dominated by the majestic Bandhavgarh Fort built in the 14th century, around which are numerous caves containing shrines and ancient Sanskrit inscriptions. The park has four main entrances, Panpatha in the north, Tala in the east (most of the hotels are located in Tala), Dhamokar in the south-west and Khitauli in the west. Two roads, Umaria-Rewa highway and Parasi-Katni road via Khitauli pass through the park. Tala is a small village on the Umaria-Rewa state highway. 

The Original home of all the white tigers alive, today, Bandhavgarh was the hunting ground of the Maharajas of Rewa; their old fort still dominates a hill in the forest. These white tigers were found in the old state of Rewa for many years. The last known tiger was captured by Maharaja Martand Singh in 1951. The White Tiger, Mohan, is now stuffed and on display in the palace of the Maharaja of Rewa. 

- See more at: http://incredibleindia.org/index.php/travel/destination/bandhavgarh

message+desc:
Eskaya Beach Resort & Spa is a beautiful resort-spa in Panglao Island, which is at the southernmost tip of the famous Bohol, Philippines. It is located halfway through Panglao along its coast facing the Bohol Sea. It is a sprawling property which covers 16 hectares. The topography of the resort is diverse. It has a gradually descending cliff, flat land, a ravine, caves, and has the commanding view of the sea.

The resort is a stylish boutique, which accounts for its exceptionality. Architecture of the building is decidedly Filipino with a splash of modern amenities. The thatched villas or "balai" in the dialect, are single-detached. These are built with sturdy construction materials, but the use of indigenous materials like bamboo, cogon, and wood is emphasized. Most of the villas have individual private swimming pools. The focal point of the resort is the infinity swimming pool, which definitely blends with the sea. The spacious restaurant has a cool feeling, yet with a warm ambience and plenty of the sea view and swimming pool view. Dining can also be at the beach al fresco, at the poolside and in the garden.

Stay in your very own villa for 3 days and 2 nights when you bag #TagTheFun's grand prize! Enter the photo contest now!

www.agoda.com/morefunph
http://bit.ly/1WB4GbW

Mornings in Baguio City are best enjoyed with strawberry-flavored taho (a snack made of fresh silken tofu, sweeteners and sago pearls.) Have you tried this particular flavor before? Let us know in the comments section!

Photo by Cy Ynares 
Instagram @thebaldbakerph

Its really delicious and a must-try when you visit Baguio City!$$Yea i've tried strawberry taho...i frequent Baguio City and i never failed to have a couple of servings of the highland goodie...i love it‚ù§Ô∏è$$First time to taste it in Baguio. You must try this if you are going there ‚ò∫ Affordable yet delicious. You can find a vendor anywhere  selling a Strawberry flavored Taho in Baguio üòä (Reymart Manzano)$$Sarap talaga, I missed philippines so very much, it's been almost 3 years I didn't go back to my mom's country, my mom being a Filipina from coron, palawan and my dad being an Indonesian from bali, and I'm so proud that the Philippines and Indonesia are known as the most friendly country in the world, love pilipinas :*$$Absolutely!! One of the reasons why I love going to Baguio! The people are friendly and the treats and goodies that they are selling are just as sweet! :)$$I did try Strawberry Taho and it tastes peculiar to me. message+desc:
‚ÄúRendang‚Äù is a signature dish which contains spicy beef. It‚Äôs originated from Minangkabau and it is now commonly served across the country. Mostly, Rendang is served at ceremonial occasions, such as traditional ceremonies, wedding feast, and Hari Raya (Ied Mubarrak) as well as to honour guests. In 2011, an online pool which held by CNN chooses ‚ÄúRendang‚Äù as the number one dish of the World‚Äôs 50 Most Delicious Foods (reader‚Äôs pick) list. http://ow.ly/RzHuv

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia

comments:
Dear leaders of Indonesia!
Offers its program to eliminate the surface and underground earthquakes, stopping forest fires, forest conservation, and restoration of water balance of Indonesia.
Restoring the first option - reducing the number and power of earthquakes.
Forest fire prevention and forest restoration.
Restoration of water balance of Indonesia.
The first earthquake. This is a very serious work, and it may seem impossible. It is not correct and effective solutions there. Quote: "Indonesia is one of the most seismically active zone of the planet and is part of the" Pacific Ring of Fire "- a powerful tectonic break. Annually seismologists recorded in Indonesia around 7000 earthquakes with a magnitude greater than 4.0 on the Richter scale. "
Is it possible to reduce the number of earthquakes in Indonesia and to reduce their power?
Can.
Mountain formation, adjacent lithosphere and the tectonic plates were many thousands of years before the warming in a static state. It is known that all crystalline body expands when heated. Take two bricks to hold them together metal strip, and will be heated. According to the law: solid body expands when heated, bricks expand and collapse. That is what happened in Indonesia, when 250 thousand people were killed by the tsunami. Scientists: "The joints of two adjacent slabs could not stand the load, collapsed - and one plate dove under the other." And there are, or smaller joints in Indonesia and around - many thousands.
Treatment of the first stage. Cooling sushi Indonesia, and water in the surrounding seas. Terms reduce the amount of power and ground and underground earthquake and tsunami - at 15% per year. The second and third stages will give later.
Second. Termination of forest fires due to litter moisture: dry last year's grass, fallen leaves, dead twigs, and the restoration of forest coolness and dampness. And much more.
Third. Restoration of water balance. This is the standard work on the production of drinking and irrigation water, but without it the temperature rise and evaporation impossible to do. Emphasizing that crystal clear drinking water will provide hospitals, schools, pre-schools in the big cities. Clean water will ensure growth in its net production to tourist facilities, and will provide a significant increase in the inflow of tourists.
Such proposals, Indonesia will not get from anyone, and all the disasters will increase and the number and power, and destroy the economy.
Visas to Indonesia me or managers are not needed. Better to call me as a specialist for three months. During that time I, or one of the managers of our bearings, and someone left who - no, but a visa is not the main thing.

message+desc:
American traveler Bob Rales has been back in the country 7 times in the last 6 years! Read on why he feels our country suits him just right! We're glad you love it here too, Bob! 

http://www.rappler.com/life-and-style/travel/ph-travel/81841-philippines-travel-story-beaches-manilaSince booking a trip to the Philippines in 2009, American traveler Bob Bales has been back 7 times. Here, he shares what he loves about the Philippines
comments:
I love philippines because is just a simple country and many beutiful islands and i am proud to be a filipino.:D$$I love the Philippines. Such a beautiful country. I was first time in Manila then Antipolo. And family from Capiz.$$You're all always welcome to visit the Philippines!!$$I can only wholeheartedly agree. I have visited yearly since 1992 and can say the people are the best part of being in the Philippines.$$See you Pinas in 5 months from now.
Missing my province Iloilo - City of Love :)$$Well I'm on my 3rd time here in just over 1 year. The Philippines is just such a wonderful place and feels like home.$$my most favorite city in ur beautiful country philippines is Davao city where I found my true Love of my life.$$See you pinas this july, 6 days holiday just to visit boracay!!$$its more fun in the Phillppines so true :)$$I love Maharlika! Filipinos have so much more to discover and know about the TRUE history of its glorious and colorful past.

Maharlika is the richest country on earth! 

Mabuhay!$$I love the Philippines so much I moved here 5 year's ago. And I still love it here :)$$My first trip was 2009, and my 9th trip is coming up in Sept.  I love it there$$I love the Philippines.   Especially Davao$$I just came back from Cebu City last couple of weeks, since I come from Sabah (Malaysia)...which is VERY near to Palawan already...ha ha ha...I used to travel to the Philippines 3-4 times every year due to the proximity between my place and the country...all in all, I always had a great time in the Philippines...best talaga sa Pinas...shopping, bar-hoppings, live bands, casinos and able to learn Tagalog (a lot of similarities in our words)...hahaha...I guess, I'd go back again once everything is done here...can't really wait!!! A lot of nice places I haven't been yet and want to...üòÉüòÄ$$Even my car has a Philippine flag stickers,and 'More Fun in The Philippines' small sticker...$$I enjoy my stay in philippines with the wonderful family. So rich in culture and so humble people of philippines and beautiful place with ful of natural beauty and their delicious foods. Enjoy more all the time. And planing to visit again next month in july 2015.$$I love Phillippines,  Iloilo province is beautiful and people are very friendly.  I had been in Phillippines for  nine time.  Now a day i cant make it anymore.  Fly from my place takes almost  26 hours.  I miss the beautiful Phillippines.$$I have been to Philippines 4 times in the past five years. I love the culture there, the food, but especially the friendly nature of the people. I have always been respected when dealing with immigration, hospital care when i needed it, always prompt service. I traveled to Davao, Malapasqua Island, Batayan Island, Cebu, Daanbatayan, Manila and seen and experienced so much. I been to many of your churches and attended mass with you. I been invited to your homes and ate dinner with  and experienced your hospitality. I been to Cebu many times, and spent the day at the zoo, resorts, or just relaxing in the hotels. I have walked in religious festivals with you many times. I have attended numerous pig roasts too many to count. I have attended birthdays , graduation ceremonies of my many friends there. The Philippines is a part of me now in my heart and spirit and home to me, even though I am Canadian. I am excited about returning in the near future.

message+desc: SHARE OF THE WEEK: L'Grand Fritsche shared this photo and the news that as of yesterday, Iloilo, Philippines just broke the world record for the largest number of flying lanterns launched simultaneously, setting the sky alight with 15,000 flying lanterns. Be a fun advocate and share this fiery news!
comments: i am not happy about this! NOT ENVIRONMENTAL FRIENDLY! you create damage in the name of peace? Get out of here!$$Has anyone thought of the tangle of burnt wires all these lanterns will leave when they redescend to Earth? Did the organizers set up post-event clean-up committees?$$I must agree this is silly and not environmentally friendly. Who will clean all that flying trash? Way to to go Iloilo...$$What goes up must come down. This is not exactly something to be proud about.$$And how many house fires get started with one of these ? In other Asian countries, they do this same ritual over water. Then they clean it all up the next day.$$Here in Thailand we do that along the sea shore... Not in the city proper...$$FYI https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=347602318695426&set=a.347551925367132.1073741834.337832203005771&type=3&theater$$Thanks to Paolino Anjelito for sharing the FAQs about the event. It seems the organisers took precautions about fire hazards and they also made arrangements for clean-up for the next day, as is seen by the FAQ. I hope this clarifies some people's concerns. :D$$Tsk congratulations people for choosing to be negative over appreciating the beauty of the event. Pwede naman siguro mag-research muna bago pangunahan ng reklamo diba?$$activities like this should be discouraged!$$There is a FAQ that was shared that shows that proper measures were taken to ensure safety and that it was environmentally safe. Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
Coron Island is a sure path to natural beauty, replete with staggering limestone cliffs, fine coral-fed beaches, and thirteen picturesque lagoons to boot.

Fun Fact:
The island's geothermal energy causes a thermocline, warming the lake waters up the deeper you go.

Photo by / Headline by:
Adrien Uichico / Corey Cruz

message+desc:
Lacquerware is traditional craft that is decoratively covered with urushi, the lacquer. 
It is said that, people used urushi products even 9000years ago. Lacquerware is not simply traditional but delicate, rich, and sophisticated products. At the same time, it wouldn‚Äôt get easily degraded. Urushi is used not only for tableware, but combs, mirrors, earrings and more!
There are a number of places that are famous for the production of lacquer. Each place has different designs in their lacquerware creation. Let‚Äôs see which one you prefer!

More details about lacquerware;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/hj/lacquer.html

message+desc:
The mega Japan Food Town just opened TODAY with 16 top Japanese restaurants, taking over Isetan in Wisma Atria.

Imagine a 20,000 sqft area filled with the Japanese food from all over the world, with prices that start from $10. THAT'S WHAT IT IS!

Follow TheSmartLocal.com > Liked > Set notifications to always > You'll never miss a post like this again!

Japan Food Town is a $8.5 million project backed up by the Japanese government and can seat up to 628-pax. It will "officially" open on July 16 2016 - but for now you can still visit some shops which have opened early. We imagine more will start to open each day.

How to get there: 
Wisma Atria, 435 Orchard Road Singapore 238877

More pictures and info on the shops that are open:
http://eatbook.sg/japan-food-town/

message+desc:
Where is it?
SM Mall of Asia, Pasay

What is it?
SM Mall of Asia is the fourth largest shopping mall in the world, according to Forbes Magazine. It has a floor area of nearly 400,000 square meters. Needless to say, it's full of shops ‚Äì from those selling local goods to luxury brands. It also has an IMAX theater and an ice-staking rink, and it provides a view of the Manila Bay.

Fun Fact:
Around 200,000 shopaholics visit SM Mall of Asia everyday.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department Philippines / Tin Sanchez

message+desc:
Question: Do you know how many kinds of cherry trees are on the earth?

Over 600 different varieties of cherry trees are grown today although we call them all ‚ÄúSakura‚Äù regardless of the variety. 
The shape of petals, the color and the blooming period are different from each other. Enjoy the cherry blossoms that are in peak bloom for the period you come to Japan. 

Related Information:
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1202_sakuraspot.html 
http://www.jnto.go.jp/sakura/eng/index.php

message+desc:
[New] A One-Of-A-Kind Instawalk Through Singapore's Countryside At Lim Chu Kang 

2 weekends ago, we trooped to the farms at Lim Chu Kang and Kranji Marshes and braved the hot sun to find out what goes on behind the scenes of our local produce. 

If you've missed our instawalk, here's a recap on what went down! 

http://thesmartlocal.com/read/instawalk-lck-recapLike the true explorers that we were, a little sun didn't stop any of us from venturing into the far North-West of Singapore - Lim Chu Kang. Check out some of the gems we discovered on our Instawalk!

message+desc:
This year, Gardens by the Bay has upped its Christmas game- introducing the Merry Medley floral display - a beautiful Christmas themed floral display perfect for date nights and families. Be awed by a giant snow globe, life-sized nutcrackers, cute spinning angels and also a tall tower full of angels and nutcrackers! After visiting Flower Dome, step outside and admire the different luminaries available in the free access areas! Pro tip: Local residents get to enjoy $4 off tickets to double conservatories with Christmas Wonderland tickets!
 
The decorations will be up from now till 5th January, 9AM to 9PM daily. 
Tickets start from $20 for access to both conservatories for adults!
 
Gardens by the Bay
Address: 18 Marina Gardens Dr, Singapore 018953

comments:
thanks for Love        LOVE    JAPAN$$Dear Sirs,                             
For 5 years I am an active user of SONY VAIO LAPTOP and SONY PLAYSTATION and very satisfied with the SONY products. For 6 years I use mobile phones from Apple and that what I have to complain about, that happened to me in these 6 years with any of my Apple products.
Through the media, my attention was drawn slowly but surely on the SONY deals on smart phones and was on November 22, 2014, I became a member of the Sony family, because I bought the Sony Xperia Z3 COMPACT (IMEI 355179065283809). First of all I was annoyed that I had not sooner worried me the phone because I loved the design, battery life and until I broke the glass of the back in my pocket by the software about two weeks ago and I injured my finger , Although I have understanding that it may be different in reality than promised in the ads, but that the back so fragmented, although it has come to a pointed object, surprised me very much.
I brought the phone to the competent charging and not surprised that I did not meet the warranty conditions and had to pay 90 TL for changing the glass back. Finally I sat down on it. It has lasted two weeks until I got the phone.
I realized immediately that the Proxmity sensor was not working and was told by the service that the Geraet was incorrectly installed and repaired it. After all the trouble I used the mobile phone full of joy and bought an expensive protective cover to protect it from further unexpected accidents.
But the blow came faster than expected and has brought the camel's back. Last night as I wanted to put me into the car, the phone fell out of my pocket on the ground, there was a height of 30 cm. The glass of the front and the back broke, even though it was in the case is a thousand pieces. I can not afford absolutely no understanding that the phone after a fall of 30 cm can come into this state. None of my friends can not believe it that the phone came with a simple fall into this state.
I'm really disappointed in Sony because they have such bad use or sensitive material, without considering that there is some device (finally a '' MOBILE '') which should withstand some shock or mishaps. For me it's just firmly around held between two panes of glass with fine black-cheap plastic thing that simply join in anything. Frankly, I'm disappointed in myself that I have the Sony familiar advertising and have too little research on the user comments had experienced in the hundreds same.
I can not understand that Sony has chosen as a marketing strategy that finally we have no complaints million per country, only a few hundred. I also do not see that it enters the warranty conditions, although the choice of the material just heard of being attributed to producers and for which the user is not enough information has been advised of the sensibility of the glass.
I should point out that I will do everything possible to make my consumer protection claims and as long as this publicly manifest until I get my right because SONY  Turkey does not take any action and they do not give my money back or change my phone!!! message+desc:
We flew to Fiji via Fiji Airways and took a short car and boat ride to Qamea Resort and Spa. The resort is located on one of the 333 islands in Fiji. The air-conditioned villas come fully equipped with an outdoor shower, patio with outdoor couches and hammocks! Imagine waking up to the sound of crashing waves everyday. It was such an unforgettable experience for our team!

The best part is that Fiji Airways is having a sale from SGD 749 for adults from now to 12 Feb 2017. 
The travel period is until 31 October, 2017 and there are NO blackout dates!

Read our full review here: http://thesmartlocal.com/read/fiji-islands-trip
Watch the full video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UiCfIczoUj0

Never want to miss a post by us again?
Like TheSmartLocal.com and set Notifications to "All On"

message+desc:
What kind of souvenirs do you choose for your friends or coworkers when heading back to your home country? „ÄÄYou may often buy souvenirs for yourself to remember a trip by.
‚ÄúOmiyage‚Äù is translated as ‚Äúsouvenir‚Äù in English; however, the Japanese Omiyage culture differs from that of its Western counterpart. In Japan, people don‚Äôt buy Omiyage for themselves. Rather, people give them to their family members, friends and coworkers. Tourist shops are filled with colorful boxes of local sweets and ‚ÄúMade in Japan‚Äù products.
Why not take a moment to find Omiyage for the important people in your life?

More Information:
http://japan-brand.jnto.go.jp/
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1303_airport.html
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1504_souvenir.html

message+desc:
Where is it?
Tubbataha Reef, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Puerto Princesa, then take a live-aboard boat to Tubbataha.

What is it?
The Manta alfredi, or "reef manta," is a common animal to be found cruising along  Tubbataha Reef in Palawan. 

Fun Fact:
Manta rays have no bones ‚Äî the skeleton is made completely out of tough cartilage.

Photo by / Headline by:
N. Hana / Magnus Ahmad

It is the time that swan visit Japan to spend winter!
At some places, swans have already arrived!

There are many places in Japan known as areas of migratory birds, such as Hokkaido, Aomori, Shimane, Niigata prefecture, etc.
If you are coming to Japan to enjoy the view of winter, don‚Äôt miss the swans!
You will be fascinated by the combination of mountain covered with snow, lake, winter sky and all those beautiful swans.

Related information > Bountiful wetlands where wildlife flourishes:

message+desc:
What is it like? 
You can paddle down the length of an underground river, or go boating in a lake that‚Äôs in a crater of a volcano. You can dive down one of the deepest trenches in the world, or just get your feet wet at a waterfall restaurant. This is the Philippines. There‚Äôs no limit to what you can do on and in the water.

How to get there: 
Fly into Davao from Manila, Butuan, Cagayan de Oro, Cebu, Clark, Dipolog, Iloilo, Kalibo, Puerto Princesa, Zamboanga, or Singapore.

Or take a bus to Davao from Manila or any major town or city in Mindanao.

Fun Fact: 
Wikipedia has listed an estimated 736 "notable" beaches in the Philippines.

Photo by/Author: 
Donald Tapan/Cecile Golez

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Banaue Rice Terraces, Ifugao

What is it like? 
A lot of traditional villages can be found scattered throughout the rice terraces. Visit the Tam-an, Bocos, Batad, and Bangaan villages to immerse in the culture of this region.

How to get there: 
Take a bus bound for Banaue from Sampaloc. 

Or take a bus bound for Baguio from Cubao or Pasay, then transfer to a bus bound for Banaue.

Fun Fact: 
If you were traveling in the Philippines, you‚Äôd most likely be carrying the Banaue Rice Terraces in your pocket. The image of the site can be found at the back of the new P20 bill.

Photo by/Headline by: 
George Tapan/Brandon Dollente

message+desc:
[New] 13 Travel Tips Every Adventurous Singaporean Girl Needs To Know 

They tell you solo traveling is dangerous, even more so if you're a female. That has never stopped an adventurous Singaporean girl. Here're 13 things you should know about being on the road alone! 

http://thesmartlocal.com/read/adventurous-girl-travellerIf travelling solo just really makes you feel a certain something inside despite Mom's constant misgivings, here are some tips you need to know to make travelling easier.

‚ÄúWhen I look back at my time in Southeast Asia, my visit to the Philippines is one that sticks out the most,‚Äù writes English traveler Tommy Walker. See what made him enjoy his time here, and share this inspiring article with friends who haven‚Äôt been to the PH yet! 

http://www.rappler.com/life-and-style/travel/ph-travel/121534-philippines-travel-memories?utm_content=bufferdfdce&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_campaign=buffer
comments: Mabuhay Philippines! I arrived the first time January 1980 after teaching English in Seoul almost 6 months; I'd planned to travel 2 months but before I noticed I was here for 4 months and din't feel like leaving but took off to Thailand for 2 weeks, got homesick for the Philippines, came back one more time before heading for California after working my way around the world for almost 4 years. I ended up hooking up with my Filipina wife in South Korea Dec 19, 1983, found ourselves at the right time in the right place in 1984 so were able to buy our first Townhouse on Roxas Blvd March 1985. Now we're nearlt 62 years young loving and sharing life together for 32+ years. Mabuhay!$$The change of impressions about the Philippines isa very welcome and timely...$$Nice truely Philippines is one of the best island in the whole planet:)$$thank you for loving my country and people...$$Thanks for the share guys!!$$https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=09RUuTAM2H0

[New] 5 Reasons Why Invisalign Is The New Braces Of The 21st Century

Invisalign is the dental treatment that eliminates all the problems associated with traditional braces - you feel less pain, have fewer trips to the dentist, and it can be $1,000-$2,000 cheaper than braces at this clinic!

PS if you're interested in learning more, there's a free Open Day on 26 November at Camden Medical Centre where you find out more from Dr. Catherine Lee Orthodontics - Singapore/Kuala Lumpur!

comments: Well a pair of those braces cost abt 5k... ouch$$WHERE?!?! I always tot invisalign are like 10k üòáüòá$$just to mention as someone who has done invisalign and also a bit nosy - life is not "as back to normal" as you'd want. you'd have to put on the braces for 22hours for optimum effect (that's 2 hours left to eat - esp when you're the kind who likes to eat out with your friends), you speak weird, and for me it was the start of flossing everyday (i had to sand my tooth so as to widen the gaps for my front teeth to move, luckily i didn't have to extract any more than my wisdom teeth so that's a plus!). i still get food stuck in the gaps every day so it's a pain eating leafy veggie and beef brisket. also if you don't have the habit of brushing after every meal you might get cavities :^) i've done braces before tho and i think the fact that you don't get your tongue pierced by the wire is wonderful. invisalign also helped sharpen my jaw!$$XiaoZyenh Tan this I mentioned$$Queenie Kok Jiahui i thought they cost like 10k sia

message+desc:
Where is it?
Banaue, Ifugao 

What is it?
In Ifugao and every other part of the country, the best tour guides are the locals. They're knowledgeable, friendly and you won't have to worry too much about a language barrier. Filipino dialects may differ from region to region, but almost everyone speaks English. You're more likely to have an interesting conversation, than fumble with a phrase book! 

Fun Fact:
Don't be alarmed by the red-stained mouths of Banaue locals. It's caused by the chewing of nga-nga or betel nuts, which they find addictive.

Photo by Henson Wongaiham
comments: I fully agree. Many moons ago, my friends & I travelled to the rice terraces and met a lovely local lass who presented herself as a guide. She was so good and honest. But here is the big clinch. When she deposited us back to our hotel, we discovered that she is legally blind (meaning she has very low vision!). Imagine our surprise because we were going up & down the mountains & traversing the rice terraces. But she grew up in that terrain that sight did not really matter. And she was doing this for school allowance. I am not sure if Jenny is still around doing this service. She gave us the best time & service. God bless her.$$Facts for you, Anthony Grande......

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Chocolate Hills, Bohol

What is it? 
The Chocolate Hills are a geological enigma. 1,268 hills of almost uniform height and shape that are green with grass during the rainy season and chocolate brown with dirt during the dry season.  

How to get there: 
Fly from Manila to Tagbilaran.

Or take the Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry from Cebu to Tagbilaran.

Or take a boat from Cebu or any of the major cities in Mindanao to Tagbilaran.

Fun Fact: 
The Chocolate Hills are not made of chocolate, but of limestone and coral.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Tourism Department Philippines / Knox Balbastro
comments: Rodney - did they mean "Coupons?"$$Nice place and n0t to0.expincive$$Wow chocolate hills from Bohol so nice......$$I love Bohol such a nice city and friendly people.$$My wife's people are from Bohol$$Seen tis on our trip to Bohol,Phil.beautiful$$Been there last January nice place and friendly people.planning to live in bohol when retired.$$I already been there last month..$$Miss this place so bad.. I'm coming back soon Bohol..!!!

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Anilao, Batangas

What is it like? 
Found south of Manila, Anilao is a popular destination for snorkelers and divers because of its diversity of fish and corals.

How to get there: 
Take a bus to Batangas from Cubao or Pasay.

Fun Fact: 
The municipality of Mabini ‚Äì which Anilao belongs to ‚Äì has a surprising number of Mediterranean-inspired houses. Close to 15% of the population works in Italy.

Photo by/Author: 
Kevin Palmer/Cecile Golez

message+desc:
Caption this photo. :)

-----------------------------------------------------------------
Fact:
The highest mountain in the Malay Archipelago, Mount Kinabalu and its surroundings are among the most important biological sites in the world, with between 5000 and 6000 species of plants, 326 species of birds, and more than 100 mammalian species identified. 
Among this rich collection of wildlife are famous species such as the gigantic Rafflesia plants and the orang-utan.
comments: Been here,though just at the foothill but loves it very much,serene n clean air.....relaxing,hopefully can go there again......hhmmmmmmmm.Alhamdulillaah.

Located just 3 hours away from Bangkok in the underrated town of Khao Yai is the caravan resort of Casa De Montana! 

Glamp it up in a fully-equipped caravan that comes with everything you would expect in a hotel ranging from air-condition to a mini functional kitchen. A perfect place to chill at away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok, they even have BBQ pits there! What more, you even get a free breakfast at a garden themed cafe located just next door which serves an appetizing mix of both Asian and Western breakfast sets.

message+desc:
The photo of the day is "Yama-yaki" (mountain-burning) at Mt.Wakakusa, Nara pref. It will be held in January 26 this year. 
After 10-15 minutes fireworks display, a fire is set and burning up entire hill. The hill continues to burn for about 30-60 minutes.
You could see the growing red mountain and night sky, it's spectacular sight!!
 
More details: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/festival/yamayaki.html
Location details: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/nara/narakoen.html
Magical mystery discoveries in Nara: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/exotic/JapanesQue/1211/nara.html
comments: Mountains  are burning!!!!! 911! but it is so wonderful$$i want to go so badly, is there a similar event closer to Tokyo?$$the most beautiful place in japan...more beautiful than tokyo

Located just 10 minutes away from Kawasaki Station is Anata No Warehouse - a seemingly run down building that is secretly home to a dystopian themed arcade that no tourist knows about. This 8 storey arcade is designed after Hong Kong's Kowloon Walled City. Enter and experience the incredibly realistic dystopian wonderland. Before you leave, remember the to take an #OOTD at the warehouse's instagrammable exit.

message+desc:
Terletak di Kabupaten Alor, Selat Pantar merupakan selat yang memisahkan Pulau Pantar (di sebelah barat) dengan Pulau Alor (di sebelah timur), dua pulau utama disana. Keindahan dan keunikan kehidupan bawah lautnya yang memukau konon termasuk diantara yang terbaik di dunia.

Tercatat, ada 26 titik diving yang mempesona; Half Moon Bay, Peter‚Äôs Prize, Crocodile Rook, Cave Point, The Edge, Coral Clitts, Baeylon, The Arch, Fallt Line, The Pacth, Nite Delht, Kal‚Äôs Dream, The Ball, Trip Top, The Mlai Hall, No Man‚Äôs Land, The Chatedral, School‚Äôs Ut,dan Shark Close. Titik diving terakhir tergolong sangat menarik karena disana terdapat kumpulan Hiu dasar laut yang sangat bersahabat. 

Tertarik menyelami keindahan kehidupan bawah laut Selat Pantar? Oktober hingga November merupakan waktu yang tepat, mengingat pada bulan-bulan tersebut arus laut cukup tenang dan bersahabat bagi penyelam. http://ow.ly/RSj2p

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments:
Outstanding...
The incredible view  of wonder ...ever...amazing..
I love Indonesia..:-)

message+desc: Happy Birthday to Singapore! We hope all our Singapore fans are out enjoying the day!
comments:
We're waiting for the parade/celebration to start.$$Yes . its a celebration that my family will not miss. We are waiting to watch the parade at home with delivery order from KFC n pizza.
Happy Birthday Singapore!$$When is Korea's national celebration?$$National Foundation Day is on October 3. It is based on Korea's creation myth.

"The day celebrates the foundation of Gojoseon, the first state of Korean nation. According to Samguk Yusa, Dangun founded Gojoseon on the 3rd day of 10th lunar month, 2333 BCE. Today, South Koreans celebrate their national foundation on October 3 in solar calendar, for convenience's sake. "Gaecheonjeol" means "Heaven-opened Day"."

The celebrations are quite serious in nature, not so much a grand parade like in Singapore.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_holidays_in_South_Korea
$$Í≥†Ï°∞ÏÑ†. ÏÇºÍµ≠Ïú†ÏÇ¨. Îã®Íµ∞. Í∞úÏ≤úÏ†à. Tangun, the founding father of the Korean nation!$$Wow! Really thanks for sharing such wonderful info. Hope I have the chance to tour Korea again.

message+desc:
Summer bamboo lantern festival will be held from July 18th to August 31st at Mifuneyama Rakuen, Saga prefecture. 
The garden will be illuminated with 5,000 bamboo lanterns for the festival.
You could see lanterns in the motif of lotus flowers and arranged like a curtain, etc.
Please enjoy the beautiful magnificent scenery!!
*It will be free admission, if you go to the festival wearing Yukata or Jinbei (a kind of traditional Japanese clothing)!
Access: 5 min by taxi from Takeo Onsen Station.
 
ÔºûSaga prefecture: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/saga/

message+desc:
Singapore Mainstream Media Gets Basic Facts About AirAsia Flight QZ8501 WRONG

After reporting on Loch Ness Monsters, The Straits Times runs a headline blaming a curse for the disappearance of the plane. Plot twist - the plane isn't even Malaysian. 

Please stop blaming Malaysia or saying it is cursed to make news. Thank you.

Article by Mustsharenews.com

http://mustsharenews.com/facts-wrong-about-qz8501/After reporting on Loch Ness Monsters, The Straits Times is now blaming a curse for the disappearance of the plane. Plot twist - the plane isn't Malaysian.
comments:
True the plane wasn't Malaysian. But I think they're taking the approach that the "Airline" is Malaysian, which it is. It always comes down to semantics...$$It IS a Malaysian airliner. It's correct.$$Is Uob malaysia equivalent to Uob Singapore?

AirAsia Indonesia is an Indonesian associate carrier of AirAsia Malaysia. It is Indonesian owned.

Please sort out your facts. 
Just because Tony Fernandes is stepping up rather than avoiding/pointing fingers doesn't mean it is a Malaysian Airline.$$then where is airasia from if not Malaysia?$$lol. Another plot twist.$$I expected more from TheSmartLocal.com

message+desc:
Where is it?
Puerto Pincesa, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly into Puerto Princesa from Busuanga, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo or Manila. 

What is it?
Fly into Puerto Princesa from Busuanga, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo or Manila. 

Fun Fact:
Fish don't just randomly join a group. Like people, they pick who to hang out with ‚Äì who their mates will be. And generally, they like large shoals with fish who are healthy and resemble their appearance. This is because a fish that stands out will be easy prey.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department Philippines / Tin Sanchez

message+desc:
Peak of the day. Mt. Balingkilat is one of the highest peaks along the Zambales Coastal Mountains and Coves area. From here, one can enjoy the amazing view of the South China Sea and all of Zambales‚Äô beautiful coves. 

Photo taken from trailadventures.com
comments:
Love Zambales of course as a Zambalena, born in Iba, Zambales, proud of its beaches, sweetest mangoes and green mountains and beautiful and nice provincemates especially my childhood friends and schoolmates$$I've been to Silanguin Cove in Zambales.  Did lots of training just inland from there in an area called Wild Horse Creek$$Nice view one of the beautiful place in the phillipines view the largest wonderful site of West phillipines sea$$West Philippine Sea and not South China Sea please!$$I've climbed it in driving rain and it's very tough for its level 6 rating. Just as you thought you're near the peak, another higher peak looms behind. And I heard it's even worse on a sunny day, you'll run out of water and suffer the heat. But it's worth all the effort.$$Lots of beautiful places in the Philippines where you can appreciate the wonder of nature, sadly Filipinos prefer enjoying manmade recreations, team parks, malls, casinos and even have to spend thousands of pesos going abroad to see tall buildings and theme parks.$$West Philippines sea...ahhh where the hell is  south china sea..$$we have a van for rent. for those who's interested kindly pm me. 2 brandnew toyota commuter and brandnew toyota adventure. ty.$$it's WEST PHILIPPINE SEA üòäüòÑ
we've climbed mt. balingkilat for almost 6hrs. and it's all worth it. üòç$$Shouldn't it read 'West Philippine Sea'?$$..dpt west philippine sea hnd south china sea..$$THAT'S FACTUALLY WEST PHL SEA..

message+desc:
Where is it?
Anilao, Batangas

How to Get There:
Take a bus to Batangas from Cubao or Pasay.

What is it?
The town of Anilao may not have white sand beaches, but its underwater environment is its biggest attraction. Dubbed as the birthplace of scuba diving in the Philippines, its deep waters teem with marine life and an abundance of corals and reefs. For non-divers ‚Äì the shallow and low-current waters are great for snorkeling. Dive and Trek's house reef is a marine sanctuary frequented by several snorkelers.

Fun Fact:
Diving conditions in Anilao are ideal for divers of all experience levels. The water temperature is consistently warm, and the surface is typically calm and smooth throughout the year.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tanya Burnett / Donna Dimayuga
comments: best dive of my life.

message+desc:
TELL IT TO THE TILES
One of the ways that temples raise money is through these temple tiles. Donors purchase a temple tile and then write a message, prayer, or wish on the underside. Later, the tiles will be used to re-fit the roof. 

Gaesimsa Temple in Seosan, Chungcheongnam-do >>> http://bit.ly/12Zp9cS

Kawazu-zakura Matsuri, Cherry Blossom Festival have been held till Mar. 10 in Kawazu Onsen, Shizuoka Pref. Rich pink blossoms are distinctive of Kawazu-zakura which come into bloom in February. You can check the bloom of cherry blossom from following website!

[$200+ GIVEAWAY] Have A Night-In With Your BFFs Thanks To Deliveroo!

Deliveroo has long made it possible for you to have fish head curry, hot wings and pizza from various corners of the island on a single dining table. Now, they come with cutesy sleepover kits too!

From now till 16 December, Deliveroo is running a contest to give away 3 sets of their Nights In Kits along with Deliveroo credits. 1 lucky winner gets a kit and $100 worth of credits, and 2 others will get a kit and $50 worth of credits each.

All you have to do is:
1. Like and share THIS post.
2. Comment below who you want to have a night-in with.

Also, if it's the first time you're ordering with Deliveroo, key in TSLROO to get $10 off your first order. This will be valid till 27 Jan 2017. Good luck!

message+desc:
Where is it?
Bohol, Visayas.

What is it?
Tarsiers measure three to six inches in height, making them one of the smallest primates in the world. This also makes them difficult to spot!

Fun Fact:
The tarsier can turn its head 180 degrees in both directions.

Photo by Joey Rico

Mito plum tree festival will be held from February 20 to March 31 at Kairakuen, Mito city (Ibaraki).
Kairakuen was established in 1842 and known as one of the most famous parks of Japan. There will be about 100 different kinds of 3000 plum trees and you could enjoy various events during the festival.„ÄÄEnjoy pretty plum trees and early spring!!
 
Location details: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/gardens/kairakuen.html

message+desc:
A satirical article by Mustsharenews.com. Don't take it too seriously guys :)From murders to drugs to biting of taxi drivers, all sorts of crazy is coming from Yishun, a hood just a 40 min drive from Singapore. And it's making us worried.

It's time to make Singapore great again.

Disclaimer: This post is satire, don't take it seriously la :) If anything, we hope this post raises awareness for Yishun. This will pressure authorities to allocate  more resources that will discourage vice and improve the safety of residents.

Failing which, we can use our ERP contributions to build that wall. And then maybe the ERP will be good for something.

https://mustsharenews.com/wall-around-yishun/

I remembered one of you said this to me the other day....$$Lol don't like that leh!!! I'm moving to yishun in 2 years time.$$Marcus Wee Al Nissira Osman prepared to be walled up. Was nice knowing you hahahaha$$Damn, trips to Nee Soon Camp will get harder should this wall be built$$Lol Now MP Denise Phua will say we need a wall around yishun majulah$$Xueyong maybe you'd need a passport to enter SG from home$$The train to yishun will still stop at yishun....  how to skip ?$$We are Singapore's Vice City, deal with it hahaha!$$Too many Foreigners staying in Yishun.$$Maybe We need donald trump at yishun lol$$They have train to busan

message+desc:
What is your favorite fruit? 
Yamagata Prefecture is renowned for its delicious cherries, or ‚ÄúSakuranbo‚Äù. As it just so happens, now is the best time of year to head to a farm for cherry picking. The blossoming flowers are white, and the ripe cherries are a bright orange-red.
Visit Japan and try the sweet and delectable Japanese Sakuranbo cherries.
The taste is unforgettable!

Related Information:
http://japan-brand.jnto.go.jp/eng/foods/fruits/3238/ 
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1404_yamagata.html

message+desc:
What is it like? 
There are over 94 lakes in the Philippines. Resting in the craters of extinct volcanoes. Created by natural disasters like landslides or tectonic activity. Made by man as catch basins for dams. There are lakes for wakeboarding, swimming or going on romantic boat rides. 

Fun Fact: 
Laguna de Bay is the country‚Äôs largest lake. 

Photo by/Headline by: 
Raul Montifar/Rachel Teotico
comments: Its true that its more fun in the philippines.

message+desc:
Arunachal Pradesh - An enchanting mix of heritage and nature‚Äôs grace

The widely scattered archaeological remains at different places in Arunachal Pradesh bear testimony to its rich cultural heritage. A serene land tucked into the North Eastern tip of India, offers an enchanting experience, with its picturesque hills and valleys, wholesome climate and simple and hospitable people.

The state‚Äôs glorious heritage of arts and crafts and colourful festivals reflect the people‚Äôs ancient faith in the inexorable power of nature. In addition, the state provides abundant scope for angling, boating, rafting, trekking and hiking. Besides, there are a number of wild life sanctuaries and national parks where rare animals, birds and plants will fascinate the visitor.

Arunachal Pradesh is home to a variety of orchids, known for their exquisitely beautiful blooms, from one of the dominant taxa with more than 600 species, occurring in varying elevations and climatic conditions throughout the state. It is habited by 26 major tribes and a number of sub tribes. 

- See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/arunachal-pradesh

message+desc:
Summer Annual Event in Kyoto ~Hassaku~
Hassaku is an annual greeting event of Maiko and Geiko in Kyoto on August 1st in the morning. They visit their masters and faithful customers to give gratitude. You will be able to see them mainly around Gion, Pontocho, Kamishichiken, Miyagawacho districts on the day. It‚Äôs not too late to plan a trip to Kyoto yet! Have you ever seen Geiko and Maiko in beautiful Kimono?

About Maiko: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/hj/maiko.html 
Kyoto: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/scenic/sviewer/

Japan is beautyful!$$I will miss it, because I was there in May this year!

message+desc:
Where is it?
Loboc River, Bohol

What is it?
Cruise along the Loboc River aboard a floating restaurant, and while you take your pick from a buffet of Filipino cuisine, enjoy the music from a live band serenading you.

Fun Fact:
The bands welcome song requests from guests!

Photo by George Tapan
comments: Not only beautiful but you would like to stay and enjoy your stay which is worth going$$I was told that muslim terrorist are a threat in the forest area of mindanao, with kidnapings and robery.... how safe is this area of the phillippines?$$Bohol s a safe place,we went there w/ my family,its so nice...$$mindanao is far from bohol. its safe and alot of tourist and visitors come there for some fun, enjoyable and relaxing vacation. my favorite part is i get to enjoy nature in bohol. its very relaxing$$If you are going to do the river cruise, avoid the floating barges with awful singers,  I did not pay to hear awful singers I want to listen to the river and sounds of nature.  I suggest just hiring a private boat with the local guides they are way cheaper and you get a personalized tour of the river.

message+desc:
The long wait is finally over! For the first time, The Philippines is host to this year's World Street Food Congress! 

Feast on a wide range of street food from over 20 international hawker stalls participating in the World Street Food Jamboree located on 7th Avenue cor. 25th Street, BGC.

Running 'till Sunday, the World Street Food Jamboree opens to the public FOR FREE starting at 4pm tomorrow till 11pm! 

Tag your friends now and make sure not to miss this event! See you there! #wsfc16Taste the best of Asia's street food in this congress' third edition happening this week at Bonifacio Global City.
comments: Some of the best food I've ever had has been from street vendors.  Much, much more delicious than any 5 Star  restaurant$$Chef Marian, check this out!$$Christian can we come here my love?

message+desc:
Seongeup Folk Village is one of the must-sees in Jeju where it holds a vast amount of the local culture. Have a feel of being taken back in time as you explore the unique cultural properties such as the straight but curvy alleys to block the wind, stone grandfather statues (Dol Hareubang), and the especially famous jeju black-haired pigs! Don't forget to check this out when you are visiting Jeju! :D

For more info, click here ‚òû http://bit.ly/1HI151x

message+desc:
Where or what kind of restaurant would you like to have meals at when you visit Japan?
 
At an authentic sushi restaurant?
At a lively izakaya?
At a local okonomiyaki place?
 
All of them are good, but have you ever thought of going to nice cafes for meals?
Cafes in Japan are not only for coffee and sweets, but some of them often serve good home-cooked meals too!
 
It‚Äôs fun to stroll across towns and find your own favorite cafe. Do you have one in Japan?
These photos are taken in several cafes in Tokyo! :)
Photos by Masatoshi Ueno
 
Cafes in Tokyo:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/restaurant-search/eng/list.php?pref_code=13&distance=2000&rst_type%5B%5D=CTG500&f_menu=1&rate_min=&rate_max=&keyword=&btnSubmitMap.x=49&btnSubmitMap.y=11

It has awesome italian soda and a great relaxing atmosphere!$$I've eaten at a cafe before, and it was really nice. Though I believe that particular cafe doesn't exist anymore. But when in Japan I usually eat at family restaurants. ^_^$$Why Japanese food is so good! I miss it :(

message+desc: Try the original taste of Es Cendol and it will certainly get you addicted !

Sejong Center, which will be hosting <Sebasti√£o Salgado Genesis 2014>, is located close to Gyeongbokgung Palace.

Why not visit Gyeongbok Palace today?
As the first royal palace built in 1395, Gyeongbokgung Palace is considered the heart and center of the Joseon Dynasty.

<Sebasti√£o Salgado Genesis 2014> will be held until Jan. 15, 2015.

Get your tickets here: http://bit.ly/1vMwHDE
comments: I love this Palace! ~Natalie~$$Actually this palace is a reconstruction. In 1592 the Japanese destroyed it. It was rebuilt in 1867. A fire in 1876 destroyed some buildings which were rebuilt in 1888. Then, in 1915, the Japanese levelled all buildings and built their colonial administration building on the grounds. This building was not removed until 1996. The reconstruction of the complex was finally completed in 2010. Therefore the oldest buildings is no older than c.1990.$$Beautiful reconstruction of the original palace.  One of my favourite places to wander around while in Seoul.$$wow the first royal palace built in 1395

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Tubbataha Reef, Palawan

What is it like? 
Schooling is when a group of fish swim together in one direction. They do this to fend off predators by creating a "confusion effect," where it becomes harder for a predator to focus on one single prey. In Tubbataha, there are 11 species of sharks and 13 species of dolphins and whales that prey on smaller fish. 

Fun Fact: 
Shoaling is different from schooling. Shoaling is when a group of fish are grouped close together, but are swimming independently. Tubbataha has 600 species of fish that either school or shoal. 

Photo by/Author: 
Jayvee Fernandez/Jao Bautista
comments:
A World Heritage site. Tubbataha is a Samal words: Tubba and taha which together means " a long reef exposed at low tide".
The Cagayancillos call the Tubbataha,"Gusong".
The Shedd Aquarium of Chicago has a permanent exhibit of the reef.
Located in the middle of the a Sulu Sea, near Puerto Princesa City and Cagayancillo, Palawan.

message+desc:
As summer in the Philippines draws near, we are giving you more reasons to travel around the country, not just for the beautiful destinations, but for the people with whom tourism matters: the frontliners. The people whose lives and livelihood are now dependent on this growing industry in the Philippines called tourism.

Our first story is from @vin_aranas87 (on Instagram) who traveled in May 2015 to Itbayat, #Batanes, the northernmost inhabited island of the Philippines. There, he met their tour guide, Kuya Pepe.

"We met Kuya Pepe on our second day and discussed with him our plans of reaching the #RafangCliffs on the eastern side of #Itbayat. Getting to this place needs some great deal of advice from him as he was the only person allowed to pass through private properties leading to Rafang Cliffs.

"Although he was Marine Engineer by profession, Kuya Pepe chose to stay in the island to be with his family and make a living out of tour-guiding. He explained that being a tour guide has helped him with much of their expenses; he was able to send his kids to school until they finished their studies.

"But aside from the fulfillment he gives his family, he also finds personal joy whenever he sees people enjoying their visit to Itbayat."

Photo and Story: @vin_aranas87

Check out our Instagram @tourismphl to see more wonderful stories of our people.

#TourismStoriesPHL
#itsmorefuninthephilippines
#visitphilippinesagain2016

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Boracay Island, Aklan

What is it like?
With all the water activities it offers, Boracay is one action-packed island. But that doesn‚Äôt mean you can‚Äôt find your spot of tranquility. Visit Station 1 for quieter accommodations.

How to get there: 
Fly from Manila to Caticlan.

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan.

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan.

Fun Fact: 
The powdery white sand and the pristine waters aren‚Äôt the only things to enjoy in Boracay. There are also golf courses on offer.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Tourism Department of the Philippines/Brandon Dollente

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Olango Islands, Cebu

What is it? 
This island group is composed of the main Olango Island and its six satellite islets. The site is a wildlife sanctuary that serves as a pit stop for migratory birds that come from as far as China, Japan and Siberia.

How to get there: 
Fly into Cebu from Hongkong, Singapore, Narita, Incheon, or any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus to Cebu from either Dumaguete or Bacolod. Or take your car via a Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry.

Or take a boat to Cebu from Manila or any major city in Visayas and Mindanao.

Fun Fact: 
The seven islands of the Olango group are joined together by a continuous reef. This makes the site a nice diving spot as well.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Tourism Department Philippines / Jao Bautista

Where is the link or video?$$i was there...it's a great experience..$$Island hopping to Olango$$Kindly Like this Page :

message+desc:
Jensen comes across this gem of a Thai restaurant in Geylang that "transports" him back to Thailand!

"I remember vividly my Thai guide confided to me during a visit to the Tha Ka Floating Village in Samut Songkhram province...."Look at that the Pad Thai hawker, she controlled the fire with such skill, the perfect browning at the edge and slightly crisp egg envelope for the Pad Thai. Many Thais know how to cook a Pad Thai, but not many know how to get right..." 

But one thing I can attest is that my taste bud is sharp as a chef's knife. I am able to detect subtle hints of spices and ingredients. And at Spicy Thai - Thai Cafe recently, I was "transported' back to Thailand. But authenticity needs another important "ingredient", which I strongly feel is, passion."

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/authentic-thai-cuisine-in-the-heartlands

message+desc: Named as No. 7 among Best 10 Destinations Asia by Lonely Planet, Pemuteran Beach in Bali‚Äôs northwest corner is a perfect place for you to get real close to nature, unwind and let all your troubles slip away as you step across  its gleaming black volcanic sandy beaches complemented with sheltering coconut and palm trees and backed by beautiful sceneries of green hills. Pemuteran is unique since no other part of Bali has such large areas of shallow reefs perfect for diving and snorkeling.  Its most fascinating feature is an enchanted underwater temple, seemingly ancient,  planted  here to regrow new corals. The project is community-based conservation for protecting and maintaining reefs and transplanting corals.  It is now rich in colorful corals and home to groups of clownfish and parrotfish. This underwater temple wonderfully combines nature‚Äôs beauty with amazing work of art.  http://indonesia.travel/en/post/pemuteran-bali-among-top-10-best-destinations-asia #WonderfulIndonesia

message+desc:
Where is it?
Taoist Temple, Cebu City

How to Get There: 
Fly into Cebu from Hongkong, Singapore, Narita, Incheon, or any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus to Cebu from either Dumaguete or Bacolod. Or take your car via a Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry.

What is it?
The Cebu Taoist Temple was built in 1972 by the Chinese community. Both worshipers and non-worshipers are welcome to visit and see the colorful statues and structures.

Fun Fact:
While the rituals held in the temple are for devotees only, you can drop some coins at the wishing well for good fortune. 

Photo by / Headline by:
George Tapan / Brandon Dollente

message+desc:
Where is it?
Boracay, Aklan

What is it?
If you ever get tired of lounging by the powdery white sand beach of Boracay -- which is unlikely, really -- you can try sailing in a wooden bangka (boat). Catch the breeze, enjoy the view of the island paradise and even the famous Boracay sunset that turns the sky orange, violet and pink!

Fun Fact:
Boatmen will give you some bread before your sailing trip, so you can throw them into the sea and watch little fish feast on them.

Photo by the Tourism Department of the Philippines
comments: This is the next adventure on my next vacation. . Boracay Philippines. .hehe$$Philippines.....the best....no other....$$My dream home, the PHILIPPINES".$$really? feeding the fish is wrong?!

Gunung Patuha pernah meletus pada abad ke-10, kemudian bagian kawahnya perlahan berubah menjadi sebuah kawah belerang berwarna putih, yang kemudian dikenal sebagai Kawah Putih. http://ow.ly/SPdbW

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Cultural Center of the Philippines, Manila

What is it like? 
The Cultural Center of the Philippines (CCP) is the premiere showcase of the arts in the country. Founded in 1969 under the Marcos regime, it still continues to hold the most celebrated and award-winning plays from around the world. At night, it's therapeutic to watch the fountain lightshow ‚Äî a colorful oasis by the side of the main road, in the middle of a busy metro.

Fun Fact: 
In the main lobby of the National Theater, you'll notice three large Capiz-shell chandeliers hanging from the third-floor ceiling. They symbolize the three main geographical divisions of the Philippines ‚Äî Luzon, Visayas and Mindanao.

Photo by/Author: 
George Tapan/Donna Dimayuga
comments: Been here. This is where  the venue of Miss Universe 1974 coronation and Miss Spain was crowned.$$Missing the our rehearsals at the CCP Lobby :)$$Leonard Lee...the venue of the 1974 Ms Universe was held @ The FAT..Folk Arts Theater not @ The CCP...üòâ $$Michaella Pugh Please refrain from posting ads here if you wish to avoid being banned. Thank you.$$The only legacies that Emilda Marcos leave to us pilipinos .. and the longest bridge..:)$$I can't wait till I go back to the Philippines$$I have seen the cultural center only once$$One of the strongest structure or infrastructure ever built since 1970's.......$$I love that Landmark and its history. Passing by everyday.$$Please please ReFurbish Metropolitan Theater too....we miss the shows for the school children...$$i've watched swan lake (ballet) & ang kiri (musical) when i was still a child here at CCP.$$thank u First Lady Imelda Marcos for this ,
