In Japan, May 4th is a national holiday called ‚Äò‚ÄòGreenery Day‚Äô‚Äô (Midori no Hi). It is a day set aside for everyone to go out and enjoy nature.
Today‚Äôs photos are Kamikochi in Nagano Prefecture, Kegon Waterfall in Tochigi Prefecture, and Yotsuya Senmaida in Aichi Prefecture.

How about enjoying nature in Japan?

Tomonoura is a port town, situated at a bay facing the Seto Inland Sea, wonderful location to walking around.
You may find a lot of photogenic alleys lined by rustic old houses with wooden facades.

‚ÄúIkebana,‚Äù or also called ‚ÄúKado‚Äù is the Japanese flower arrangement. 
The history of ‚ÄúIkebana‚Äù dates back approximately 500 years and it is said that there are more than 300 schools at the present.
As you know the beauty of the flower never turn into any era, we must appreciate grace of nature. 
If you would like to learn while you are in Tokyo, please refer to http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/pdf/regional/tokyo/flower_arrangement.pdf
For your memorable experience, there are also ‚ÄúIkebana‚Äù classes available at the various cities in Japan, please check it at the local information centers. http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/category/index.html?cat=tic

message+desc:
Courtrallam is as small, charming town situated at an elevation of about 167 m on the Western Ghats in Tirunelveli district. 

The waterfalls for which Courtrallam is famous, are formed by a sharp three stage drop of about 91 m (300 ft) by the Chittar river. Several other seasonal and a few perennial rivers such as the Manimuthar River, the Pachaiyar River and the Tambaraparani River originate in this region. 

A large number of tourists come here mainly to bath in the falls which are believed to have medicinal properties which has earned Courtrallam the title of the Spa of the South. 

- See more at: http://incredibleindia.org/index.php/travel/destination/courtrallam/

message+desc:
We experienced 3.5 million volts of electricity and watched Singapore's ONLY fire tornado show FOR FREE at the Science Centre! You can also get up close and personal with butterflies or even be blown away by the typhoon simulator!

We checked out the following:
1. Tesla Coil Show
2. Fire Tornado Show
3. Butterfly Up Close
4. Climate Machine
5. Typhoon Simulation 

Address: 15 Science Centre Rd, Singapore 609081
Opening hours: 10am to 6pm daily

Admission to the Science Centre is completely free for Singaporeans and PRs during off-peak hours, but some of the special exhibits have a charge. 

Director: Pepita Wauran I Models: Pepita Wauran and Russ Tan

message+desc:
Relative Of Deceased In Track Accident Pens Heart-Wrenching Open Letter To SMRT

"Yet you ever-so eloquently say that you are ‚Äúvery saddened by the loss.‚Äù But to you, the two young lives lost today are just a statistic; A number that you have to account for in the face of public outrage. Just collateral damage. Soon, you will forget. Your career goes on. Your life goes on.

To us they were beloved sons, brothers, cousins, nephews, friends. Brilliant human beings who had promising futures ahead of them."

http://mustsharenews.com/smrt-open-letter/He questioned how SMRT could possibly share their grief over the loss of a loved one, and hopes they'll take responsibility for the incident.
comments: The writer is so right... I totally agree. Its really sad these 2 young men lost their lives only within such a short time of joining the company. 'Dear colleagues' - c'mon, how fake does that sound? I bet you didn't even know them until the accident. You'll probably shift the blame to anyone, or maybe even the train for moving when its not supposed to be in operation?$$There is NO COMPROMISE When Dealing With Safety. Take Responsibility SMRT....Own Up...

message+desc:
Today, let‚Äôs introduce the Chirihama Nagisa Driveway.
It takes 20 min. walk from JR Hakui Sta. in Ishikawa Prefecture, and this is only one place in Japan where cars can be driven on the edge of the surf almost 8 km long.
There are some sightseeing buses available between Kanazawa and Wajima including to visit this unique Driveway.
Driving on the beach! Yes, even all over the world, this experience is so unique and rare!

Related Information;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/natuscen/chirihama-beach.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/rtg/pdf/pg-403.pdf
http://japan-driving.jnto.go.jp/en/guide
comments:
wonderful :) This is exactly where I was driving on my recent May trip when I took a few days in Kanazawa with Aya & Reina :) I drove all along the beach and stopped to enjoy freshly cooked right in front of us mussels and seafood in a rickity old shed by lovely obachan while parked on the beach. You dont need a 4wd either..I had a little Toyota somethingorother front wheel drive and it was nooooo probem. great experience and wonderful day out.     The Chirahasa/Nagisa Freeway has great views and a pleasure to drive on..I loved it...but one thing...speed in Japan is not what's posted on the signs...the freeway was supposed to be 80kmh..but everyone goes min 100 and most 120 ...same for 50kmh zones everywhere else in Japan...50 is the "recommended speed" the real speed is 80 :) just sayin ..$$went there when I was younger.....my relatives live in Kanazawa.$$A cool place to drive. Apart from the usual English classics like Fish & Chips and Steak & Ale Pie, they also serve unique offerings like Toad In The Hole - a traditional British delicacy you can't find elsewhere in Singapore. What more, DBS/POSB cardholders also get a 1 for 1 draft beer promotion during weekdays as well as a free dessert if they spend over $50!
 
Monkswood
Address: 393 Guillemard Road Singapore 399790

Opening Hours: 5pm - 11pm (Tues ‚Äì Fri)
11am - 3.30pm, 6pm - 11pm (Sat ‚Äì Sun)
 
Director: Sean Foo I Model: Xenia Tan

message+desc:
Munnar - There is nowhere else quite like Munnar, and that is why so many travellers have a holiday in Munnar as top of their wish lists while travelleing to Kerala. Located at an altitude of 1600m, at the confluence of the Muthirappuzha, Chadavurai,   and  Kundaly rivers, it was once the summer resort of the British. 
Munnar  holds great appeal for those with an appreciative eye for exquisite beauty - from unending expanse of tea plantations to pristine valleys and the verdant mountains of the Western Ghats; and from national parks and sanctuaries teeming with wildlife, to the beautiful lakes.

 - See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/munnar
comments: beautiful place to visit and explore ...

message+desc:
Where is it?
Magellan's Cross, Cebu 

How to Get There:
Fly into Cebu from Hongkong, Singapore, Narita, Incheon, or any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus to Cebu from either Dumaguete or Bacolod. 

Or take your car via a Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry.

Or take a boat to Cebu from Manila or any major city in Visayas and Mindanao.

What is it?
Magellan's Cross commemorates Portuguese explorer Ferdinand Magellan's first contact with the people of Cebu on April 7, 1521. 

Fun Fact:
The original cross is actually encased within the planted wooden cross you see today, as a precaution against locals who chipped off small pieces for their rumoured healing properties.

Photo by / Headline by:
Jaime Singlador / Magnus Ahmad
comments: Ive been there. And I feel great.$$No, I beg to disagree, Cebuanos are one of the most honest Filipinos I know.$$try to visit here guyzzzzz,,,,,,:-)

two, when i am the loner at the party i no longer have to stare around awkwardly, i can whip out my phone and pretend i have a life and so many people are messaging me oh gosh.

Technology make my life more flexible and convenient when I am hungry and need for food I can simply call for delivery without even stepping out of my house! I can contact my friends with Watapp on mobile phone and stay in touch with friends through Facebook and messenger! No more letter writing which take time to reach my friends save on paper and effortlessly to stay in touch! Tagging Jennifer Ong Boon Chye$$I love how technology allows and helps me in communicating with people on the other side of the world. I would look forward to every night as i would be able to video call my mom as she moved to Thailand. We would talk about everything and anything HAHAHA it almost felt like we were side by side and things were the same like when i was a little kid. I am kind of an awkward potato andddddd im an introvert. I used to bury my head in books and not socialize with people of my age but playing online games has helped me out tremendously as it made me feel comfortable talking to strangers and connect with people from other parts of the world. From chatting behind a computer screen and slowly to video chatting with my best friend from maplestory. She has helped me to become a more social person and made me feel comfortable in my skin because I was made fun of alot in school and was an outcast. But, she was there for me and I would always look forward to going home and pouring my emotions out to her. She was a good listener. She taught me to create a blog and let me share about my life experiences. I'm so glad technology was invented and really glad that i have met my first true friend :)$$Technology has made life so much more flexible in so many ways. Communication is one of the aspects that have become much more convenient. Previously, once the date and time have been fixed, it is hard to change it at the very last minute. With smartphones, we can now create group chats and update everyone on the date and time to meet with a simple message. Also, it has allowed many cross-border exchanges, be it travelling or business deals, and strangers, friends and even families are able to connect despite being in different countries.

Liked and shared the post! :)$$I remember when we used to enter contests by tearing out pages from magazines/newspapers and mailing them by postage to the company's office, and we receive our prize through mailing too! Now with technology, we just need to "like and share" and most of the prizes are e-vouchers which is convenient! :)$$Press a button, money transfer over. Press another button food flies over. So shiok! We are very fortunate to be living in this era, everything got shortcuts now. Heng ah! I'm sure in the years ahead, we will see revolutionary changes in the way we lead our lives. Look forward to more exciting developments in the next generation of technological advancements. Hope I can still keep up with it in my 60s, 70s... :) Our lives will be more intertwined with technology!$$Technology has made my life easier and more convenient. From online banking to online shopping to ordering your taxi from your smart device. All it takes is a push of a button and sometimes you may not even have to own a credit card to enjoy having everything sent to your doorstep. Yes, some shops accepts COD! :-) But what I love most about these modern conveniences is that I get to spend more time with my kids and husband. The time supposed to be spent in walking to Sheng Siong and hauling 30 kilos of grocery with 2 howling kids in tow is now better spent playing catch in the park or watching movies at home with my feet propped up. Other than that, I am on extended maternity leave because I can work from home and submit my reports online. How cool is that? Perhaps I will order that chicken rice from that flying boat after all. Kristina OngDee Kaytee Polyndevilla Vic Peng$$Technology has definitely made life more flexible by allowing me to order fast food like MacDonald's, Pizza Hut, KFC etc with the click of my hand. It totally helps when I stranded at home with 2 little ones. 

Liked n shared!$$As Singaporeans, we love our food as much as we love our choices. With the advancements in technology, not only has our food become more delicious, dining has become more fun as well.

For instance, many would agree that having sushi off the conveyor belt not only allows us to dine at our own pace, the myriad of choices is also part of the fun. 

Having Korean BBQ wouldn't be as fun if the meat came to your table properly grilled as opposed to cooking it to your desired doneness, thanks to technology that makes it possible for diners to grill the meat and eat it right after.

And what about designing your own fluffy pancakes from bottles of pre-coloured pancake batter? 

All these dining experiences would not have been possible if technology did not exist - no longer do we need to prepare food beforehand before sitting down to a meal with friends or family - with technology, even the cooking can be an activity that bonds people.

We cannot deny that the future of food is closely linked with the advancement in technology. After all, one day we may be able to have our meals in a self-driving vehicle while taking in the beautiful scenery - life does not get more flexible than that. ;)$$Technology made our lives easier by allowing us to read almost everything and anywhere via our smartphones, so now I can just read stories and articles (esp thesmartlocal articlea :P) on the go!

Love it. i also take pictures of her every now and then.$$When i was in san miguel island,every morning i wake up im looking in mayon volcano it have a perfect view meanwhile the sun rising..i miss that time..see u soon mayon volcano!$$I was vacationing with my cousins in Cagraray Island, Bacacay, Albay when Mt Mayon erupted in April 1968. The "fireworks display" was magnificent & fantastic as seen from the view deck of the Tabaco Public Market.

message+desc:
10 Creepiest Tekong Stories To Keep Recruits Up All Night

A compilation of scariest Tekong ghost stories since your grandfather's time. Recruits, try finding #2 when you're at Tekong.

http://thesmartlocal.com/read/tekong-ghost-storiesA compilation of scariest Tekong ghost stories since your grandfather's time. Recruits, try finding #2 when you're at Tekong.
comments: "It wasn't long before the higher-ups in BMT finally engaged a Taoist priest to perform some rituals to get rid of the spirit. The priest suggested adding a third door to the existing two, in order to make the spirit leave. The third door was constructed and padlocked, preventing the spirit from escaping." so keep or exit?$$this pic looks like the bunk i used to stay in Nee Soon Camp during my BMT in the mid 90s but abit newer....$$That's a nice cover photo! You know why? It was my bunk, eight years back! And I'm also the unit's photographer! And it's also my photo!  And you know what isn't there that is also ghostly invisible yet glaringly obvious? My credit! :D$$Legendary ghost story of tekong is 3 door bunk, missing recruit at route march, jacob ladder. These 3 e most famous.
